description:
Delishhhhh. From start to finish. Came with a big group and no reservation at around 8 PM on a Wednesday evening and were seated within minutes despite the relatively small space. We got bruschetta, a cheese pizza, and grilled veggies for apps. 

For dinner, a lot of us got the gnocchi but we also had linguine and pappardelle as well. Everything tasted amazing and flavorful without too much of a wait. The service was on point and we loved the vibe. Would def return next time I'm in SF!
author: Nika B.

description:
We narrowed down our search to Pazzia because we were looking for a place that could accommodate a group and was family friendly (as noted on their Yelp page). Trying to find this in downtown SF can be a challenge. Though Pazzia can be good for groups, its a smaller sized restaurant so I recommend to call ahead for reservations. 

And now let's get to the food! Some of the pasta is made in-house. The lasagna was piping hot. While I thought I'd have enough to take home, I ended up polishing it all off. The béchamel sauce was so tasty I'm so glad I got my own and didn't share. 

I had a bite of the homemade gnocchi which was delicious and the pizza was great for sharing. Washing down the food a nice pour of very vino made for a satisfying meal. 

I will definitely be back the next time I get a craving for lasagna!
author: Nova P.

description:
We came here wanting pasta because I was in the middle of marathon training and will never say no to pasta. Late on a Saturday night, this very authentic Italian place (the owner is awesome), was pretty packed. We snagged a table for two and ordered a bottle of wine to go along with our pasta.

Location: Pretty convenient for us since we were coming from the border of SOMA and Mission Bay.

Ambiance: Super cute and romantic in the evenings.

Drinks: They have a pretty good wine list and we thoroughly enjoyed our bottle.

Food: I ordered the Housemade Tagllerini with salmon, pancetta, kalamata, and a light white wine sauce and devoured all of it. Fresh pasta and seafood? Win, win.

Would I return? Most definitely. It's a good Italian option to have around that's within walking distance!
author: Leana L.

description:
This is our second time in San Francisco, and we wouldn't go anywhere else for pizza except Pazzia. Very nice ambiance, cute place. The owner and the staff are always very helpful. Our waitress Svetlana was very pleasant, attentive and kind. 
Definitely would recommend this place. Next time we come to the town, we'll visit you again.
author: Dina M.

description:
As an Italian son of a Chef, my standards for Italian restaurants are naturally pretty high. It is not easy to find good authentic Italian food in the states, but luckily, in San Francisco we have Pazzia!

Bread and Olive Oil (4.5/5): What can I say about this AMAZING bread? I could go to Pazzia, eat just the bread, leave and I would still feel satisfied!

Tagliere di Salumi (2/5): For the many times I have been to Pazzia, I can say that this is probably their biggest miss. In Italian restaurants, we like to start with a big plate of salumi. Those few stripes of speak (a kind of salumi that you should not see in a tagliere) and two micropieces of prosciutto make this a sad plate.

Guazzetto (4.5/5): This is FANTASTIC. The taste of the sauce is so balanced with the taste of the mussels and the spiciness is just at the right level, really a must order.

Lasagna (4/5): The serving of this lasagna is beautiful, and the taste of the meat is so authentic. Can't go wrong with this, I think anybody that can eat meat would like it.

Overall Rating (4/5):
Pazzia easily gets a solid four stars, and it is surely one of the places I always like to go. If they improve their salumi plate, they could really step up their game.
author: Manuel T.

description:
So I came here several times. I think its a great place to go for dinner on a date or with a small group of friends. I do not think its a great place to have lunch at, the reason being its tooo crowded and the service is soooooo slow and the food feels rushed! I came here with a group of coworkers (party of 10) We got seated immediately without a reservations, score! *fist pump*. Things were going well until the lunch rush arrived. It took forever for our servers to come take our order or even serve bread for our table (which we didn't get refills on). food took forever to come out, and some parts of my pasta was clumped together and wasn't even cooked thoroughly. Aside from my opinion (I have higher food expectations) all my coworkers seem to have really enjoyed their meals.

I'm giving a 4 star review b/c I have also dined here for dinner and it was perfect! there weren't a lot of people around we got quick service and the food was delicious! I would definitely dine here again just not for lunch.
author: Nina Y.

description: Went here for a team lunch and it didn't disappoint! We ordered pizza, pasta, diff appetizers. Got full easily but can't stop eating and trying everything the servers handed to us. The restaurant is very small but you'll really feel that it's a legit Italian restaurant.
author: Krista D.

description: Legit are here for the first time a few days ago . Had lunch with a friend and was so impressed I brought my team back for dinner that same night! Owner greeted us warmly both times and the food was amazing . Hey are opened limited hours but definitely find the time to eat here
author: Jason P.

description:
Really enjoy coming here for lunch. If it's not too chilly, sitting outside is great. The service is very friendly, and the atmosphere is always nice, as it's quite a small restaurant. 
The food is well above average for Italian food in San Francisco. I have to say that I haven't found too many Italian places that I like, so this is the exception. I've had most things on the menu, but the ragu pasta is one of my favorites. The salmon entree is really nice too, and the pizzas are always good to share. Lots of nice wine by the glass and bottle. The servers tend to be Italian which makes it feel quite authentic. Ask for a limoncello when you're done!
author: Derek M.

description: Amazing food and service. The homemade pasta and seafood are so good. Service is phenomenal and the staff are so attentive. Food would not disappoint and place is so clean.
author: Cherry M.

description: Amazing food, excellent service. The ambiance was very casual and the entire experience was delightful.
author: Yani D.

description: This is the first time I got a take out pizza (also my first time ever at this place) and by the time I carefully carried it home this is what I saw in the box...but I would appreciate some explanation to HOW can a pizza be made that everything just slid from the crust. Just bad. And $20 for that?
author: Maria G.

description:
I called to make a reservation the day of and was able to secure a 3 person reservation for 730pm. Restaurant is fairly hidden and unassuming and I'm surprised I never tried this place despite living above it for 1.5 years. 

We were seated fairly quickly, but it was extremely loud and cramped inside. They really need to add some sound proofing on the ceilings or walls, otherwise it feels like I'm in a crowded bar shouting to be heard. 

The lasagna is different than your typical multi layer lasagna. It's in an oval dish and actually not as thick as normal lasagna. There are only 2 layers at most and the cheese is much more liquid and not too hardened. The pasta tasted very fresh and soft, so that was a huge plus for handmade. 

Overall, I liked the food, but the echoing is deafening and too much for me. I'd suggest coming at a less busy time to get the tasty food without the crowds.
author: Edward W.

description:
And I need this place where I live. And every other place I visit.

Truly a gem among gems. Small, intimate storefront with both indoor and a few outdoor tables. Serving real homemade Italian food.  And
you walk in and you are instant family. Everyone is talking with everyone else, celebrated a few birthdays, and made an instant friend with the owner

Two for dinner. Carpaccio to start - perfectly sliced meat, a little cheese and capers for flavor. Pizza Margherita for my guest, Gnocchi for me (full disclosure - I am a sucker for anything gnocchi). Served fresh, hot and just the right serving size. No dessert, just a couple of iced cappucinnos. Yum!

Very close to Moscone Center, SFMOMA and Union Square.  Make sure you find this place. And welcome to the family.
author: Herb V.

description: Great find!  Our concierge at The W recommended this place and we weren't disappointed. Kids had pizza that was delicious and I had the ravioli. Their pasta is homemade in house which is always a huge thing to me. Their wine list was extensive and we had a great Barolo.  For dessert we had the tiramisu. This place has a sister restaurant in Florence if that tells you anything. Our server was awesome and came from Florence. Would definitely try again and again!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Oh man, Pazzia is hands down, the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The owner, Massimo was so nice and welcoming! My family and I just arrived in San Francisco and after a long drive, we were ready to eat a good meal. It was our first time at Pazzia and didn't make any reservations, but thanks to Massimo, he found us a really good seat and we were able to enjoy this amazing restaurant!
The food here is unreal. Their pasta is homemade, real authentic, Italian food. The flavors come to life...with every bite of each dish, your tastebuds will be doing the happy dance all night long!! 

FAVORITES: 
My favorite dish is their LASAGNA. It comes fresh out of the oven, with ooey gooey cheese dripping down the plate. Every bite is bursting with flavor. You can taste the besciamella sauce mixed with their robust meat sauce. My sister tried the PAPPARDELLE which was delicious as well. The bolognese meat sauce was very tasty. We also tried their off the menu dish, highly reccomended, SPAGHETTI alle VONGOLE. The clams were delicious, and the pasta was nice and al dente. My nephew got their MARGHERITA PIZZA and it was great. We went back later that week just to order their pizza to go! 

We got to take a picture with Massimo and his staff and also got some complimentary lemoncello shots!! This restaurant not only serves up amazing food, but has good vibes because of Massimo and his staff.
author: Ruby V.

description: Excellent Italian. Pazzia salad is simple and perfect. The pastas and pizzas are very good - classic Italian.
author: Dom P.

description: The crust on Diavolo pizza was ok, but it was pretty bland.  No seasoning.  Caprese salad were three pieces of tomato with mozzarella and it was $11.  I also had to ask for balsamic vinegar since it did not have any.
author: Pasha G.

description: Very small space so for large parties advance reservations is a must. Friendly and fast service !! The food is delicious at reasonable prices. The best spaghetti pasta puttanesca ever!!!!!!!!!!
author: Cecile C.

description: Went here for lunch with a friend. The servers/waiters were all very nice and fun to talk to, and the set up of the restaurant also has a nice ambience. We ordered the bruschetta and Gorgonzola pizza to share, and also ate some of the complimentary bread. I probably wouldn't order the bruschetta again just because the bread was enough, but the Gorgonzola pizza was delicious! It was my first time trying Gorgonzola and my friend warned me it was a strong taste (kind of like blue cheese) but I really enjoyed it. It was a simple thin pizza, but the cheese gave it a nice twist. Overall a nice lunch place and I would come back to try some of their homemade pastas!
author: Hannah K.

description: Great service.  The spicy sausage pizza was tremendous.   Very friendly staff.  Great location
author: Jared H.

description:
This place is NOISY. Not to mention cramped. I literally sat less than two feet from my date but we had to yell at each other all night just to be heard. Knocking off a star for that kind of atmosphere (if you like loosing your voice and being halfway deaf by the end of the night, be my guest).

Service here is also mediocre (if not poor). My date and I stood by the door for 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. When we finally did get seated, it took almost 20 minutes before our waitress came to take our order. And don't even get me started about how long our food actually took to arrive. I wasn't particularly hungry when I came here, but I sure got hangry halfway through. 

Food wise, it's just so-so. Unlike other Italian restaurants I've been to, portions aren't ridiculously sized, so order enough to be full. I got the taglierini, which consists of spinach pasta and salmon, and it was pretty good. Salmon was cooked well and the pasta was on the lighter side since it wasn't heavily drenched in sauce. Nothing spectacular about my dinner stood out to me though. I was just barely full from my dish. 

In my honest opinion, I probably won't come back. My date and I couldn't wait to leave, just so our ear drums would stop ringing.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
What happened??? Came in last week for lunch and felt totally ignored!!!! We were the first table in the place and had the ask for EVERYTHING! The only thing they brought without us asking was the water and then it went downhill.

We had to waive them down for drink order. We had to waive them down to order food. Once we did get the owner over to order food he was telling us about specials and then said "oops we dont have them". Uhm ok.

Had to ask for table bread.

Food arrives. Tastes good which was the saving grace. My friend had the taglierinni which is always good (salmon pasta) but my gnocchi's were just ok. The cheese in it was not melted and it could have had a few more minutes under a broiler.  

Wouldn't be so harsh but considering the place is TINY and the freaking owner was socializing at a table the whole time- gonna have to say its gone down hill. 

We got in at 11:45 so way before lunch rush, too. 

Sad.
author: Erica D.

description: This is one of my old favorites. I was in the neighborhood and felt like some hardy good Italian food. It's always so cozy and familiar in her. The staff is super attentive and the atmosphere pretty hip, i love the music . I had the spinach pasta with grilled salmon and olives and it was the perfect mix of creamy and salty. The bruschetta is arguably the best I've ever tasted, and I've been to Italy. The tomatoes were super fresh and on point. I asked the waitress to pair my meal with a nice glass of wine and she let me sample one of her favorites, it was perfect. I always leave here feeling like I've  just been to someone's home. This place is really great.
author: Ana M.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant when yelping for a great pasta place near downtown. Called ahead on Saturday night to make sure there wasn't too long of a wait and they let us know that there would be no wait if we could get there within 20 minutes. We hurried over and they seated us right away. They had amazing selection of pastas that they made fresh in the restaurant and we decided on the Bolognese and Fettuccine Alfredo and even made slight alterations on the sauce with no problem! The food was so good, portion sizes perfect and service was amazing. The only complaint I would have is that the seats and tables are very close to one another but it looked like they were expanding soon!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Cute interior design, we were welcomed by the team and they worked really well together in a timely manner. I ordered the mussels as an appetiser and they were delicious! These mussels were drenched in their tomato sauce and was so juicy. I ordered the spinach pasta with salmon but unfortunately they ran out of spinach pasta so I had to settle for fettuccine. I also had the cotto E funghi pizza which was beautiful! The flavour was there and the cheese stretched out across the table as I tried to get a slice for myself 
Props to the waiters as they clean and set the tablets like magicians!
author: Shan N.

description:
Want a little bit of Firenze, Italy right here in SF?  This is the place. The food, the staff (from Florence), the ambiance, and the music!!  It's all here.  

Really loved the fact that there were several table of Italian tourists enjoying "native-but-local" fiord. And of cites the Limoncello at the end of my meal was "perfecto"!
author: Ray S.

description:
I can't explain how much it's great here!!
Amazing food
Fresh, delicious and make you want more and more
I will come back here for sure!!

Excellent place for Italian food!!!
author: Michelle M.

description: Excellent spot, kind people, nice and warm inside, and the food was incredible. I had the salad with pine nuts and ate it individually leaf-by-leaf, and the salmon dish was one of the best meals I've had at a restaurant. Highly recommend this spot!
author: Meralyn W.

description:
I have been living in the city for about a year now and Pazzia is the best authentic Italian restaurant in the city. Massimo(the owner), and the rest of the staff treat you like family in their small but homey restaurant on 3rd street. The pasta is made in house which shows and the level of food quality is out of this world. The portions are perfect, and the menu selection will have something for just about any Italian food lover.

10/10
author: Vladimir G.

description:
Went on a dinner date here on a Saturday night because I was craving Italian and we had heard great things about their pizza! We called about 30 minutes ahead of time, and they insisted that there would probably be no wait for a party of 2. When we got there, it was nearly full, but they were super accommodating and managed to grab us a table right away.

First impression: This place hit all the right notes for me. The ambiance was intimate, comfortable, and classy--the decor boasted romantic (read: dim) lighting, warm toned furniture, and an open kitchen. We were served some delicious bread as soon as we were seated, and I'm not proud to admit that we consumed two basketfuls of bread. (+1 for the bread because it was that good LOL)

What We Ordered:

1) Caprese Salad (4/5): To be honest, I'm not the biggest fan of tomatoes (in fact, you could almost say I hate them) but the flavors of the mozzarella and basil balanced out the tomatoes so well that I didn't even mind! Great appetizer, and a good light start to a probably heavier rest of the meal. 

2) Mushroom & Sausage Pizza (4/5): This definitely satisfied my cravings for pizza! It was huuuge we were only able to finish half and we took the rest home. It was a little bit too cheesy, so the pizza itself felt very oily and wet but honestly it still tasted pretty amazing. 

3) Gnocchi (5/5): Tasted like literal pillows in my mouth. Sauce was on point, the actual gnocchi was amazing, could not ask for more!

4) Tiramisu (5/5): My second stomach for dessert prompted us to order the tiramisu, and I definitely did not regret it. It was delightful! It melted in my mouth so easily, and it wasn't too sweet which is a problem I usually have with Tiramisu. Coffee lovers, definitely try this one!

Service: Our waiter was polite and attentive, always checking up on us and kindly not judging how much bread I ate. 

Overall, definitely coming back here! This surprisingly was one of the best restaurants I've tried in SF, and would 100% recommend to anybody looking for a great Italian place :)
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Not very Large restaurant, but the food is excellent.
The bread taste home made and fresh.
Close to Moscone Convention Center just a short walk away. Went there for lunch quality and service is excellent.
Loved the fettuccine must be a home made sauce.
Not acidic at all just has that Italian home made flavor. Made with zucchini and large shrimp.
That's the reason they give you the knife...
LoL.
Noticed their pizza come out fast but if you order a baked dish it takes a little longer.
Did I mention Dessert. Their home made Tiramisu as they say " To die for !" ( very Good )
author: Juan P.

description:
This is where work colleagues and I go for Italian lunch. Granted there aren't many Italian spots in NOSOMA besides delis but this spot is good.

The lasagna is great every time, layered not too thick and looked more like a casserole than the traditional rectangle-shaped deep pan. The sauce is rich and oily - borderline decadent towards the end - but I can always finish. The pappardelle, spaghetti Bolognese, and linguine seafood are good as well. Cannot really go wrong with any of those al dente items. Lunch total prices range from $12 - $30 depending on what else you may order.

Service is friendly every time, and ladies, they're not as overbearing as the North Beach restaurants servers, haha.
author: Peter L.

description:
Wonderful pizza served by pleasant good looking staff and owners. In a tiny space this establishment cranked out a wonderful fresh pasta dish (ravioli tonight) and a sausage pizza that reminded me of pizza I had in Rome. 
Did I mention wonderful yet?
I will definitely come back again and explore more dishes.
So far first impressions are really positive on all counts.
Dining experience
FOOD
Service
Cleanliness
Fair price
Offering of wine and beer
(I had a glass of house red wine, and it was very nice!)
See the photos of the ravioli and pizza I posted.
JYW recommends!
author: Jeff W.

description:
The food is a 3 to 4. Service is a 1... If that. We spent the majority of our time waiting for one thing or another. Twenty minutes alone for waters and our appetizer order to be taken. The pacing for the rest of the meal sadly followed suit. 

Our group of 5 ordered 2 appetizers and a main per person. Burrata was watery, spinach pasta - a bit oily, chicken - disappointingly dry. The calzone, however, was light and fluffy and filled with deliciously melty cheese. Definitely the highlight of the meal. The bruschetta appetizer was also solid: perfectly crisped baguette edges, tomatoes popping with juicy summer sunshine.

Pushed down to a 2 because they don't supply space heaters outside. At 6pm that wasn't so bad, but at quarter after 8, while waiting on the bill, the temperature had dropped so much that I was shivering in my coat, 3 layers, and boots. 

Update: Just watched another couple leave due to lack of service while we continue to wait for our bill to come back so we can sign and leave. Feeling extra comfortable with the two star rating right now.
author: Sonya I.

description:
Super cozy atmosphere, smaller location that is run exceptionally well. Tables are close together and the food is very good and authentic. Pizza was very filling, normally can finish a pizza, but could not this time. Tiramisu and Panna Cotta top notch as well. 

Due to smaller size try and call ahead for a reservation, or be prepared to wait. Outside tables are available if you are interested and don't need inside. Very good option for an Italian dinner. Enjoyed ourselves very much.
author: Lucas O.

description: This is probably mi favorite Italian restaurant in Soma! The waiters and waitress are amazing, the owner of the restaurant is always present and the food is absolutely amazing!
author: Alfredo C.

description:
Pazzia is the best! After just recently moving back to the Bay, I started craving Italian food and Pazzia in particular - and after a seven year hiatus - it was just as good (if not better!) than I remembered! Woo hoo!

My all time favorite lasagna spot (Macelleria in NYC) closed a while ago and I had yet to find a suitable replacement. Enter Pazzia. I remember the visits in my earlier days when a coworker would only ever get the lasagna and never share! I knew this needed to be given a chance as the new de facto lasagna.

Lo and behold - we were not disappointed! After much debate, we decided to each get an order of their lasagna because hubby and I were equally worried that if we liked the lasagna as much as we hoped we would - there would be no sharing. Thankfully, we rolled the dice appropriately because this is not a shareable entree. You'll want to eat it all yourself. The bolognese is perfectly meaty, cheesy, tomato-y, creamy, everything-y.

Now, it's not all about the lasagna...which I've clearly mentioned plenty of times now....

1. They are expanding into the space next door and hope to open by September which will more than double their space.
2. Owner Massimo is still in charge and seemingly at the restaurant every night greeting patrons, saying goodbye, helping the wait staff, in the kitchen, everything. It's a great touch.
3. The restaurant was renovated since I'd been last and I love the new look. They did away with the 90s style white tablecloths and decor and have a more updated + modern look going on.
4. Their focaccia is AMAZING. You've been warned.
5. Great + reasonably priced wine list including by-the-glass options.
6. Everything I've ever had on the menu (burrata, carpaccio, lasagna, pizzas, tiramisu, lemoncello!) is amazing. 

Hubby even wants to make Pazzia a standing monthly date!
author: Jessica M.

description: Love this place great service and delicious home made pasta. I had the papparadelle bolognese pasta. It came with a free appetizer of 2 loaves of fresh baked bread with dipping oil which I soloed all of! The pasta was very filling and flavorful and the service and atmosphere top notch. You cant beat that for under 20 bucks.
author: Sean G.

description:
My friend and I were in the area and she mentioned wanting to try this restaurant out. We got there right around 6PM where there were plenty of open tables, and after being asked if we had reservations (we didn't), we were seated at the table right next to the door. This got a little annoying because over the course of our meal, a LOT of people came and started waiting at the door, sometimes leaving the door open and letting the cool air in. The wait staff was initially very abrupt to us, but did check on us frequently to see how everything was. 

My friend and I decided to split a mixed platter of cheese and cured meats. Although it's listed separately, the waitress suggested a mixed plate and we went for it. Unfortunately, it was nothing much to write about. I liked the salami and the olives, but nothing else on the platter (mostly bland). 

The pasta though. The pasta was AMAZING. I ordered this pennete with mushrooms (I think it was alla funghi?) and man, it was rich and full of flavor. Absolutely delicious and I was actually super happy to have leftovers so I could extend my enjoyment into a second day. 

I would definitely come back again, although next time I'll make sure to get reservations. 4/5.
author: Elodie T.

description: We got there just in time to grab the last outdoor table before a non-stop crowd of patrons began standing in line.  The massive pizza and calzones were extraordinary with ample cheese and a crispy crust.  The highest highlight was the linguine vongole (linguini with clams).  The sauce was perfectly balanced and every last bit needed to be sopped up with the perfectly baked italian bread.   The clams were cooked just right and there were more than enough to satisfy.  Last stop was the dessert menu where the tiramisu was the star of the show.  Homemade and delicious!
author: Robert A.

description: Another amazing meal. The veal limone was amazing and not over powering.  The lasagna was to die for.  Sharing meals again with my wife left us completely satisfied and moping up every bit of sauce with the delicious bread. Service was wonderful as well.
author: Bryan G.

description: We just love this restaurant. My wife and I visiting from Norway this was the best Italian pizza we ever had. And the Tiramisu was extraordinary. Massimo and his staff were very nice and fun to talk to. We will come back!
author: Rune H.

description:
I love and appreciate this place- have been coming here for years. It's down home, authentic, and delicious. Pizzas are good but pastas are better. And the tiramisu is bomb. 

Only gripe I have is I by preferred the decor before they remodeled... now it just looks like literally every other posh San Francisco eatery with white subway tiles and black light fixtures - note to restaurant- bring back the character and murals and the local feel- that's why we love it.
author: Caro C.

description:
Popped in for a quick "work" lunch last week and was promptly greeted by the owner, Mossimo. For those of you who haven't met this guy yet, well you should because he's a super cool dude who's turning out some authentic pastas and classic Italian dishes. Oh and get this, he's from Italy too!

I ordered the caprese salad to start because it's the end of tomato season here in CA so wanted to take full advantage. I forgot to take a picture because I was pretty darn hungry but, the salad was well proportioned and the tomatoes, mozzerella and basil were as fresh as can be. I was feeling like fish that afternoon and normally don't order salmon but, for some reason it was calling my name that afternoon. I was surprised to see such a nicely sized piece of fish for a lunchtime portion and it was cooked/seasoned perfectly. The accompanying potatoes and vegtables felt nice and healthy too. 

All in all, it's a great option for those of you who want to keep it casual and not break the bank during the week. There were a couple large groups dining at the same time so, if you're thinking "team lunch", this might be a good option. Grazie Mossimio, grazie!
author: Benjamin F.

description: I've been eating here for the past 4 years and it is one of my favorite Italian restaurants.  Massimo and his staff are terrific and welcoming and the food is deliciously wonderful.
author: Greg W.

description:
The Bruschetta antipasti and the Pomodori salad is the way to go if you're a vegan! 

I would recommend the bruschetta if you're open to the bread being a little on the softer side. I know some like if crunchy, but this bread was soft and saturated with just the right amount of garlic and olive oil. It paired really well with the fresh tomatoes on top. 

Yes yes, the pomodori salad is a basic *no frills* salad, but it's very ideal for vegans who want a frictionless experience seeing and ordering something on the menu. Between the two dishes (the Bruschetta $9 and the salad $4.50) you have a full meal for a pretty good price! 

The ambiance of the restaurant was low key, spacious, not noisy, ample seating and good lighting. The service was great and I liked the wine.

It's safe to say I'd be back to this place, especially since I can't get the texture of the Bruschetta bread off my mind. :)
author: Jackie K.

description:
*** In Short ***

A solid and easy-to-book Italian joint for both handmade and boxed pasta.

*** In Depth ***

It's about due time I updated my old review, given the number of times I've come back over the past four years. Having tried more of their menu over subsequent visits, I'll say this: their pastas and pizzas are all solid options, which has easily made Pazzia one of my go-to pasta stops in the city, alongside Zero Zero for something a bit fancier and unique, and Caffe Macaroni for something a bit more central and varied.

My feelings about their lasagna haven't changed: it's still delicious, and one of the things I frequently get, but their other pastas are also quite tasty as well. They used to have separate menus for this, but have since combined them such that the handful of handmade pastas have their own section on the main menu now.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - When they're busy, the inside of the restaurant can get a little packed, but I've rarely had trouble with seating when I go. Worst case, they also have a few outdoor tables, which are far more spacious.

Bathroom - Still haven't tried them.
author: Johnny W.

description: In short, Pazzia is one of the most authentic Italian restaurants in the city. I am super picky about Italian cuisine being that I was born in Rome and lived in Florence and both my mom and grandma deserve Michelin stars. Anyway, what I am trying to say is that Pazzia reminds me of home! Eat here. Order everything!
author: Elisa D.

description: I loved the food here, the service was very kind. We were seated with a quickness even though they were almost closing. We never felt rushed. The servers were very attentive and smiley. The restaurant has a intimate ambiance to it. Perfect for dates. The place is a little small though so theres a bit of a tight squeeze between you and the tables around you. Our entrees reached our table not too long after ordering. The food was exceptionally tasty. I'm not giving them 5 stars though because unfortunately there was an earwig (pincher bug) in my boyfriends pasta, yuck. The reason I'm still giving them 4 stars though is because they handled the situation in such a professional manner. They were visibly sorry.m, they apologized profusely and told me it had never happed before and the critter must have snuck into the mushrooms which would be hard to spot when cleaning and preparing them. They didn't charge us for my boyfriends meal and also served up a complimentary tiramisu. My boyfriend wont be back but i definitely will haha fluke accidents happen but it shouldn't deter you from restaurants with tasty food and exquisite service.
author: Jose F.

description: The food and service were spectacular. We started with a bottle of Chianti. Enjoyed the calamari, Cesare salad and gnocchi. Wow!!! It brought me back to my time in Florence. I loved this quaint restaurant and the fabulous food. I highly recommend it.
author: Elyse S.

description: The pappardelle here was homemade and amazing.  I got another pasta dish with salmon and bacon as well which was surprisingly a good combination. I went on a weekday evening and there wasn't a wait at all. I do wish that there were bigger portions. Overall though, it was a great meal and I definitely want to try their other pasta dishes!
author: Amanda F.

description:
Pazzia is one of if not the best Italian restaurants in San Francisco. Conveniently located downtown between the Moscone Center and AT&T Park, you won't want to overlook checking out the authentic Italian dishes complimented by the excellent service.

You can't go wrong with the food from the appetizers (Buratta is a favorite!), pastas, pizzas to the main dishes, everything is delicious and made with care. My personal go-to's are the Capellini All Rughetta + Shrimp and the Lasagna. There is also an extensive wine list to choose from. 

Massimo, the proprietor, is also one of a kind and will make you feel like family. He is a perfect combination of being genuine, generous, energetic, and thoughtful. There simply aren't enough people like him.   

And be sure to not leave without trying the house-made tiramisu, gelato or a glass of limoncello!
author: Peter D.

description: Cute place. Hearty Italian food. You should go here  if you want a quick but pleasant meal. Might not be great for more special gatherings since it's cramped and can really noisy. It definitely has a warm fuzz about it though, I'd go back there on a solo lunch break from work.
author: Vidya R.

description:
One of the best hidden little secrets in all of San Francisco. Very good, authentic Italian food. Owner is amazing, very friendly.

Excellent value!! Best tiramisu around as well.
author: Jason C.

description:
Great restaurant!  It can get busy at dinnertime.  But they take reservations.

The sausage pizza is superb.  The pastas are great.  Especially the pappardelle and the rigatoni salsiccia.  The tiramisu is absolutely delicious.

Ok fine - all the food here is awesome.  This is a "go to" Italian restaurant that I could eat at once a week and never get tired of.
author: Lewis C.

description:
OMMGGGG YUMMMMM!!CARBBBSS..

Pazzia is ADORABLE and DELICIOUS. Two of my favorite combinations.

We came here on a Thursday night with no reservation and were seated before we had decided what we wanted to eat on the menu. They (the hostess and the owner) greeted us right away when we walked in and they were so SO incredibly friendly.

We were able to cram into the back corner table which was meant for 2, but we still had plenty of space.

Things to note:
1. The fresh, free bread here is AMAZING. It is ooey-gooey-chewy and you KNOW it's fresh and handmade with love. I could it ALL DAY with nothing on it!

2. The Fritto Mixto is not your typical calamari, but it is fluffy and light and not too filling! Definitely worth a try.

3. As you've seen in the other Yelp reviews, the pappardelle bolognese is DELISH! The texture of the noodles are so wonderful and al dente. I want to know what ALL their pastas taste like!!

4. Finally, my FAVORITE of the night was the calzone. To be honest, we thought we were ordering a pizza, but I am so delighted that they delivered what is possibly the best calzone I have ever had in my life. I'm' a HUGE fan of ricotta and clearly a huge fan of their bread, so this was a home-run in my book.

Overall, it is a wonderful place to eat and we were greeted with such warm, hospitable service..I don't know how I could ever say no to coming back!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE - went in for the 2nd time because our first experience was great - this experience -  not great at all.  

Had a reservation and they sat us 30 minutes later.

Two servers plus bus boy and that was disaster.  Service - horrible.  Slow to say the least.  Meals were stacking up in the kitchen and they pulled them off to serve them to tables only to discover they were serving them to the wrong tables and put them back to serve to other customers #Shameful.

Food, well, this time not great as it was the first time.  Lots of salt and taste, so so.

Would we go again?  I don't know.  After our first experience we praised this place.  After this experience, most likely just continue to discover better local places to dine.

Sad.  Also, the owner wasn't there the second time but that shouldn't change service or taste.
author: Phillip S.

description:
Great restaurant with an authentic menu! Called at about 5 PM to make a 5:45 reservation and they accommodated us very well. You can tell the people who work there really know what they are doing from knowledge of the menu to watching the chefs cook from our own table. 

It was very loud during dinner and it slightly ruined the experience. It's not their fault obviously because it is a small space, but it's something to keep in mind. 

The fresh bread and olive oil that is brought out is amazing. We ordered the Capricciosa pizza, Capellini Alla Rughetta, and Pollo Arosto. The Capellini was an awesome dish, and the pizza was great as well. The roasted chicken was very dry and we couldn't finish it.

Overall, Pazzia was a good authentic restaurant with a lot of noise and some dry chicken, but the great staff and and easy reservation made for a nice experience.
author: Waleed S.

description:
The Pappardelle Bolognese was exceptional in a sneaky way.  The first few bites tasted kind of plain but then the deep meat flavor starts to come through. By the fifth byte you are really liking the dish. A nice surprise indeed.

The Margarita pizza was nice and simple.  Kind of reminded us of a really good drive-in theater pizza from back in the day.  Those old enough to remember drive-ins will know what we're talking about.
author: David D.

description:
$21 for my own personal pizza, I guess it's what you'd expect to pay at a classic Italian pizzeria. While my friends got stiffed by some "fancy pasta" and some "delicious tortellini", it ended up being a tiny serving of lasagna and about 6 pieces of tortellini. Shared between multiple, growing, hungry teenageers/young adults.

However, my meal was the pizza. Honestly, they all looked pretty similar so I ended up getting one with sausage and mushroom. Not bad -- I've had worse but I've definitely had better. The food took about 40 minutes to arrive, so not ideal either, but we were quite hungry by the time so the pizza tasted pretty good at that point. 

It's a tiny restaurant, so you might have to deal with sitting outside. And you might have to wait a good 30 minutes for seating regardless (unless you have a reservation). It wasn't too bad, but I definitely got a couple mosquito bites that busy summer night I went. Cover up or wait for an indoor seat.

Take-away: Go here if Zero-Zero or Goat Hill Pizza down the road is busy, or you're just really hungry, but I wouldn't recommend this for date night, or your first night in the city.
author: Sameer C.

description:
Truly enjoy Pazzia each time we go there. This time we had guests and full family. 7 people is a bit tight since the place is small. 
But If you want Italian style pizza, great pasta -- this is the place to go. Nothing fancy - very much traditional plates but great value. My favorites include pizza w parma ham, porcini pasta.
Highly recommend this place. Make a reservation if possible. They are always busy.
author: Ediz E.

description: Went for lunch, very friendly and attentive service, delicious food, and there was no wait. I ordered the Gnocchi, & a margarita pizza and I enjoyed both. Will definitely be going back!
author: LeVar H.

description:
My lunch group came in on a whim. I wasn't expecting a lot, but the experience didn't match the minimal standards I held for an off-the-cuff lunch in downtown San Francisco. 

For starters, it was an uncharacteristically beautiful, warm summer day in San Francisco. There was no patio seating available, which would have been fine if it weren't also unbearably warm inside. For whatever reason there was no air conditioning and the otherwise empty interior reflected that. We sat at the table closest to the door, just short of sweating, and proceeded to order. 

The salad was quite decent, with a good mix of flavors and fresh ingredients. Unfortunately my pizza was a little undercooked. Far worse though was the hair I found under one slice. Rather than make a scene about it, I chose to carefully eat around that slice. Was this an actual hair or just some random lint that had flown into the dish on the way to our table? I didn't want to investigate. 

Our server was extremely nice and I consider the hair a one-off irregularity that wouldn't deter me from eating here. The uncomfortably warm interior without air conditioning is a deal-breaker though, and enough to keep me from recommending or making a return visit.
author: Alex L.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants in the San Francisco's area. I had a special request for a seafood pasta and they were very accommodating. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente filled with fresh seafood covered in a fresh tomato red sauce.
author: Juan V.

description:
A bit expensive, but standard prices for SF dinner. I chose the margherita pizza just because it was the cheapest, but it turned out to be fantastic. Probably among the best margherita pizzas I've had. They will tell you that each pizza is individual, but it is definitely splittable between two people. 

The restaurant is fairly small, which makes it an intimate setting, but it seems that they are expanding to include the space next door soon. It's also really neat that they have an open kitchen and you can watch them making your food. Based on other reviews sounds like they are very busy during prime dinner hours - but from my experience, there is no wait at all if you go late on a weekday.
author: Zareen C.

description:
Business Trip Lunch Day 1:

Eating at Pazzia reminded me of dining in Italy. 

Tucked away on what seemed to be a less crowded area of the street, I enjoyed lunch here with some of my co-workers. With the doors wide open on a warm sunny day, we were greeted by our friendly servers who had our table moved closer to the door so we could enjoy a little outside breeze. 

First of all, I wanted absolutely everything on the menu...I mean everything. I opted for the beet salad and margherita pizza. I love beets, and one of the best things about coming to San Francisco is having the opportunity to eat beet salad pretty much wherever I go. My salad was fresh and loaded with greens and beets. Light and lovely.

The pizza was sooo delicious. They serve thin style pizza here, just like being in Italy, so you can plan on it coming out quickly. Great if you want to order up and make it to your meetings on time. Loaded with cheese and fresh ingredients, I wished I could have taken it back with me. I could have eaten the whole thing.

Friendly and quick, with a few cute cafe tables outside. 

Note: There's nothing more exciting that actually recognizing someone from the Chicagoland area who has been to this restaurant before. Nick R is right in his review. This is such a lovely authentic dining spot for Italian.
author: Angela S.

description:
This is probably my favorite restaurant when I want to have a nicer lunch around work. Everything I've tried here is delicious. I've only got pasta, pizza, salads or appetizers, so I can't say much about other entrees, but those were consistently good. 

There's usually enough room to show up without a reservation, which is nice too around that area.
author: Marta F.

description:
"L'arte dell'ospitalitá"
I never right a review but tonight I was compelled to write after being treated like royalty by the staff at Pazzia. In a time where customer service is almost dead in the Bay Area this little gem teaches us how to treat your customers right.  Tonight's dinner was the second in two months and both times we were treated like family....From the busboy to the "lovely" waitress to the host we were treated to an amazing experience once again. Thanks Pazzia!
author: David G.

description: Huge portions of handmade pasta and salads! Plus there isn't ever a long wait and everything comes out quickly. One of the best places in the area for pizza, pasta, or salad during lunch or dinner!
author: Rory T.

description: A friend of mine brought me here! Oh mi amore the food delicioso! Massimo the owner is hands down very accomodating! They own two restaurants one in SF & the other in Sicily, really authentic italian food. oJust be patient as they make the food from scratch it takes a few minutes to get it prepared. My favorite is the pizza & the seafood risotto! To die for. Coming back with my friends on our birthday. Grazie!
author: Taryn M.

description:
Visited San Francisco for the weekend as a gift to my boyfriend for his birthday. We stayed at the W hotel and had a long day wandering the Golden Gate Park, California Academy of Sciences and de Young Museum. We were forced to eat at the cafe at the California Academy of Sciences for lunch due to accessibility of food. For dinner, we wanted to eat somewhere close by but with great food, since we were disappointed by our lunch fare. 

We decided to look to Yelp for a restaurant that was nearby and we were craving Italian food. At first we were disappointed since all the reviews said that this restaurant was closed for remodeling but we decided to call to double check. Low and behold, we were saved! We were told they were open until 10:30 PM so we got ready and walked down the street to the restaurant.

Upon first impression, I loved the feel of the restaurant. It was warm and inviting, like you were visiting home. There wasn't seating available for us inside but we decided to take advantage of the beautiful weather and enjoy our meal outside. 

We were warmly greeted by our waiter who was very friendly and he took our drink orders and food order since we knew what we wanted. I enjoyed the house white wine while my boyfriend ordered La Rossa Double Bock beer. The house bread was very good, with a nice crust on the outside and white, hot, fluffy bread inside, accompanied with olive oil for dipping. 

Our food came and we were both very impressed. I ordered the seafood risotto and my boyfriend ordered the tagellini. Both dishes were slightly out of our comfort zone and we both enjoyed our food. The seafood risotto had a wonderful fragrance to it, it wasn't fishy-smelling at all and the seafood was cooked to perfection! Definitely a great ratio of risotto to seafood, and the risotto was perfectly cooked as well. 

We ended our dinner with a tiramisu to change our palate. It was very moist and light, which is what I want in a great tiramisu. 

Only downside I experienced while I was at this restaurant was the service at the very end. It took a very long time for our waiter to come by our table to give us our bill and even take our bill when we had a card in place. Part of it was us sitting outside but there was a significant period of time where our waiter was standing on the restaurant floor observing the patrons. So for that, I reduced the rating to 4 stars. Regardless, it was a great experience and at the end the owner even asked us how we enjoyed our meal. Although I didn't interact with the owner much, I saw him helping his staff and greeting customers, which I thought was great. 

Highly recommend this restaurant for decently priced Italian fare in the SoMa district.
author: Sabrina R.

description: Went here for lunch with 8 other co workers. It's a really great spot for a big crowd!  I ordered the pappardelle bolognese. Really delicious, homemade pasta. The downside is I had more noodles than sauce. Chose to put 4 stars bc the staff were very accommodating, allowing up to have separate checks. If you're looking for decent food and have a huge crowd, this is the perfect place!
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description:
Another amazing dining experience at Pazzia. As always, the team at Pazzia makes you immediately feel like you're dining with family in Italy. The food is great, the atmosphere is inviting and the experience is entirely unique. Thank you to Massimo and Laura for a wonderful evening!

Pro tip: one of the best pizzas in SF
author: jacob l.

description:
I was trying to find a place for part of our office to enjoy lunch at.  Pazzia got rave reviews, and the pics looked good, plus who doesn't love Italian?  I'm glad that they're expanding their space to the empty portion nextdoor, because the restaurant is small and we took up a table in the middle for 9 of us.  This place is definitely busy during lunch and we had to wait a little while for our order to be taken.  

It was definitely a hard choice, but the waitress sold me on one of the specials which was a saffron pasta.  We started off with some orders of the burratta.  You can never go wrong with burrata with proscuitto!  The cheese was nice and creamy, the argula was the perfect bitter balance and the pork was fresh and just added a tad of the saltiness.  I think the buratta could have used a little more seasoning though.  My saffron pasta came with lots of shrimp and zucchini and tons of homemade pasta.  Pasta was cooked al dente, the zucchini was delish.  I loved the color of my sauce, but wish the saffron taste stood out more.  I think it would have been great if there was a little more in the pasta, like maybe some crab or scallop, or some extra veggies.  Everyone else seemed to like their pasta, pizza and calzone.  The calzone was massive and had lots of meat and an egg in it.  

I think Pazzia is a decent place to get your carb fix on in SOMA.  It's slightly pricey, but it's understood to the area.  I wouldn't mind coming back, but I would get either a non-special pasta dish or perhaps one of their pizzas instead.
author: Cat C.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in SF, in the USA. Only competition is in Tuscany or Florence itself. Maybe that's because Massimo the owner is Florentine. 

They pastas and the pizzas are simply perfectly done, simple, fresh, authentic. This place gets it - it being the imperative to keep it simple and real, don't get cute, classic Italian food IS subtle and simple. 

Waitstaff are always just right: attentive without being obsequious. A

I LOVE Pazzia and have since, holy crap, 1999! Salute, Massimo!!
author: Joseph D.

description:
Pazzia is DA BOMB DIGGITY! Seriously. Always great quality food, without fail. And the staff is super nice and on point. The owner is a very Italian looking stylish dude who is super friendly and remembers everyone. And the food is just solid, from their pizzas to their pastas and gnocchis.

And OMG, did you know they have amazing ice cream? I had no idea until I saw someone order it, and OMG! OMG! Hands down one of the most delectable experiences my mouth has ever had (the chocolate one was especially amazing).

They also just recently renovated their space really nicely. This is the perfect neighborhood mom&pop Italian joint for those looking for authentic and consistent Italian flavors in an intimate space.
author: Bar B.

description:
Great food!

Awesome Linguini and Clams!  Great Puttanesca!  

Delicious Fresh Homemade Bread every day!

And one of the Best Pizzas in SF.

Sergio is a Great Cook!
author: leesa M.

description: Great Italian place, I mean really Italian, not Italian-American. It's not the fanciest place around, but it's warm and welcoming, and the food is good. The owner Massimo is always around greeting people and stopping at tables for a chat. The menu does not change, so you know what you get, and it never disappoints. My personal favorites are: Lasagna, Ragu Pappardelle, and Scaloppine al limone (veal). Bonus: the bread they serve is tasty and you'll have a hard time stopping yourself from over eating it before your meal is served.
author: Alberto T.

description: What a great restaurant and close to our hotel (staying at the Marriott on 2nd Street).  The ambience is relaxing and the service is excellent.  We arrived right at 5:30, the first customers of the evening.  We met Maximo, the owner came by and introduced himself.  Casual dining at its finest!  BTW- the food is amazing!
author: Lourdes C.

description: The food is very good as is the staff.  We ate on the sidewalk seating.  They were busy on Saturday night but we were nicely attended to.  We shared a great bottle of Chianti.  I will be back.
author: John H.

description:
Came here last night for Valentine's Day.  My gf and I saw the restaurant on Bay Area Check Please a few weeks ago and decided to try it.  The people on the show were 100% right, this place was really good!

1.) The food was DELICIOUS.  We had the Caprese as an appetizer, then for the main dish the gf had Pennette Ai Funghi and I had the Pizza Del Giorno.  I'm a huge fan of pizza, especially thin crust (specifically new york style) and these guys did a superb job.  I went with the special of the day on the pizza and in hindsight wish I would have went with the Margherita, but none the less it was GOOD!.  

2.) The price was moderate and very reasonable!  Big plus.

3.) Service.  This was a somewhat hit and miss!  We were in a far corner outside which made it a challenge for us to really get waited on and I get that the waiter was probably trying to give us some space since we were having a great conversation with our out of town fellow diners, but it did take FOREVER to get our check.  But, on the upside, the owner was very gracious and came by to introduce himself, even offered a drink (unfortunately I don't really drink all that often due to my training), and thanked all the diners for stopping by, which I think was very classy and made the experience personable. 

4.) The layout, its small (a little tight, you do hear everything the other diners are saying) with a direct view of the kitchen, but with a nice modern decor.  The roses and candles inside was definitely an added bonus for Valentine's Day.  You can tell the owner really put some thought into keeping the restaurant looking top notch!

Overall, we had a great experience and would definitely come back!!
author: Mike M.

description: Seriously as good as it gets!  I felt like I was in Spain or Italy with the quality of the food!!!  Wonderful service and delicious food!!!
author: Mj D.

description:
Visited this restaurant a handful of time and I have too many things to say. However, I will summarize my thoughts:

Food has always been superb. Pizzas are great, homemade Pastas are to dream about and the appetizers are mouth watering.

Service has always been fast and cordial. Vanna, our waitress, has always been fun and entertaining, without taking anything away from her professionalism.

The owner, Massimo, always welcomes me and my friend with open arms. As if we were childhood friends that haven't seen each other in years. However, it's usually a week at most.

They really make you feel at home here. And food is great. Love it!

Bravo!
author: Mr. Food G.

description:
DISCLAIMER - DO NOT OPEN THIS REVIEW IF YOU GET GROSSED OUT EASILY! 

So me and a couple of friends decided to check this place out since it was right around the corner from the bar that we were at. As soon as we got seated we got our menus. My friends and I were taking a while to decide what to get since we had never been here before. Within the first 2-3 minutes I expected for our waitress to come to our table and ask us if we wanted anything to drink (you know, how it's supposed to be) or at least check on us to see if we had any questions about the menu, but she didn't. I noticed a couple that walked in, got seated at a timely manner and got some water right away (before us) which made me very upset. Finally after about 10min of deciding over what to order (mind I say, my friends and I had to YELP the restaurant to see what was good) we were finally ready. We put our menus down hoping our waitress would come but one of my friends had to actually give her a hand signal and call her over. Unbelievable. FINALLY our waitress came to our table and took our order. Clearly there was nothing special about her or her personality that made me feel welcome at this restaurant. In my opinion, a waitresses main priority should be to make the customers feel welcomed and have a fun personality so we can feel comfortable. customer service wise; I asked my friends what they thought and one responded with "The service was ok. They didn't really check up on us" and another said "They did take a while but they were also busy" .. I'm huge on customer service and I rate this place a 1 out of 5. 

Now for the food.. Four of us got pastas and 1 of us got a lasagna. I must say the food was just off the charts and my friends were pretty impressed. We all loved our plates, they were delicious. I ordered a sea food pasta. It had clams, shrimp, octopus and calamari. I don't really have much to say about the food besides the fact that it was pretty damn good! We were all 100% satisfied. 

Now here is the reason why I am writing this review... THIS WILL BE VERY DETAILED SO PLEASE STOP READING THIS IF THIS IS TOO MUCH INFORMATION FOR YOU. Please note: I limit myself to only eating out ONCE a week (since I do like to eat healthy) meaning this restaurant was the ONLY place I went "out" to eat to. 

So.. the next day in the morning after having dinner at this restaurant, I digested something unusual... let me rewind a little. After dinner, my friends and I went out and I ended up getting home at 3AM. As soon as I got home, I digested (I seem to have a very fast metabolism) and right after, I went to sleep. I woke up at 9am because my stomach was aching and sure enough, I had to digest for the second time which was totally normal for me. I went back to sleep and woke up at around 11:30 and what do you know?? I digested for the third time. Once I got up to flush, I noticed something VERY SCARY in my stool. I was so scared I called my grandma in the restroom and we thought it was a tapeworm. It looked long, wide and off white. She grabbed a wooden pencil, took it out of the toilet, placed it under the faucet and washed it off. I HAD EATEN A PIECE OF GLOVE! It was literally a whole finger of a glove.

So many things were running through my head. I knew it was from the restaurant, I just couldn't figure out HOW I HAD SWALLOWED THAT THING. I came to the conclusion that since I would roll up my pasta on the fork, the piece had to have gotten in there somehow; since it was actually longer than it looks in the picture. I've also came to the conclusion that I probably chewed it up thinking it was some piece of clam or calamari. I'm sure the glove would've had a similar texture as the chewy sea food. EITHER WAY, I'm 100% sure that this piece of glove came from this restaurant because (once again) THIS WAS THE ONLY PLACE I HAD EATEN OUT DURING THE WEEK. Also, the week before this, I had eaten wingstop which is dry food so I know it couldn't have been from there. 

So I decided to call the restaurant. When I called, the first question I asked was if they used gloves to prepare their food and the woman on the phone said yes. I asked her to describe them to me ... after she did, I told her what happened. She then began to say it was impossible and was all she kept on saying. She was going on and on and then said it was ALSO impossible because the cooks didn't use gloves to prepare the pasta... Excuse me, didn't you JUST tell me that the cooks use gloves to prepare the food? She was just being rude, so I cut her off. I told her I wasn't calling to argue or get anything out of them and that I just wanted to let them know so they could be more cautious.  

I just wish they would've handled the situation properly. I don't get why the woman had to freak out over the phone? So I guess for everyone who visits this place in the future, PLEASE CHECK YOUR FOOD BEFORE YOU EAT IT. GOOD LUCK!! 

P.S. 
Pazzia, you're lucky I'm not suing.
author: Emily O.

description:
Mushroom pizza was one of the best I've had!  (5/5)
Fried Calamari had the most delicious breaded batter- crispy and light without being oily.  (4/5)
Panna Cotta was absolutely amazing. (5/5)

The manager was super friendly too.
author: Maniya G.

description:
Surprisingly, this place isn't bad. The outside appearance of the restaurant looks casual, but when you go inside, its a level up from casual, and closer to semi-formal. The entrees were a bit expensive, but the food tastes delicious! 

We were not very hungry so the two of us shared the Bruschetta appetizer and a plate of pasta, Rigatoni Con Salsiccia (tube-pasta w sausage). Sooo good. I wanted more even though I was so full already. The meat was cooked perfectly and the tomato sauce was not too salty (thankfully). The service was great too -- feels like an authentic Italian restaurant. There was not much space in the restaurant so be prepared to sit close to the party next to you. I will probably come back and try the other pastas on their menu.
author: Connie L.

description: Arguably the best Italian food in San Francisco. The owner and waitstaff are incredibly friendly and gracious.
author: Alex S.

description:
Discovering Pazzia this week has seriously made me question all of my past treks into Northbeach for really good Italian food, as this place serves up some of the best right in the heart of SoMa! 

My whole experience here was wonderful. Upon coming in, all of the staff was very friendly and personable in greeting us and making sure our party was properly situated. The indoor seating was INCREDIBLY HOT to the point where my co-workers and I were frantically fanning ourselves to suppress the impending hurricane of sweat we were producing. When we asked to sit outside, they set up a table for us and allowed us to enjoy the breezy 70 degree evening weather. 

The food was especially tasty... although it probably had a stick of butter in each dish. "TREATCHO SELF, STEPHEN" was my mantra through every bite of delicious lasagna, pizza, tortelloni, gnocci, and pappardelle that I inhaled. The pasta all went really well with a nice glass of red and honestly tasted better than a lot of food I've tried in Italy. 

I've heard the tiramisu is pretty bomb here, so I'll most likely return for another post-work excursion soon. Thanks, Pazzia, for renewing my love for the neighborhood I work in. Grazie mille!!
author: Stephen D.

description:
I've been here two times, both times with a group. 

Their salads are all great -- croutons on the caesar are crunchy and flavorful; the one with the pine nuts is great because... pine nuts; the beet salad was refreshing, but I wish the beets were slightly more tender.

The pasta dishes were decent; my favorite was the beef ragu parpadelle; the lasagna was a huge hit. The pizzas were okay, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend the gnocchi (a bit too starchy, wasn't a fan of marinara).

I called ahead a few days earlier and they were able to accommodate my party of  10. 

I would come back anytime -- with a group, big or small!
author: Michelle K.

description:
I found this restaurant through Yelp as my friends and I were hunting down a pizza spot that was open after 9pm on a weeknight. Once seated, the servers brought out warm bread instantly which was delicious; not like the day old rough bread you get at most places. We ordered a margherita pizza that I regret not taking a picture of since we dived right into it. The pizza was very thin, with the right amount of cheese, and topped with fresh basil... yum. They also brought out freshly grated Parmesan; not the powdered stuff.  

Overall, the service & food was fantastic. I don't go to San Francisco much but I would definitely check out this location again if I am ever in the area again.
author: Love K.

description: We were staying at the Marriott Marquis and the concierge desk suggested this place. It was Fantastic!! It's close to the hotel property just down from Spin, the ping pong bar, and has a small seating area. The kitchen is in full view and was immaculate. The bread served was so fresh and delicious. We ordered a bottle of pino noir and various salads and pasta dishes. Everything was fresh and tweaked by the chefs to match our palate desires. I have nothing negative to say and after our bellies were full it was a quick walk back to the hotel. We ordered  a chicken dish which was moist with a great presentation, the gnocchi was unbelievable and we had it two ways, with a red sauce and eggplant and with an Alfredo sauce. Definitely out this on your "to go to" list. I'll be back when I fly into San Francisco again!
author: K R.

description: We always feel very special when dining at Pazzia. Massimo and his wife are interacting with each of the guests and the perfect hosts. The food is very tasty, service is excellent and it feels like a great Italian experience.  A true neighborhood gem.
author: Abraham M.

description:
I'd been dying to try this place for months, as it had been very highly recommended by an Italian friend of mine.  My expectations were more than exceeded!  I would typically refrain from giving a 5 star review after only one visit, but this place is truly exceptional! Massimo and his staff are amazing, and very welcoming.  I felt like I was dining at his home.  I sat outside and sipped Machiavelli Chianti Classico Reserva, and enjoyed an absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked pizza.  The execution was flawless, and topped with primo fresh ingredients.  I was also given plenty of crushed red pepper (I love it spicy!) and parmigiano.

Great food, and great people!

The wine list is also quite impressive.  I'll certainly be back to try some of the pasta dishes and a lot more pizza!...& wine!
author: Evan M.

description: I live near here and my husband and I frequent this restaurant probably two times a month. We love the food love the ambience and we love the owner! Super great fresh food, great wine and amazing service!
author: Genia P.

description:
It was nothing fancy, nothing trendy, nothing super cool... Just a great meal with great service. Everything we ate was super-fresh and beautiful, and as soon as I'm back in SF, I'll do it all over again. 

Things change when you have a baby. Suddenly your Yelp searches for dinner include the term, "family friendly" and you make reservations for three with a request for floor space (that damn stroller). Pazzia was happy to make us comfortable, and the gentleman running the place even helped my husband lift the damn stroller over the heads of other diners to get us into a quiet, low-traffic corner of the place. Such service. 

Our meal? Spectacular. The burratta was incredibly fresh and creamy, served with a beautiful side of dressed arugula and thinly-sliced and deliciously salty prosciutto. The Pazzia salad was simple, yet packed with beautiful ingredients and amazing flavors. These two apps were the perfect precursor to our decadent pastas -- mine being the Ravioli with Mushrooms in Pink Sauce, a divinely salty, creamy and earthy mix, and his the Beef Tortelloni with Cream Sauce & Mushrooms, another home-run. Accompanied by a glass or two of bold, juicy local cabernet, our meal was a total pleasure. 

The service is impeccable. Warm, quick, helpful -- the server even suggested a different wine to complement my husband's meal when he ordered, and she was totally spot on. They also bring some outrageously delish fresh focaccia to the table along with some fragrant olive oil for dipping. Bonus!

Great for families, for dates, for everyone. Not to expensive, either -- especially for what you get!
author: Hilary H.

description: I've been looking forward to going here for a long time, especially since it was closed for renovations for a while. I pass by it often since it's in a great location - easy to get to on foot or by public transit, and near Caltrain. However, I was kinda disappointed in the end. I went with my bf on a Friday, after the dinner rush. There was no line, which was great - why then, did we have to wait so long before being seated then served? The restaurant wasn't even busy. The waitress we had was nice, but it was sometimes difficult to get her attention... or anyone else's for that matter - even the owner, who was distracted by a dog at another table (indoors, which was unusual for a restaurant). The food was okay, but I've definitely had better Italian food in SF. The starter meat platter we shared was good, but nothing special. Similar for the lasagne - it was okay, but was more overcooked than expected. We didn't bother staying for dessert. Overall, it definitely wasn't my favourite restaurant experience, so I'll probably head somewhere else the next time I want to go to an Italian restaurant.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Bruschetta
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pazzia-restaurant-and-pizzeria-san-francisco?select=y9OFrFMXfO1c5hTk-q3xBQ#dK55Yk3CfzWD7bjXGRbEBA
This was a bit disappointing. The tomatoes were mushy and flavorless. The bread was good but this really just tasted like olive oil and bread with mushy tomatoes that didn't even taste like tomatoes... could've used more salt and pepper too.

Margherita Pizza
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pazzia-restaurant-and-pizzeria-san-francisco?select=y9OFrFMXfO1c5hTk-q3xBQ#oQmeXezqUvC-S_LI8fGazw
One of the best Margherita Pizzas I've had in the bay area :) If I come back here again I think I would try more of their pizza because this was so good. It was a bit oily though... they went a bit heavy handed with the olive oil on this one.

Seafood Risotto
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pazzia-restaurant-and-pizzeria-san-francisco?select=y9OFrFMXfO1c5hTk-q3xBQ#HE-I4DjouWv0B0570CB8gA
It was okay... a bit on the bland side.

Tiramisu
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pazzia-restaurant-and-pizzeria-san-francisco?select=y9OFrFMXfO1c5hTk-q3xBQ#y9OFrFMXfO1c5hTk-q3xBQ
The tiramisu was super creamy but I couldn't taste much coffee. It was just alright for me.

I definitely recommend the pizzas here but not so sure about the rest of the stuff on their menu...
author: Lily L.

description:
Great restaurant all around, from the service to the food. They know how to make you feel comfortable and right at home.
Tonight is my first time here & I'll definitely be returning. 

I had the lasagna & it was just absolutely great.

The price point is fair for the food and service they provide. 

Only downside if any is the place is just a tad small & cramped, although I was told they'll be expanding very soon.

Great place to dine if you're in SOMA, 

Highly recommended!!
author: Marcos R.

description:
We made a last minute reservation for 5 on a Saturday evening. The lady over the phone had such a heavy Italian accent I could barely understand her confirming my reservation. But I was also very excited to know that this place is legit-ly authentic Italian.

I brought the kid and was immediately greeted by Massimo. He offered to take our compact stroller and store it another room beside the restaurant. How family-friendly!

We all shared the Caprese Salad and Burrata Salad. Hands down the Burrata was the winner of the two. Super creamy and a touch of saltiness to finish off the palette which paired well with my Pinot Noir -- excellent.

I ordered the Fettucine Pescatore special -- incredible. The homemade pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and the sauce was very rich but not heavy. I inhaled my entire plate and did not feel bloated at the end.

The kid had the homemade mac n cheese made with fresh rotini pasta and butter. He added cheese at the table to make it creamy -- he loved it.

We took our time chit chatting and ended up staying over 2 hours. We had a great time and the staff was very attentive. I would definitely come back!
author: Jon S.

description:
I came here with my sis after walking from the moscone center for a trade event.  It's conveniently close by and I swear my sis told me "the lasagna is hecka good!" 12 times.  Even though she originally planned to go somewhere for a healthy lunch, I think she kind of really wants me to try this hecka good lasagna she's been telling me about for 5 mins

It was lunchtime on a Thursday and the place was busy! Luckily we were seated within 5 minutes and we ready to order!

LASAGNA - $16
My sis claimed this to be the best lasagna she has ever had...and we grew up eating lost of Italian food and she's quite the picky eat these days!  They were super nice to split the order when the server knew my sis and I were sharing! It was brought to us still sizzling! It was indeed very good and creamy!  I love cheese and creamy food so this was definitely a yummy one!

SALAD
The arugula salad was simple and yummy.  It came with pine nuts which I loved and a generous amount of balsamic vinaigrette!

I never thought to come here but I'm glad my sis took me! So lucky of me!  The service here was wonderful and everyone was super nice!  It's a small restaurant with some outdoor seating....I had a wonderful time here.  :)
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: Best Italian authentic food.  Its like being in Italy all over again.  This place is a must
author: Rob P.

description: OMG!! This is place has very authentic Italian food!  Their homemade Lasagna and Fettuccine were delicious!  The Bruschetta was perfection!  Vanna, our server, was authentic Italian also!!  She's from Italy !  She's a very conscientious waitress!  Thank you to Massimo for a wonderful dining experience!  We will eat here again!!
author: Denise E.

description: Great food and nice service! Walking by the restaurant and got attracted by its newly remodeled look, clean, rustic and warm! Definitely come back again to try out other food!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Visiting SFO and had an errand nearby, so was looking for a local spot with good reviews.  Small and cosy (but expanding into more space adjacent).

My waitress was prompt but not rushing me in any way.  I was interested in a wine I was not familiar with and she cheerfully brought me a taste.  Ordered a bottle, and since it was kept at room temperature, I asked for an ice bucket to bring it to proper serving temperature..

Then came the warm bread and oil.  It was amazing!  I asked but they said they did not bake it in house.  Either way it was great.

I ordered the Caesar salad.  When it came time to order the entree, I really wanted the spinach pasta, but with a different preparation, as was on another dish.  She gladly accommodated that request.  Everything was fabulous.

I even introduced myself to the owner, Massimo, who throughout the evening, went back and forth from the door to the kitchen, being hospitable to his diners and helping his waitstaff and kitchen staff.  I complimented him on his food, the feel of his place, and particularly the hard working staff I enjoyed watching the entire time.  

For me it was the perfect combination of excellent food, locally owned restaurant, gracious staff, reasonably priced wine list.  I really can't wait to get back to SFO to dine here again.

The only constructive suggestion I would make would be to spend the $1,500 for a large wine cooler so that their red wines could be kept at 55 degrees, and be able to serve and enjoy at that 60+/- degree 'sweet spot'.

Thanks Massimo!
author: Dwight A.

description: I came here with a few coworkers during our lunch time and I was not impressed at all. The waitress was nice which is why I gave Pazzia an extra star but the quality of food was awful. I ordered the ravioli and what did I get? 5 pieces of extra oily ravioli that was small in a large bowl. My coworker got the greasiest chicken breast I had ever seen with potatoes smothered in oil. Blegh!! And as if the greasy food wasn't enough, the bill price was outrageous!! I spent $17 on 5 pieces of small and oily ravioli. That's $3.40 per ravioli! Never again are we coming here.
author: Khatia R.

description:
Can be pretty loud inside, but there's patio seating.
A wee fancy. Warm ambiance, but bit boring. 

I think I had the Spaghetti Alle Vongole (spaghetti w/ clams) the first time and recall that being quite delicious. My friend's gnocchi looked good too. The Taglierni Verdi (spinach pasta w/ salmon) was just ok. Bit bland.

Our group shared a Burrata (prosciutto, mozarella, argula platter). Liked the prosciutto.
author: An Y.

description:
I went here for a going away lunch for a coworker. The meal started off with a basket of fresh bread. It was warm, fluffy and served with vinegar and olive oil. Great start to the meal. As starters we had Burrata (cream-filled mozzarella di bufala, arugula, prosciutto and olive oil). The mozzarella was fresh and was perfect with the other ingredients.

As an entree I ordered the Pappardelle Bolognese. I typically like a thick and creamy sauce for pasta and this was close to being perfect. The Pappardelle pasta was fresh, the same had a generous portion of meat, and creamy tomato sauce. The dish was a bit cold coming out of the kitchen, but other than that I loved it.

I will definitely give this place another go.
author: Rudy S.

description:
The staff / service was great. No online presence and you have to call for reservations, but they're pretty accommodating. 

Still, the place was too small. They've been expanding for what feels like years, and they've crammed far too many tables into their current space. We were repeatedly nudged by people passing by, including staff, because there just wasn't enough space to move. 

The food was eh. Could be the least interesting home-made pasta I've ever had. It was all quite bland, even a pinch of salt would have gone a long way. 

We got: 
- house bread basket: eh. foccacia types loaves. it was fine, but clearly not fresh. 
- bruschetta: bland and uninspiring. totally forgettable.
