- burrata: was good, but there's really no skill required for this dish, it's a couple dallops of cheese, and some arugula.
- gnocchi w/ eggplant: far less eggplant, and far more bland tomato sauce than I would have liked. It's a simple balance to fix, and a little basil and salt in the sauce would really have elevated the dish. 
- we also got another homemade pasta dish with a white wine sauce and mushrooms, but same story. Some garlic, some salt, some pepper could have really helped. 

I'd heard great things about the restaurant, and had higher expectations for the food.
author: Dimple B.

description:
This restaurant is located in SOMA.
I made a reservation for 6 at 18:00 on Saturday. 
We ordered two appetizers, one Chicken, one pizza, one past and risotto.

(Rating: +++ is perfect)
Atmosphere+++:
Inside of the restaurant was a casual and we can choice outside table.
Unfortunately, restroom is in the kitchen.

Service++:
Pretty kind and friendly. Workers are so nice. 
The day we went to was only one servicer, who looks like so busy.

Value++:
Reasonable
_________________
Food

Bruschetta ++:
The bread was casual that It was a little crispy and Tomato, Paprika, and bail cut a big size. It was a good harmony that I ate them together. 

Burrata ++: 
I think that everybody likes this dish.
Some slice of Prosciutto were  delicious,  mozzarella is soft, fresh, creamy, and Rucola smells fresh sesame into my mouth.

Chicken Confit ++:
I can't' remember the taste but It wsa average.

Pizza /Mushroom and Prosciutto ++: 
The pizza was chewy and it's a little thic. Tomato source was good accent.

Risotto /Seafood risotto in saffron sauce ++:
The taste made me relax. The saffron taste was elegant and shrimp was chewy.

Pasta /Fettuccine Asparagus and shrimp in cream sauce +++:
This is so rich that I want to eat again.

 I like better pasta than pizza in this resturant.
author: Hiromi S.

description:
Huge thin crust pizzas, nice and doughy and topped generously. I love that the pizzas are substantial, unlike the dainty little pies you get at Beretta or Delfina. The funghi and sausage was amazing, even better than I remember.

The highlights of the night were the clam pasta, with perfectly al dente pasta, and the rich, fresh burrata and procuitto appetizer. 

Wasn't particularly impressed with the wine, but can't complain because prices weren't bad - they offer a house wine for $30, and the cabernet sauvignon we ordered was $45.

Ended the night with an extra creamy tiramisu stacked high, and a carmel flan (which I would pass on). I can't believe I haven't returned since 2008 - I need to put Pazzia into rotation more often! More importantly, I can't believe I have been writing Yelp reviews since 2008!!
author: Jess C.

description:
This place seems to have really hit or miss reviews, not sure why. As a pizza place and as an Italian place, this restaurant didn't really quite hit its marks for the SF benchmark. We had the:

- Charcuterie plate: Meats seemed like they weren't freshly cut. The prosciutto was not soft and the other meats were just okay. I feel like they took the Costco pack of charcuterie meats and threw it on a platter.

- Grilled vegetables: This was so bland I could only eat it with the meats. It was missing the grill flavor too.

- Pizza of the day (artichokes, truffle oil, prosciutto): For great ingredients, this pizza was very mediocre. The flavors didn't shine, the pizza bread itself was crispy and (a little too) chewy, and lacked flavor.

- Margherita: I benchmark all my pizzas on the traditional margherita. While this was probably one of the better items on the menu, there are plenty of other places in the city that can serve up a mean Margherita at the same price.

- Gnocchi: Too dense. Tomato-based sauce was tasty though and just the sauce itself was a great dip to make up for the pizza crust.

- Bread: Decent; soft and warm. Needed some salt or perhaps some balsamic vinegar to serve with it.

The atmosphere is just okay too. It was strange that they were playing loud electronic music at an Italian white tablecloth restaurant. It seemed like it was easy to snag a spot and wasn't terribly busy around 6pm.
author: Joanne Y.

description:
Stopped in after a long day of moving for dinner. We were way underdressed LOL but they didn't seem to mind. Their table focaccia bread is incredible! I had a margherita pizza and my husband had the chicken with mushrooms, both were excellent. The tiramisu for dessert was amazing, I'm not a huge tiramisu person usually but I'd absolutely over this again. Also had decaf lattes, which were wonderfully frothy and light. 

This biggest thing for me was that our card got declined (just moved from it of state) but the server was discreet and didn't make a big deal about it. Was super embarrassing for us but we got is resolved.
author: Lindsay J.

description:
Best Italian food in the city. They have some
Delicious wines, very warm welcoming atmosphere and great service. I would highly recommend it.
author: Eire M.

description: On a Family reunion to San Francisco with my siblings we happened upon Pazzia Restaurant.   Each course was delicious!  We enjoyed every minute and will be sure to visit again and again on future trips!
author: Ann W.

description:
I used to pass by this place every day on the way to and from work, and I've always wanted to try it. Finally dropped by and it was a pleasant experience involving some pretty great Italian food. My friend and I came in at 6:30 on a weekday and the place was still fairly empty, but by 7pm the place was packed, so I'd recommend coming by earlier (or making a reservation).

The food is really great! As any good Italian place will do, they start off with bread, which is hot out of the oven and tastes fantastic. It's served with olive oil that tastes better than normal. I went with a pasta and got the Taglierini Verdi (spinach pasta, salmon, pancetta, olives). The pasta is perfectly al dente, chewy and soft, just the way it should be. The salmon was fresh and cooked well. Everything tasted amazing, though it was a little on the oily side.

I'm usually kind of skeptical of fancy Italian places because it often seems like the food should be so much cheaper (C'mon, it's just pasta!). But, as my friend said after dinner, "That was pretty good! I'm actually not that sad that I just paid $17 for lasagna!" And this is considering that both of us got incredibly spoiled by the availability of cheap and delicious Italian food in college.

Come by early after work to avoid waiting and enjoy some fancy Italian comfort food.
author: Brittany C.

description:
i've passed this spot many many times, and it's always packed, and im usually carrying a bunch of groceries from whole foods or my work stuffs, so i've never sat down to eat.  last night a couple girlfriends and i came here after a grueling pilates class, and needed some carbs to refuel!  the restaurant was STILL packed, so we took the last table outside...and ordered a bottle of house red to keep warm. 

we ordered two pizzas and a pasta (they were out of burrata, super disappointing..)..the bread they serve is also super delicious, but i limited myself to one slice because we ordered so much food! ask for the balsamic! food came out quite quickly for the limited space that they operate in, which was awesome. seriously, the kitchen is about the size of my bedroom, so i was really impressed at the quality and speed of the food, and the speed at which we literally devoured everything!  noodles were cooked al dente, and the pizza crust was thin and crispy, ingredients are fresh, and everything smelled and tasted wonderful.

service was comfortable and attentive! legit spot - glad to have tried it.
author: Christina L.

description: We had a wonderful evening at Pazzia! The food was absolutely delicious and the service was wonderful. We enjoyed a delightful visit with the owner. We highly recommend this restaurant and will be back next time we visit San Francisco!
author: Annette M.

description: This place is amazing! I had the salmon plate and MY GOD WAS IT DELICIOUS! Best salmon plate I've ever had, hands down. Service was great, as well as the atmosphere which was very lively. You won't regret coming here.
author: Manny F.

description:
Wow. Just wow. I don't know if it was the fact that I hadn't eaten anything all day or I had never eaten real good Italian food before, but this place really seemed to hit the spot.

It's a quaint little restaurant right on the sidewalk, with elegant outdoor and indoor seating, fancy waiters, and fancier names for their food (that's how you know it's legit). 

Our waiter suggested some great items, we opted to try their pizza and pasta. Honestly, I cannot remember the names of either, but if you showed them the photos I posted, they would totally know what they were. And let me just say, GET WHAT WE GOT. My pasta was so yummy, not too overpowering, and the bread they gave us was delightful to dip in the oil. 

The only complaint I have: they open at 5:30 for dinner. We walked in around 5:20 because their doors were wide open, and they kicked us back out, making us wait for 10 minutes. I understand they are getting things ready still; however, they should shut their doors or at least let us sit down and begin looking over the menu. 

Massimo was there, he's the owner, and he was very genuine and grateful. I appreciated him and his love for a good meal! 

TIPS & TRICKS: 
* As soon as you enter the restaurant, and if there are a lot of tables left, ask to have the furthest one on your right. It's quiet and out of the way.
author: Haley N.

description: Fantastic Italian restaurant in San Fran!! It's small but the service is fantastic and the food is on point. I've never had pasta as fresh, authentic, and flavorful as Pazzia! We ordered off the Specials list - all fresh pastas, made in-house. WOW!!! My spinach pasta with salmon and white wine sauce was great. The salmon was cooked to perfection and the pasta was light, but filling. My dinner companions ordered the lasagna and the pappardelle with meat sauce - two rich dishes that both were extremely satisfied with. We also ordered the gelato and espresso dessert - a delicious end to a wonderful meal!
author: Tash L.

description: One of my favorite place to have dinner in SF! First, Fidelino is probably one of the best pizza maker. If you're looking for a thinner crust Florentine pizza, you have the right place! The pasta are all great; the lasagna is delicious, the salmon dish is unique and the pappardelle bolognese are very popular but my all time favorite are the home made gnocchi  The service is relatively quick and you can even see Noel the chef and Fidelino cook in front of you! It's also important to mention that the products are super fresh and high quality. You'll find a great selection of my all time favorite Italian wines like the Brunello. However what really make this place so special is the owner Massimo, always bringing his good mood to your table. I think people come here over and over again just because of him. Thank you Massimo and the Pazzia team
author: Nour A.

description: Great homemade pasta and bread. I love Italian but can't have garlic and every item was available modified to no garlic for me. Always appreciate that. Would definitely recommend this gem.
author: Kim A.

description:
I was here on a business trip, and my boyfriend claimed this was the best food and bang for buck in SF. I took Uber from the Holiday Inn in Civic center, and was there in 10 mins. The bread was amazingly fresh, the salad was on point, the pasta was to die for, and the tarimaso (sp?) was AMAZING. Its only been one day since I've eaten there, and Im craving to return. Its worth the visit! DO IT!

PS GREAT WINE LIST!
author: Sarah B.

description:
The food here was amazing. Our group had pizzas and linguini and clams and all was top notch and fresh. The bread for the table was freshly baked, and yes, Massimo seated us! 
Definitely a keeper!
author: Robert P.

description: My favorite place to bring people for lunch. You can't go wrong on the menu. Pizzas are delicious. The owner loves his restaurant, his staff, his customers, and his food and it shows each and every time I eat here.
author: Alex L.

description: Went for lunch with work team.  Delicious pizza and pasta.  Both were very fresh and the buratta appetizer was amazing!
author: Angelina G.

description:
This is an authentico Italian restaurant in Soma! There are enough vegetarian options to be satisfied. 

We had the Funghi and Margherita pizza. Both were delicious and perfectly seasoned. The gnocchi was MY FAVORITE. The sauce was amazing and the gnocchi itself was perfect. 

The dessert is a must. We got the tiramisu, great. But, you should get this caramel flan-thing. WHOA. awesome. 

Definitely will be back for more of their pizza.
author: Akshaya V.

description: Just visited Pazzia again after their recent remodel, and I love it. It's so clean and cozy. And of course Massimo is as friendly and welcoming as always.  I even think the food took an upgrade although it was still great before. I love that this place is still going strong after all these years. Truly authentic Italian food.
author: Ms. H.

description: Showed up on a Saturday night while I was in town for a conference. Even though I didn't have a reservation they made room for me, which I really appreciated. I ordered a glass of cabernet, Cesar salad, pappardelle bolognese, and panna cotta to go. The Cesar salad was huge, probably a good size to share. The pappardelle bolognese and panna cotta were soooo good! For SF I thought the prices were good as well, everything I got came out to about $51. The service was superb; the staff works very hard, it was cool to watch them all in action. The owner introduced himself and gave me a complimentary lemoncello which brought me back to my travels along the amalfi coast!!! I will definitely go back and bring the hubby next time!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Food was great! Linguini with clams 
was very yummy! There was no wait on Monday night! I may not recommend for dinner with kids though.  It is suitable for adults who enjoy wine.
author: Silvia J.

description: Very tasty !!! Loved the food!! Recommendation: make a reservation because sitting outside is too cold and away from the warm atmosphere going on inside. We sat outside but it was a good time and we felt lucky to not be turned away .
author: Mari B.

description:
After a road trip to LA filled with lots of drinks and snacks, I was looking for something really hearty for dinner, so we decided to find an Italian restaurant. I work in SoMa so I just Yelped some close-by Italian restaurants. That's when I came across this gem. 

The ambiance is very cozy and once inside, it feels like a little escape from the city. We were greeted very warmly and seated promptly. Then, the goodies started to arrive:

- Bread: Yes...bread. Something so basic yet so delicious! It was so warm and the inside was the perfect amount of fluffiness while the outside was just the right amount of crunchiness. Came with olive oil only so we had to ask for balsamic but the service here is great so they brought it right away. It was so good and I was so hungry that we ate it all and I was almost full by the time we were done with the bread. Oops! 
- Lasagna: It came in a perfect dish and was very warm and delicious. Only thing is that I felt it was a bit oily and watery. Would've liked mine a bit more baked but otherwise good.
- Tortellini: The sauce was very good and the tortellini was good as well. Nothing that really blew my mind but it was overall satisfying.
- White chocolate lemon cake: Yum! I think my favorite parts of the meal was the bread and dessert. The cake had the perfect balance of lemon and chocolate. It wasn't too lemony or chocolatey. Wonderful!  

Overall, I liked the ambiance and the service was AMAZING. Our waiter was so friendly and very very attentive. Never forgot to give us anything we asked for. My favorite part - when we were leaving, he gave each of us A HANDSHAKE AND HUG! He made us feel like we were long lost friends having dinner in his home. =)
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I'm Native San Franciscan always get ripped off tourist trap in little Italy ?
I found this place by accident a few years ago coming from the ballpark. I live in Maui when I come the city or a ball game . 
To say this is my favorite restaurant in the city is a large statement. The prices are crazy reasonable. The food is excellent 
Good job some times service is slow and it get dam busy
author: Mike P.

description:
Not bad pizza at all.

The crust wasn't my favorite, too crunchy and thin to be called an Italian pizza.

Toppings were great! Full but not overpacked of good quality ingredients.

Very good professional service.

I walked out happy.
Recommended, even if you are not just around the block
author: Max F.

description: Super authentic Italian food, cozy atmosphere, the lasagne is rich & meaty - highly recommend!
author: Victoria Y.

description: Loud, crowded, and unfriendly staff, although we did visit on a Saturday night. The food is great but portions are small.
author: Daniel T.

description:
I've been going to Pazzia for years. I try to get there every time I return to SF.  
The bread that they serve is great but it's the thin-crust pizzas that make my family and I return over to this restaurant over and over.
It can be tough getting in sometimes but I typically just go earlier than I normally would.
Meals are not cheap but they are SF-prices.
author: Judd J.

description:
I love this place! 

Owners and servers remember your name and faces and give such hospitable service in hosting you!

The food is delicious as well. I prefer all the pasta dishes and appetizers are fresh as well. The chefs in the back work quickly and efficiently. Prices are reasonable and they stay open pretty late for this area at night.

Always a great place but can get very stuffy and busy. Hopefully the next door expansion is still in the works to give us customers a little extra dining space .
author: April G.

description:
Paxil is great - had Han excellent pizza with prosciutto done the right way(re: not baked, layered on top afterwards) stringy cheese pizza is always a plus!

Massimo, the owner, was super welcoming and made the experience from great to awesome!

Don't miss out (:
author: Loren C.

description: Friendly and attentive service. Delicious house-made pastas... had paperdelli and ravioli -- great! Like being in Tuscany
author: Goone B.

description: After walking past this place every day for 2+ years, I finally had dinner at Pazzia. I wish I went sooner because everything we had was great! The bread they bring to the table is warm and fresh, and the house red wine was really good. We ordered burrata, sausage pizza, and the ravioli - all were fantastic. Will definitely be going back! It's an Italian gem in the middle of busy soma.
author: Kathleen W.

description: This place was great. Small, great food. We walked in without a reservation but they were still able to squeeze us in. Super friendly staff too!
author: Dylan P.

description: This is one of my go-to places for a sit-down lunch. It's only a few blocks from our office, accommodates large groups, usually has space at noon, and, most importantly of all, the food is really good. Pizzas and pastas here are fantastic (I've tried most of them at this point) - my favorites are the arugula and prosciutto pizza and the pasta with shrimp and asparagus. The service is really friendly as well.
author: Wing Y.

description: We wandered in on a whim. Within 10 minutes of sitting down, the place was packed. The margarita pizza was great as was the pappardelle with bolognese sauce. Price was very reasonable and the service was fantastic. Definitely try it.
author: John G.

description: Just a down home honest Italian cooking great time at this restaurant.  We came with a party of 6 and the cozy dining hall was packed, all the while the owner Massimo was coming from table to table greeting and entertaining his guests.  Excellent pizza, great pasta dishes, and Massimo's wine suggestions are excellent!  Great meal!
author: Larry B.

description:
Great & attentive service, yet bland food. This would be the shortest summary. Located on 3rd street, neighboring other decent food options, Pazzia is a medium-sized restaurant with some seating outside. As the staff is Italian & decor is nice, it gives you authentic feel. 
As for the food, you have pizza, pasta and some entrees. Everything pretty standard, so don't expect anything delicious or gross - it's just average.
author: Piotr G.

description:
One of my all time favorite Italian restaurants. Very cozy and intimate although they are in the process of expanding. Some of the best authentic home made Italian food you will have. The pizzas make a delicious appetizer. We usually get the margherita. The have a pizza special which usually worth trying.  I've also had the lasagna which is delicious. Served extremely hot! I've also had the roasted chicken which I avoid as it's been dry in the past. 
The owner Massimo is an amazing host and spends a lot of time socializing with his guests. 
I go to San francisco about twice a year and make sure to eat at Pazzia every time!
author: Nick R.

description:
This small, unassuming lunch spot delivered mad salads and pizzas with the quickness to our (walk-in) party of six on a Monday at noon.

Quick highlights:

Margherita 'za = all the yes, again + again 
Beet salad = totally solid
Short and to the point beer list
No frills, no fuss and AOK service
author: Rachel F.

description: Everything my wife and I love about Italy was personified in this restaurant. The food was out of this world (I had the homemade lasagna).  The staff treat you like long lost relatives. Mossimo, the owner/general manager was warm and friendly beyond compare.  The waitress staff (Vanna?) literally picked up my two year old girl and showed her the kitchen and how they make their pizza (even gave her a free slice).  My girl was in heaven.  If this restaurant has any negative reviews, I attribute those to customers with mental health issues.  My daughter left with a matchbook car toy...her parents left with giant smiles and content bellies.
author: Jamie D.

description:
Best F@#$%^& Lasagna in SF.
And maybe the USA...
And maybe better than my Grandmas...No, No, shes gone now, that's disrespectful.
Definitely better than my Moms. 

I have been coming here for over 5+ years and it is one of my favorite spots in the city.

This is not pizza hut. GTFO.
author: Alyjaa S.

description: This is my favorite Italian spot in sf!! Always so good!!! Make sure you try this spot, Massimo the owner is such an amazing host, treats everyone like they are guests in his home.
author: Micah B.

description:
When arriving here on a late night walk, after sailing. It was so worth the walk. We arrived perfect timing, a line of people behind us walking. The name on the outside made me think of just pizza - but "Pazzia" had so many choices to choose from. I enjoyed my three courses, and sharing my friends food also. Sampling each other plates in our group, every bite made you wanting more. 

I seen this small place, as a diamond in the rough. The owner said he was in process of being expanded. After sampling, food, drinks, and service that says it all. The two hours we hung out eating and enjoying our friends company. The restaurant never had a slow period, when someone would leave, their seats were filled again. Even when the line was getting longer they found more chairs, and made room for the non-stop crowd.

The night was beautiful in San Francisco for this time of year. The food was so good, every bite made you wanting more (loved the ravioli) . The owner came outside area to see how our dinner was, then he checked again later on us. The waitress gave us excellent service, to make sure every detail was taken care of. 

I can't wait for my next visit, and the new addition should be complete. I am looking forward to trying this place again soon.
author: Nancy D.

description: Noisy and busy for lunch. They brought out fresh warm bread for an appetizer. I ordered the angel hair pasta. It was great!
author: Lindsay L.

description: Fantastic place!! Massimo is a hands on owner. Food is great! Atmosphere is nice too. It's a MUST whenever I travel here to SF from Michigan!
author: Char V.

description:
Love this place! I've had most dishes in their menu, lasagna, pasta with salmon and ravioli are favorites but their pizza is also great.

The ingredients are fresh, staff is friendly although bust at times. A great place to go for some really good italian food, both for lunch and dinner.
author: Louise S.

description: This was excellent. Great atmosphere. The food was so good. Daughter had spaghetti and it was good. Husband and I split mussel appetizer and a pizza. It was excellent!!!! Highly recommend reservations for the weekend. Will definitely go back.
author: Violet F.

description:
We were craving pasta - and finally remembered that Pazzia is a delicious neighborhood option. So we decided to walk over to see if there would a table open to seat us.

They were so accommodating and sat us right away. Let me start off with how amazing the smell of the food is... definitely is a huge attraction when walking by.

This was our second time, I had the lasagna again (creature of habit), and the bf had the spaghetti with clams. We started with a ceaser salad, oh and most importantly a bottle of wine. I was very curious about their house white selection, the waiter said we can sample it. It was good! We ordered a bottle.

They bring home made bread with impeccable olive oil to start.

Will have to visit soon to try the pizza.
author: yana Z.

description: Food is very good, prices are great for what you get, but service can either be excellent or extremely slow. I'm always a mix of very excited to eat here, but leery of how much time it's going to take.
author: Brian B.

description:
When walking down 3rd St, don't miss this nice trattoria restaurant and its friendly owner Massimo. This small, hole in the wall place resides under an apartment complex so it doesn't stand out initially. However, it tends to be crowded comparatively to Osha Thai up the street. Therefore, be prepared to wait a while because its neighborhood popularity. 

When eating here, you can see why Pazzai is popular. The servers were on point checking in every five to seven minutes even at maximum capacity with only two waiters working. When scanning the room the dimly lit room, you will notice the impressionist art on the wall above the kitchen window, which gives the restaurant a nice romantic feel. In addition, the outdoor seating is nice on a warm evening. 

Now for the food. Though I'm not a pizza crust expert, the crust here is crisp enough to give the pizza a nice chew, but not enough to make the crust crumble. Additionally, if you like oily cheese, then the pizzas are for you. Personally, I recommend the Alla Diavola (especially if your a meat lover). If you want something else, Pazzai's has pennette, pomodoro, fusilli, and rigatoni pastas with a variety of sauces. Protein options are available too. 

Overall, I recommend this small pizza place if you want something quieter with a nice atmosphere to discuss business over a meal.
author: Blake W.

description: Came here for a group lunch and was pleasantly surprised how they quickly they were able to handle such a large group, but the food is where I felt like they fell short on. We got 4 pizzas, with 2 where very mushy from too much cheese and two that were perfect. I would recommend this place for lunch... just their pizzas can be a hit or miss.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Pizza or Pasta?  Pizza or Calzone?  The menu here has some really good things, and I had a tough time deciding (that's a good thing).  Better yet, I decided to share a pasta and calzone with friend so we could try two different things, and both were quite good.  The Calzone was big (tall/airy) and very thin/crispy which provided a good light meal.  The pasta was good too and hit the spot.  I started with a cup of the Minestrone zuppa which was also quite good. The Wine was not too pricey by the glass either.  

Only warning is that this is a very ....very...small place, so plan accordingly, especially since it is so close to Moscone Center.
author: Dan M.

description: My sister introduced me to this restaurant last night and it was a winner!  Packed at 9 pm on a Monday night, there are clearly a lot of satisfied diners who come back again and again. I had the lamb chops (Agnello) medium rare with spinach and broccoli.  Beautiful flavor on the lamb. Garlic, but not too much - it doesn't overwhelm the lamb. Finished with a glass of Limoncello- I felt like I was back in Italy!  Try it, you'll like it.
author: Tim K.

description: They're back!!!  Lovely as ever - the newly remodeled space is beautiful!  Same great food and service. Massimo is a wonderful and engaging host. Love his new space and you will too!!!
author: Taress H.

description:
On a fairly busy block of Third Street lives Pazzia Restaurant & Pizzeria, a casual, yet charming, Italian restaurant.

The decor of the dining room is nothing to write home about, but one does not go to Pazzia to be in awe of the art on the walls; one goes to experience some artful Italian home cooking.

The rich, fresh burrata and proscuitto appetizer was worth the extra calories and, cooked perfectly al dente, the clam pasta was delicious.  With just the right amount of char on the crust, the huge thin crust fungi and sausage pizza was topped generously, but was quite soggy in the center, making it difficult to eat. The rigatoni with meat balls was rich, tender, and zesty--definitely a dish to take the chill off a summer night in The City.

Desserts include an uber-creamy tiramisu (yum), and a carmel flan (meh).  The small, but adequate, wine list is fairly priced for San Francisco.  Do not expect trophy bottles, but rather some rather pedestrian suggestions that nonetheless complement the food.

The owner, Massimo, and the wait staff were friendly and attentive.  A downside was that the restroom is located in the kitchen area.  Hopefully with the planned remodel and expansion this ill will be cured.

If you need a fix of Italian food and can't get to North Beach, Pazzia Restaurant & Pizzeria has you covered.
author: CJ G.

description:
Hot starter bread with olive oil + Thin crust pizza + Fun crew = happy faces

Another plus: they got a good ambience. 
 
Thank you for taking a good care of us even walking in 10 minutes before the closing time. 

Will return.
author: Seiko I.

description:
Let's begin with the bread they serve you at the beginning of the meal. Soft, doughy, and just the right amount of chewy. I think I went through a basket on my own! The bread was a pretty good indicator of how the rest of the meal would go. I was on cloud nine.  

The clam spaghetti here is buttery parsley goodness! Another must-order is the lasagna with it's flavorful and cheesy layers! Yum!!!!  

It's up there for a good carby lunch during the work week!

Ambiance is a bit lacking so I wouldn't take a dinner date here.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I finally decided to come here because of the awesome ratings. We came here on a Friday night and it was super packed to the max!! 

We ordered the mushroom and sausage pizza with arugula. It was pretty good. The pizza was super thin crusted and the flavor was ok. The ravioli was way too cheesy. I'm also not a huge fan of pink sauce but my friend really enjoyed it. The best dish was probably the spaghetti with sun dried tomato in olive oil. Could have definitely use some more sauce. I felt like I could have cooked it myself way better. 
The tiramisu was one of the worst I've ever had. The cake didn't even tasted like coffee. Tasted more like a vanilla sponge cake.  My friend thought it tasted average.

Overall, price wasn't  too bad and was super affordable. Eat dish was less than $20. However, customer service was great. They kept refilling our waters and made sure all our needs were met.  They were extremely friendly.  

I probably wouldn't come back again but it was good to try once

5 stars for service
3 stars for food
Overall 3.5 stars
author: Vivian N.

description: I can't say enough about the food at Pazzia. Every time I've been in - and it now dates back to 8 years or so that I've been eating there - the food is delicious and fresh, from the soft warm bread with olive oil that's placed on the table when you sit down, to the incredible pasta and just-like-Italy pizza (Diavola is my favorite). Highly recommend this for a SOMA lunch or dinner, a great spot close to Moscone Center during a convention. You won't be disappointed.
author: Matt S.

description: Seriously, amazing!! We had a great experience and service was really good! The food is absolutely to die for. Real Italian food, home made. We had the pizza and gnocchi and lasagna. I can't even say which was best bc it was all equally good. The manager came and greet us and the place was full! He came and made a table to serve us. Definitely coming back!
author: Monique R.

description:
When I'm craving pasta, I go to Pazzia! Their restaurant is pretty small so you should call in advance for seats if you're a party of 2 or more. I've had a few of their dishes now. 

In order of my favorite:

1. Spaghetti vongole! YUM YUM YUM YUM. They give you a ton of clams! 

2.  Beef ragu with pappardelle noodles. It's SO good. I also always ask for extra mushrooms. 

3. Penne with mushrooms. It's super flavorful but a little too creamy for someone who can only have a little bit of dairy. 

Their bread also has a hint of salt on it. LOVE.
author: Julia A.

description:
We had a late dinner here on Saturday night. Even though it was past 9, there was still a wait for a table. This space is pretty small, and clearly popular.

I asked the server if we could go get a drink and come back (I appreciate that a lot of restaurants let you do this.) She put us on the list for a reservation in 30 minutes, which worked out perfectly.

We were brought bread immediately, it was good, but i had to save to room for the meal.

We asked the server what her favorites were, and we ended up sharing: margherita pizza with spicy sausage and homemade gnocchi. 
The pizza was good, but not my favorite.I prefer margherita pizza with the slices of fresh mozzarella versus the cheese that makes it feel like a standard cheese pizza.
The gnocchi was AMAZING. I'm not a big gnocchi fan, but my husband loves it. Unfortunately, very few places make a good gnocchi. This pick was a VERY good choice.

The server knew were sharing , and the kitchen plated it in two bowls. I was thinking we were going to get a split plate charge on the bill, but we didn't. How surprisingly nice!

The gnocchi was cooked perfectly, had great flavor, and I loved the spicy red sauce it came in. There was also a slice of fresh mozzarella on top. I would go back just for this dish.

Service was attentive, and food came at a good pace. Prices for food, as well as wine and beer were reasonable.

I would definitely return.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Before you read this, you should know that I was on a very hetero date eating carbs, so my memory may be off.  Italian food always makes me a little loosey goosey.

My boyfriend proposed we go to the San Francisco Auto Show at Moscone.  Yikes, I don't even have an outfit for an auto show!  I dressed as a mechanic for Halloween one year but hEllO, that costume would get me thrown right out of any Goodyear.  So after finding black leather pants and a long-sleeve that only Bon Jovi would wear, I set off on my date night, which started with Pazzia.

We were welcomed with a big smile and placed at a corner table by the window.  Fabulous little dimly-lit bistro, and fabulous view of the trashy people walking down 3rd Street.  When the server read the specials (literally took like 5 minutes, they have SO many specials), I settled on the burrata as an appetizer.  Delicious as always, I love burrata.  My boyfriend didn't.  Don't worry, I dumped him after the auto show. (kidding)., wait-are you reading this?

How was the rest of the food?  Oh ya.  Seafood risotto was delicious, boyfriend a pizza... and I had a little fruit tart for dessert which was--oh--a very nice fruit tart.  You really can't screw up a fruit tart, afterall.  My boyfriend had a lovely tiramasu, but packed with calories.  Yikes!  I nearly split my leather pants before dinner was over

Service at Pazzia is unbelievable.  You'd think Octo-mom pumped out 8 waiters and they're all responsible for your table.  The manager came up twice to see how we're doing.  

My leather pants survived, barely. I'll be back.
author: Jeri T.

description:
We have walked by Pazzia too many times (we're Giants season ticket holders). Last night needing to lift our spirits we stopped in after the game.  Absolute perfection! We shared an incredible Rigatoni con Salsiccia, my main was the Chicken Funghi with Marsala, and the hubby ordered the Veal Scaloppine. Everything prepared fresh, served hot and plentiful portions. We shared a very nice bottle of Italian white and finished this off with a slice of Tiramisu. 

The owner is hands on and very welcoming.   This is very much a neighborhood gathering spot, and at 9:30 in the evening on a Tuesday was full. 

The Giants may have blown their lead in the 9th, but Pazzia, you comforted our soul.
author: Vicky W.

description: I was in a rush and very hungry when I stopped in the pizzeria. I order a margherita pizza. It was simply delicious, very different from those american pizzas. It was very similar to an italian pizza, great cheese and fresh basil. The service was very good and fast and the price, fair.
author: Andrey V.

description: First time trying this place.  It was agony sitting and waiting for my order.  The smells of all the different dishes surrounding me was dreamy.
author: Nicole R.

description: Outstanding food, outstanding service. A very warm reception from the owner and staff. Be prepared to wait a bit if you haven't made reservations. Tables are very close together but unless you have a real issue with that, you are in for a treat. I had the minestrone capellini special and my wife had the gnocchi. We shared cheesecake for dessert. The man at the next table had a calzone that was the size of a football and he loved it.
author: John M.

description: I love this place because the food is excellent, clean and nice staff.  Whether pizza or pasta or other dishes...all great and I can recommend as one of my favorite "go to" restaurants for food food and service!
author: Danny H.

description: This place is amazing! Was recommended to us and we absolutely loved it! The owner greets you as you enter the door! The food is amazing! So delicious!! Definitely stopping by every time I'm in town!
author: Yesenia M.

description:
Overpriced, servers were nice but food came out so slowly.

The bruschetta on crunchy toast was nothing to write home about.  I had the fettuccine with asparagus and prawns for $18, but the prawns were not fresh, and the sauce and fettuccine were not tasty!  My friend had the ravioli, which was a tiny portion and she was still hungry after.

Their fresh warm bread was the most delicious part of the meal.
author: Letitia L.

description:
I have to admit I was expecting a lot more from Pazzia since I heard good things about the place recently. But alas, the menu is just not very interesting here, and the execution borders a bit on the lazy. As a matter of fact, I came on a particularly lazy day, the day after Thanksgiving, when nobody was in the FiDi. I took two colleagues for a leisurely lunch there, and no one else was in the place at noon. 

We shared an order of the $6 Bruschetta, which is normally a can't-lose at a real Italian restaurant. While I had no complaints about the fresh chopped tomatoes and basil on top, the toast underneath looked to be just a slice of wheat toast rather than a crunchy baguette (see photo). That just seemed so wrong. Better was the $13.25 Fusilli Alle Melanzane, a rather unadorned pasta dish with a barely there tomato sauce, basil and chunks of eggplant and mozzarella, which oddly looked and almost tasted like bits of butter (see photo). 

But frankly I think I could have made that at home. In fact, I think I did make that at home. One of my colleagues ordered the $9 Insalata Medici with Belgian endives, rucola, pears, walnuts, Gorgonzola cheese and balsamic vinaigrette dressing (see photo). Even with the addition of chicken strips, there was nothing too extraordinary about it. Listen, with the much superior La Briciola down on the next block of 3rd, I don't think there's much reason to venture here unless you really want to eat like you never left your kitchen. 

FOOD - 3 stars...like you never left home...seriously! 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...quite bright and open, especially when it's empty 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...she was pretty...and efficient 
TOTAL - 3 stars...not bad but kinda meh for Italiano
author: Ed U.

description: This restaurant is such a gem! Their homemade pasta is amazing as well as the service. It is really a special place :)
author: Jennifer G.

description:
So the service was a bit slow; it took a long time for the servers to take my credit card and then it took a long time for them to get it back to me (which never makes one feel comfortable).  I suspect this was because the waiters were fawning over two ladies who were sitting next to us.

The gnochi pasta was pretty boring.
The argula and proscuito pizza was good though.
The medici salad was pretty good too, but nothing that special.

I'd come here only if you want Pizza and are ok with sometimes slow service.
author: Charles S.

description:
I'm a little biased when it comes to this review because my boyfriend lives upstairs, so we come here ALL the time and just keep coming back (because it's so easy to do so, and we just love it THAT much.) But Pazzia is one of my favourite Italian restaurants because it's so authentic and delicious. If you are looking for an Italian restaurant that is decent with their prices, and has a range of food-- DO IT. 

The service is always top-notch here. But beware, because they're always busy and crowded. My best suggestion is to call the night of, at least half an hour to an hour ahead of when you want to actually eat there, and make a reservation for the time. That way you don't need to wait 30 minutes outside, because there is no real "waiting" area-- you will be stuck in the rain and the elements if it's not ideal out. 

 I really come here for the appetisers. The burrata here never disappoints. It's always thick, creamy and delicious. My boyfriend and I fight over the last piece before deciding that we need to "split everything evenly." And it comes with prosccuito di parma on the side. It's absolutely delicious and provides a great headstart to the meal.  I've never had the pizza here, so I cannot review on that. I always get the handmade pastas, or some pasta. I've had pretty much the entire range of pastas here and loved all of them, so I can't complain. My favourites have been the lasagna and the gnocchi. My boyfriend really likes the pizza, and can't finish a whole pizza by himself (though I'm sure if we didn't get the appetisers, he would definitely scarf the entire pizza down.) The lasagna here is made with bechamel sauce, so if you're imagining a purely tomato and meat sauce based lasagna, you might be a little disappointed. I'm not normally a fan of lasagna, so the fact that I like it here means it's fantastic.
author: Christa Lei S.

description: Great Italian restaurant run by an Italian family. They're even better after the recent renovation. Highly recommend.
author: Shawn S.

description:
This review is in relation to the manager of the restaurant who, under the stress of New Years, lost it on customers instead of maintaining courtesy and valuing customer service.
We were kept waiting outside for 20mins past our reservation time and when I went to ask him, visibly upset, when our table will be ready as the customers were done but just sat at the table for 10mins - he walked me back outside and literally yelled at me and my friends.
His exact words: "you want me to kick them out?? Don't give me any stress!!! This is not the post office - you wait, you don't like it?? Deal with it!"

I understand that New Years is a busy and stressful time - but that attitude and obnoxious, arrogant behaviour was not something I've ever experienced in my life - even in crappy corner shops.
Common courtesy would have been a basic civil apology for the delay and a generic "we'll get to you as soon as possible"

We immediately left and had dinner at a wonderful Thai restaurant next door called osha where the staff was courteous and wonderful.

Definitely will not be going back and will be telling all my friends about this encounter.

Customer service goes a long way in determining loyalty to a restaurant.
Piazza definitely lost it before we even tried it.
author: Nouf A.

description:
It was an awkward night. The restaurant was crowded; people who didn't have reservations were getting angry at the hostess. Since there's no place to wait, we were all either standing inside (in the way) or out in the cold (freezing). The woman in front of me had the tag still hanging from her recently-purchased sweater and toilet paper stuck to her shoe. En route to the ladies' room I nearly bowled over the busboy, since the bathroom is located smack in the middle of the bustling kitchen. I requested a corner table but was told that the "owner sits there;" the runner-up option, for which I patiently waited, was bogarted by a couple who seated themselves without asking the hostess - she had to ask them to move. They gave me violent glares when I sat down, even though they scored another table within minutes. 

Despite the never-ending awkwardness, the staff were professional. They didn't get annoyed with the couples clamoring for seats, the lack of aisle space, or the patrons clogging the doorway. The hostess & waitress were instead patient and sweet. They seated me at the apparently controversial table I'd requested, made sure I had bread and wine - a bottle of the house red is only $30 - and managed not to glare at me for being a pain in the arse. I appreciated that.

Perhaps my expectations were too high, but the food was disappointing. The special was pappardelle in pesto sauce with salmon and artichokes; since pappardelle is my favorite type of pasta and I'm a pesto fiend, it was a no-brainer. The only problem was that the pesto was - gasp! - bland. Bland basil? What happened to the garlic? What happened to the flavor?? Life becomes depressing when good Italian food goes awry. My friend loved his meal - linguine with clams and mussels - so perhaps it was an off night for the pesto. We started getting dirty looks for overstaying our welcome, and when I started to feel like I was back in NYC we decided to leave. Sad story. Next time I have a craving for Italian food I'll visit my elderly Italian neighbor instead!
author: Ray J.

description:
Pazzia has been hit or miss for me, but let's go with hit. 

I usually get one of their pizzas or their bolognese. Both are good--pizza-wise, I dig the mushroom/arugula/prosciutto pizza. 

Their bread is usually good, and their olive olio is damn tasty.

Can get busy and hard to get a seat, so reservations are a pro move.

The good: good food, usually doesn't take too long. Also, a solid wine list. Everyone there seems to speak Italian, I dig it.

The bad: I've seen lipstick smudges wiped off of clean wine glasses by the waitstaff. Wasn't super excited about that.
author: Amanda B.

description: Loved this place!  Such great service and food. The owner takes his time with everyone and is very friendly. We had the carpaccio, margarita pizza and pappardelle and loved all of it. So glad we took the recommendation of the hotel we are at and come here. It's a real gem!
author: Michele I.

description: Good food, terrible service. Reservation for 3 was held at a table of 2. Took 15mins to get the waiter for order, forgot drinks. Food was brought in a good time and tasted great, though pricy. Took around 20mins to get check. Had to go to counter, discuss about drinks and wait for waiter to white out bill and adjust... over all I hope they get more than one waiter to handle Friday night rush
author: Marco E.

description: Had the chicken caesar last night. Great food and excellent service!
author: Tauasa T.

description: Adriano is the best! The lasagna was excellent and so was the service! The daviolo pizza was delicious.  I highly recommend this place!
author: Samantha S.

description:
4/18/13 Dinner

Pazzia thrives silently on 3rd Street their original location. My first time here was 10 years ago, and over the years I have returned for their very delicious, thin-crust pizza with fresh ingredients. I'm happy that Pizzeria's overdue expansion is finally happening soon.

On this Thursday night I'm glad I called and made a reservation. The place was packed shortly after we were seated at 7pm. Owner Massimo is bubbly, greeting regulars and talking up a storm all over the place. You know this is the real deal when Italian people actually eat here, and order in Italian.

*Margherita Pizza:  this has been my favorite. It's simple, fresh, and tasty. Unlike American-style pizza, Pazzia's crust is very thin, and the edge crispy. Cheese is not overpowering and is thinly glazed on the dough. Fresh basil is the reason I always get this pizza.

*Rigatoni with meat balls: Cooked perfectly, al dente, meat balls tender and zesty. Couldn't be done better.

Pazzia dishes out authentic Italian cuisine. Their pizzas are not loaded with a million toppings, think about three toppings at most. Pasta is actually home-made here. Food is simple, tasty and unpretentious. It's a hidden secret in a city full of Italian restaurants that serve American-Italian food.
author: Matt Y.

description:
A group of 6 walked through the persistent rain to get to the place simply to satisfy our craving for Italian food. And it didn't disappoint. 

We got started with some nice fluffy bread with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. The pasta was good too (my friends had those). I personally went for the dish with chicken breast and knew it was going to be great. It didn't disappoint!

Service was good too. Though the place was a little tight during the lunch hour. Overall a good place still for good authentic Italian food!
author: Kenny L.

description: Small space but excellent service and food!  I had the spaghetti vongole and have to say it was one of the best I've ever had.  It was so good I am craving it right now!  I was surprised there were so many servers given the restaurant was not large but we were always promptly attended to and you can't complain about that.  I would absolutely come back!  P.S. - Generous pours of wine! :)
author: Emi N.

description: Great food, good service, not a long wait for the kitchen to produce........very good and will definitely be back. DavetheCM
author: Dave F.

description:
wow, what a gem of a place! I've walked by Pazzia so many times. It's completely unassuming and doesn't scream authenticity, but please don't judge a book by it's cover....which admittedly I've been doing for 3 years. I finally went there for lunch and wow is it amazing!

Fresh pasta, ragu, salads and the owners and servers are ITALIAN....like preggo after everything. Man, I love this place! I'm dreaming of pasta as I write this :)
author: LAIKA K.

description: Simply the friendliest service and the most wonderful authentic Italian food I've ever had
author: Vinh N.

description: Delicious food! Great service!!!! Authentic Italian food!!! Loved it!  It doesn't look like much because of the strip mall feel but they definitely deliver!
author: Deanna S.

description: I have been to many Italian restaurants in DC, San Francisco, all over the US in fact....I would say this restaurant comes the closest to authentic Italian cuisine that I've had while living in Verona and Bardolino Italy.  Truly delicious.
author: Chi H.

description: Service was excellent. Pappardelle was the best ever. And if you haven't had the lasagna it is absolutely the best. We will be back as often as possible!
author: Danna H.

description:
Love this place!  Warm, family style restaurant with great service that makes you feel all warm inside (just like the food)!  Comfort food at its best.  I go back for these items:

Lasagna 

Any of the salads

Any of the Pizzas

Located near the corner of 3rd and Folsom this is a great location in SOMA to visit while you are in SF
author: Christina K.

description: Small little store front in a strip mall. Unassuming. Could easily walk past it, but had a superb dish of pasTa. Also had the lemon cake, that was a little underwhelming, but the tortellini made up for it. Good italian wine too and reasonable price point. I would go back.
author: J. Denise P.

description:
Where can one find the best pizza in San Francisco?

It might be right here. 

An Italian restaurant actually owned and run by an Italian. The owner is from Florence and comes from a family of restauranteurs back in the old country. He brought his expertise across the Atlantic and built this absolute gem of dining experience. 

The service is OUTSTANDING! And attention to detail cannot be beat.

Now back to those pizzas. Yes, they are truly a work of art. Thin crust, perfect mix ingredients and flavor. I cannot believe it's taken me so long to find this perfect pie.

We were treated like regulars, noo! make that like FAMILY! Our server asked if we were here to celebrate something special. We were not, but still she made sure to bring out a complimentary slice of tiramisu. Now that tiramisu is crack, the first is one free but I will be over dosing on one of those again soon!
author: V B.

description:
Four stars for the food, but only two for the service, so we'll break it even at 3. 

The pasta is delicious and fresh, and I've had it several ways. Favorites are the pomodoro and the al vongole. The clams they are use are small and succulent, and neither dish is overly heavy, while still being nicely portioned. 

The bread they serve is amazing. Seriously. 

But the service has been so shoddy lately. It always seems they are down one or two waitstaff, and it really shows. The last two times, it took my admittedly slighty large parties (once 6, once 7) over an hour and a half to get in and out. Drink orders took forever, food orders took forever, and our dishes were all brought out at different times. 

The last time I was there, they did realize they were having a problem, and gave us two free tiramisu desserts--which were delicious. 

In any event, I hope speed improves, otherwise I won't be able to keep coming during work hours.
author: Allison S.

description: As an Italian, I have to say this place was very convincing. The food is not too far from authentic Italian savors. And the grappa is really good!
author: R G.

description:
I love Pazzia!  I first heard about it on Check Please Bay Area.  We've been there twice in the last 6 months.  On both occasions, the food and service were excellent.  We started off with the Burrata appetizer.  It's simple and absolutely delicious.  They have just the right touch of olive oil and seasoning on the cheese and arugula.  

The servers we had the first time made you feel at home.  They also had great advice on the food and wine.  I had a traditional pasta dish with red sauce (I don't remember which one) - it was delicious.  

When we went there a few days ago, we had a different server.  She was also very attentive and friendly.  She suggested two wines and let us taste a sample of each one.  We ended up with a great wine.  I had the Pollo alla Medici - a baked chicken breast with Marsala sauce.  The chicken was cooked perfectly - tender, juicy, and excellent flavor.  

Their pizza looks excellent.  I haven't tried it, but I can't wait to go back and give it a shot!
author: Paul G.

description:
We came on a Saturday night and it was super busy. They were extremely friendly and nice - and you could tell they cared. 

The homemade pasta was excellent - including the lasagna. The mushroom pizza was also great. Unfortunately the cheese pizza was a little under down, and not at all crispy.  The tiramisu was excellent

The bigger issue was they were so crowded all of the food came out at different times. They were very sorry, but then we weren't all eat in together. 

They seem to be expanding next door - hope they can adjust to more people, and keep the kitchen consistent
author: Jon H.

description:
The lasagna is okay but not amazing.  The pizza was quite good.  The tiramisu was strangely unblended -- some of the ladyfingers did not taste right.

The gnocchi was too dense.  The ravioli sauce was delicious.  The burrata was good but no better than I could make by opening a packet from Bi Rite.

I don't think I would come back.
author: Niniane W.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was and how good the overall experience was. This place was a lot more authentic than anticipated, with home made pasta and actual Italian wait staff. I was there for an 8 person birthday dinner party and they treated us very well, kept our glasses full, and didn't once act annoyed or bothered by our party's size, despite the restaurant being rather small.

I shared tortellini in a cream sauce and rack of lamb with roasted potatoes and broccoli. Both were really good, and we kept swapping plates so that we could eat our share of both dishes. The lamb was cooked to perfection, exactly medium as requested (but they default to medium rare if you don't ask). 

Prices were also quite reasonable, and they affordable wine options. Overall an excellent dining experience and a good go-to place for Italian in SOMA/FIDI area.
author: Jordan C.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco stumbled last night. I had the fettuccine with shrimp and asparagus; but it contained only three shrimp. I get more than twice that number in a taco from Dos Amigos. In addition, the fettuccine was clumpy.  All in all, not really an $18 dish. I've had this dish here at least a dozen times and this was an epic fail.  

Ordinarily I would have complained, but I'm a little shy and everyone on the staff was super nice.
author: David B.

description:
Absolutely everything yon want from a "family" sort of Italian place. Laura our server was great, remembered our names all evening, offered great suggestions and always had a smile. The buffalo mozzarella dish as an appetizer was the freshest I have ever tasted. My calzone was the size of a bus, but I missed the boat on my order when I sampled a coworkers gnocchi. The lasagna also looked like another reason to go back. All in all, super fresh flavors, wonderful service and great atmosphere.

The only downside was if you sit inside, the oven makes the whole place HOT. Choose outside if at all possible.
author: Mark C.

description: Oh my gosh best Italian restaurant in San Francisco! The pizza is amazing! Ambience is great. I really can't say anything negative at all about this adorable little place!
author: Mara R.

description:
This is a very inviting restaurant with excellent service.  It was packed on a Thursday night and everything we had was very good--especially the bread to start things off.  This one is a keeper!

Tutto era molto buono.
Penso che ho ingrassato. Un chilo ma sono sazio!
Avevamo pasta e una pizza.
Hanno avuto entrambi funghi è salsiccia.
La mia pasta avuto le melanzane. E era fantastico.
Non vedo l'ora a tornare.

author: Thomas D.

description:
What a beautiful experience! It was a Saturday night and I had just finished Paint Nite with 3 of my friends at 7pm. I called Pazzia's and they were able to find and save us a table that would be ready at 7:30.  We arrived a bit early and were given glasses of white wine while we waited.  The restaurant is small but has an airy feel thanks to an entire wall being floor to ceiling windows to the sidewalk.

The service is excellent and so is the food.  The staff is like a family as they sat together talking and sipping wine as the last two tables of customers finished their conversation and cleared out. A very comfortable restaurant for a casual meal.

I really enjoy coming here!
author: Karen L.

description: The prices advertised online are half of the real prices. The waiter told us she dis knew about it but nevertheless didn't say anything when we ordered on the phone. This is a scam. We ended up paying but should not have. There are numerous as good and cheaper pizzerias less than one block away. Dont go there
author: Guillaume S.

description:
Pazzia in Italian means "madness".  Such a fitting name for a small mom and pop type of restaurant.  The owner, Massimo, is originally from Italy and looks like Fabio, just skinnier and with grey hair.  You'll immediately spot him once you walk in and he'll give you a handshake.  I came with a crew of 20, basically filled up the place and damn, we were such a disturbance to the other first dates going on around us.  But Massimo loved it and he embraced our demeanor with his restaurant's name.

As for the food, top class.  You can taste the freshness in the ingredients which reminds me of when I lived in Italy.  Italians like their food basic, none of that Bucca di Beppo stuff.  I recommend their bruschetta, linguine with clams, and arugula pizza.  the prices are a little stiff, but it's in the SOMA so you should expect that.  Good date spot, just hope there isn't a big party like mine that drinks too much vino.
author: Alex G.

description:
I would say everything about this place is as advertised. Fantastic food and service!  They serve you free yummy bread while you are waiting for the food. I would recommend asking for just half of what they bring you. That way you don't stuff yourself with bread. I made that mistake, but that didn't stop me from polishing off my entree and dessert. 

The Margherita pizza was just amazing!  Highly recommended. Their pistachio gelato is to die for. 

I will be back again!
author: Gopal R.

description: My daughter & I ate in this tiny cute place last night. We had reservations for 7 and they were ready for us, but had some open tables. Place filled up though so we were glad we did. Not touristy at all. Very friendly helpful server. Daughter had oven roasted chicken with rosemary potatoes. Both were excellent. Our server recommended spinach pasta with salmon, kalamatas and pancetta with a white wine sauce. Yummmmm. We had read this was best tiramisu in SF and we concur that it's delicious! Reasonable prices, great service, excellent food and nice ambiance. Definitely recommend!
author: Christie V.

description: Went here on the recommendation of the hotel concierge. Bad choice. I didn't have a reservation so that was the first mark against me. I was by myself - second mark. And I wasn't a regular - third mark. The pasta was overdone. The service was bad and inattentive. Would not recommend this place.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Great food, great service.
The staff recommends good wine with the food so if you go there try getting a recommendation.  It feels like a family run joint and it's very friendly.  The food is as good as the service and they have a good combination of vegetarian and non-vegetarian food.  I've tried multiple dishes on the menu and liked all of them.
author: Rajat S.

description:
Admittedly I am not a big Yelper but on occasion an experience is so unbelievably spectacular that one must stand on the top of a mountain and alert the masses that they are doing themselves an enormous disservice if they have not visited Pazzia.  I have often walked by this place on my way home from a Giants game and wondered why it was so packed full of people.  Another thing that always struck me was that everybody inside looked like they were having an absolute blast!  

After meeting Massimo I now know exactly why people love him and his restaurant.  He provides the type of passion and sincere love of food and family that I have never felt on this side of the Atlantic.  He is an amazingly charismatic and caring man from Florence who has provided our great city with the true feel of one of the greatest dining cities in the world.  You can see his reflection in every aspect of Pazzia and the food is incredible! We had an amazing pizza with Gorgonzola and sausage that was by far the best pizza I have ever had stateside and quite possibly anywhere.  It paired perfectly with free flowing Pinot.  The food and staff is so authentically Italian I felt like I should have left with a stamp on my passport.  

Normally sitting at a table next to my childhood hero Joe Montana would have been the highlight of any dining experience but I can honestly say that Massimo, his food and his amazing staff overshadowed seeing my man Joe Cool.  The night ended with an Italian style goodbye hug from the entire staff that truly made me feel like we were leaving dinner with family.  I certainly plan on returning in the very near future and you should too!!
author: Adam G.

description:
Love this place!  Cute neighborhood Italian restaurant. The food is deeelish (pizza, pasta - you can't go wrong). The authentic Italian owner and the staff are super friendly. I saw the owner help an old grandpa hail a cab and get him safely inside the vehicle after dinner once. 

There's not a ton of tables though, so make sure to make a reservation in advance!
author: Christine C.

description:
I've loved dining at this spot for years before I moved to the neighborhood - nearly a decade! It's such a bonus now that I can walk to this adorable restaurant. 

It has a friendly, cozy ambiance, and the food is wonderful. I admit that I get the homemade lasagne nearly every time, but everyone I go with loves the food as well.
author: Susan W.

description: Solid Italian option. Little too pricey, but food is rustic and on point.
author: Howe L.

description:
I've always made an effort to come to Pazzia since my brother,  a foody who worked at Vivande,  introduced me to it nearly a decade ago.  He told me the story if the muralist who owned it,  the hand made pasta, the care. 

It was always a highlight that I'd share with both family and friends.   

Today was infuriating.  No balsamico,  scattered staff could be attributed to the business.  But having oredered tortelloni, a favorite of large,  hand folded fresh pasta,  was shocked to be served ravioli.   Thinking maybe I mispoke,  I took a few bites. Shockingly,  the pasta were crunchy,  as though they had been put under the heat lamps.  Flavorless filling and a pink sauce that seemed anything but Italian. 

$50 for two glasses of so-so Pinot Gris and reheated pasta. 

I don't know what I did to deserve such treatment,  but I was pissed.
author: Paul V.

description:
Basically, I could not come up with a reason to give these guys less than five stars. This tiny, simple restaurant really pleased me when I stopped by for lunch with my friends. I ordered the lasagna while my companions chose the bruschetta and the chicken sandwich. I have to say I almost regretted my order when I saw my friend's sandwich arrive! Oh, boy did it look good. 

But then, so did the lasagna. And that regret quickly faded away as soon as I tried my glorious dish. Sooooo good! It was exactly what I imagined a real italian lasagna should be like! Super tasteful, well cooked and accompanied by an amazing sauce. Actually I liked it so much that I kept eating even after my body started telling me "no more food, please". What else could I do?

The prices are reasonable (not too cheap but affordable) and the staff is so nice that you wouldn't believe it. The waiter actually hugged and kissed all three of us goodbye -- seriously! I know what you are thinking: creepy! But hey, if that is not a little piece of Italy in the US, then I don't know what it is!
author: Gabriele J.

description: Exceptional service. Authentic feel 100%. Perfectly Italian food. Ignore the casual outside appearance, the food is delicious and always exceeds expectation.
author: Kimberly N.

description: Love this place!  Have eaten dinner here many times and am now ordering take-out since I live nearby in one of the tall high rise towers.  The pizza is amazing, the calzones are delicous, the pasta dishes are superb.  Can't go wrong with any dish!  Thank you for making such tasty food.  Hope you stay extremely popular.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
MAKE A RESERVATION!! If not, it is really worth the wait. Very small, intimate restaurant with phenomenal food and service. The b*e*s*t pizzai have ever had. Super fresh ingredients, smart combos of toppings. Nightly specials, nice Italian based wine list, super friendly staff, attentive to all needs. The waiters are very helpful when it comes to navigating through the menu and wine selections. I have been there three times and hope to make it a staple. The food range for cost is about 17-25 bucks. Not too much room to stretch out since it is a small space so plan accordingly with the over sized purses and such. If you have a party larger than 2-4, it is imperative to have a reso. 
FANTASTICO!
author: Megan W.

description: Delicious! The pizza and raviolis were amazing! Very authentic and it was so nice how the owner came to our table and made sure we had a great dinner. The tiramisu was a perfect ending...
author: Catherine P.

description:
Girlfriend and I decided to stop in here after doing zero research while meandering around looking for somewhere to eat. We are both very glad we did. The service was fantastic and the people were genuinely nice. 

I had the lasagna and she had the tortelloni. Both were amazing. 

We finished the night with tiramisu. We will be back before heading home!
author: Chris B.

description:
Since I do not drive this time, I decided to hop on BART all the way from Pleasanton and take my exit at Powell Street Station to search for something I have not tried before. Supposedly, I was planning to give Zero Zero a try for the night, but unfortunately, the bar is fully booked and the hostess gives me a not so friendly attitude in which I have to force myself to search for another restaurant while wandering down the street. Having a sudden craving for pastas, my friends and I decided to give Pazzia a try because of its ratings. Once we got our seats, the waiter's attentive greeting makes us feel like we are home. Warm, whimsical, friendly, our waiter certainly possesses the best customer service qualities every customer asks for. 

After browsing through Pazzia's menus, we ordered the Lasagna, Gnocchi with Pomodoro Sauce and Tomatoes, and Spaghetti Vongole. The Lasagna is definitely the best, if not, one of the best Lasagnas I have not eaten in my entire life!!! It is homemade, light, and lively once you get to bite it. The sauce wonderfully compliments the impeccable texture of the pasta and this dish is definitely TO DIE FOR!! The Gnocchi is decently prepared with a Pomodoro sauce in which the flavors of the Tomatoes' juiciness would enhance the flavors of the gnocchi. The Spaghetti Vongole, to my disappointment, is not as tasty as I expected. It seems to be a little bit salty and lacks a certain seafood freshness for my taste buds.

Once we got our check, the waiter once again attentively greets us as if we were old friends. With our stomachs filled with the chef's culinary love and harmony,  Pazzia gives me a memorable experience that incorporates warmth, happiness, and an easygoing dining process in which I have not been experiencing for a while. I would definitely recommend this place for those who loves to have some decent Italian food. Here, I wish Pazzia and its servers a happy new year and hope we would meet again at some point in the near future. Ciao!
author: Eric P.

description: Solid Italian restaurant with great service. We were demanding but they have no prob keeping us happy. We would return. Parking was pretty easy on a weekend night.,
author: Tracy L.

description:
The mushroom pizza was advertised as $7.50 on their menu online (http://www.viewmenu.com/pazzia-restaurant/menu?ref=google), then when I arrived to pick it up they charged me $16, saying that the online menu was 13 years out of date.

The waitress was well aware of this issue, and she did not mention it on the phone. They should take down the online menu, or tell anyone on the phone that prices are inaccurate before accepting their order.
author: Jacob T.

description:
Pazzia is a great little unassuming restaurant tucked away in SOMA - with tasty food, exceptionally good service, and a casual vibe, there's not a whole lot more I can ask for in an Italian restaurant.  We had the spaghetti with clams, the funghi pizza, and tiramisu and fully enjoyed all of them - all the dishes were a good balance of flavor, not overly heavy or rich, and portioned just right.  

All in all three stars for great food, another for excellent and service, and...what's that?  Oh, right...a 5th star for Joe Montana and his family sitting at the table next to us!
author: Rosers M.

description: The pizza was pretty good, but the gnocchi was great.  Incredibly friendly and attentive service as well.
author: Simon L.

description:
Excellent food and wine. We both had veal chops and pasta....both pastas were our request and was accommodated without a problem. The service and servers were all great. We will certainly go back.
.
author: Tom S.

description: The best Italian restaurant I've eaten in years and the best in San Francisco.
author: Chase M.

description: I got back to Pazzia at last.  This time for dinner.  I had to kill 20 minutes because they were full, but then owner Massimo set me up with a nice sidewalk table.  I love salmon, spinach, and kalamatas, so there was no way I could turn away from the spinach tagliarini, salmon, kalamatas, and bits of bacon.  It was masterful, and the service was extraordinary.  Done deal; Pazzia is a regular stop whenever I get to SFO!
author: Ken C.

description: Food was pretty good, simple but well executed. Roasted chicken with rosemary potatos filled me up. If only we were in Italy with more scenic views and music would I fall in love. Service professional
author: Matt A.

description:
This place is amazing! First time visiting SF with my girlfriend we were both craving Italian food and this place popped up on Yelp. Needless to say we were not disappointed. There was a line out the door (during the lunch rush, the weekend before Christmas so that was a given). The guys running the show were awesome, had great recommendations and treated us to some nice wine. Nice authentic Italian food, great service and awesome staff!

Loved this place so much we went back on the last day of our vacation and it was just as good :)
author: Nate Z.

description: One of my favorite spots in San Francisco. All the workers are very friendly and the food is amazing.
author: Chris S.

description:
This place is so fun and the food is so good I'd give 6 stars if I could. 

The staff is hilarious, caring and genuinely so happy to make others happy. 

You can also tell the place is well-managed because they're very polite on the phone and even the kitchen staff jokes around with the front of the house. 

Be warned: lots of Italian-style yelling and having fun, horsing around and genuinely hilarious controlled-chaos. I love this place and am glad I live in walking-distance.
author: Jordan H.

description: We ordered the diavola pizza for takeout & it was pretty good. Nothing standout amazing but it was pretty good value for the $15 price. Sizewise it was smaller than expected but inline for the price.
author: Nicole E.

description: the best pizza, roasted chicken and pasta dishes!!! I love Massimo - he's an old world style consummate host and the wine selection is quite comparable to some of the top Italian restaurants.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Before race day this past weekend, my friends and I came to Pazzia for dinner to stock up on our carbs properly. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, to be frank, and it's a bit small (even when the windows are thrown open given nice weather outside). But it's that coziness, along with the delicious Italian food that's served here, that makes it feel cozy. Our waiter's thick Italian accent certainly didn't hurt either, making us feel like we were getting the real Italian deal. The service was great, with the waiter making friendly banter with us and getting our food out pretty quickly.

Given I didn't want to eat anything too far outside the bounds of plain-ish pasta, I didn't sample as much of the other food as I would have preferred. That said, the burrata is really good here - very creamy, but not overly thick and heavy - in other words, really good buffalo mozzarella. It's served with a good chunk of arugula, which I could take or leave, depending on the mood. I shouldn't forget to mention that it pairs well with the bread served at the table, which is freshly-baked and maintains a bit of that fluff that soaks up the olive oil it gets dipped in. For my main dish, I went with the rigatoni, which was cooked perfectly al dente - not too chewy, but cooked enough not to be tough to the bite. The sausage was delicious (although I wish there was more of it), and the mushrooms rounded out the dish well when paired with the tomato sauce. I had a bite of the spaghetti with clams, which was also very good - and very light; the olive oil and garlic provided plenty of flavoring when paired with the clams.

Pazzia may not seem like much from the outside, but this is a very solid Italian restaurant in the heart of SoMa. I'd love to come back sometime and try some of the other pasta dishes, as well as what looked like a delicious thin-crust pizza. It's not a super-flashy place, but it works well as a casual get-together restaurant for groups of friends.
author: Asuka N.

description: They still haven't fixed their menu prices online which are different than the prices in store... I dislike this. It seems dishonest. But, to be honest, the pizza is pretty good. I really like the gorgonzola (though warning- it is STRONG) and the mushroom pizza. Also, the burrata appetizer with arugula and olive oil is amazing!! With Zero Zero up the street though, its hard to compete.
author: Vinitha R.

description: Friendly small moderately upscale place with good pasta and pizza. I had a wonderful salad with beautiful tomatoes. Staff is super friendly and just the right degree of attentive. It's in a slightly odd spot, in the middle of the block all alone.
author: Lucinda D.

description: We stopped by this place 5 minutes before closing thinking we would be shooed out. Instead, we were very warmly greeted by a distinguished-looking gentlemen and felt like we visiting an old friend. Afterwards, the friendly waiters took our drink order and we felt very relaxed. The food was fantastic and it turns out the distinguished-looking gentleman was actually the owner. He is so friendly!
author: Aaron F.

description:
