Always solid italian and great lunch spot for meetings. They're looking at opening a bar right next door as well which will open up some space for them. The owner is very friendly and accommodating. 

Favorites: 

- The Parpadelle 
- Pizzas (though I prefer light cheese on them, which they happily do) 
- The home made lasagna 
- The meat plate
author: Sareen Capital S.

description: This place has really great Italian food and great people serving it. Call ahead as it is a popular spot!
author: Joe G.

description:
We got a pizza and Seafood fettucini (mushrooms and shrimp). It was a friday night around 7pm, no reservations. Outside seating had no waiting but it was freezing. Everyone seemed to have reservations but we didn't. We asked the owner for a table and he mumbled something in Italian and english to my girlfriend and I and smiled. 15 mins later we were seated. It was pretty packed inside but I see they bought the space next door, so an expansion is probably coming soon (they desperately need it). Food was great! Entire dinner was $34 before tip, but it was a good amount for 2 people, we still took about a third of the pizza home.

We got lucky to get seated fast without reservations, I would probably suggest making one. We did try to a few hours before but it was so busy that no one could pick up the phone.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Cozy little Italian eatery on 3rd with plenty of free street parking after 6pm on a Tuesday night. Complimentary bread with some olive oil for taste was served warm and that's always a big plus with me. My eggplant corkscrew pasta dish was great. With cubed mozzarella cheese melting on top of the hot plate I was loving every savory bite! A friend that I was dining with also finished up every last bite of her clam pasta and mind you I rarely ever see her finish up her food. 

Ambiance is a bit lacking but they make up for it with their service. Upon entering we were greeted with smiling, friendly faces and our waters were constantly being refilled throughout our meal.

Although i didn't order the pizza we saw a few of the other diners order and I'll admit it looked rather good. Well, I guess that just means I have to drop by some other time to taste for myself.
author: Esther A.

description: Really good food and packed on a weeknight. Wouldn't have expected it to be this good given location (first floor of apartment complex). Highly recommended
author: Jameel K.

description: Their fresh pasta is amazing! My all time favorite dish is the fresh Fettuccine dish which is their homemade pasta with prawns & fresh zucchini in a saffron sauce. It's so good that I can only order that dish every time I eat there. I have been here a few times with my coworkers for lunch and we always have a good time.
author: Jen C.

description: Never disappointed...the food is just excellent..we have been there with 2 and just had 13 Friday night..always happy! Pastas and pizzas are great, everything fresh and hot! Massimo and staff made every time a grand experience!
author: Barbara A.

description:
Love this neighborhood gem. Some friends introduced us to this family owned restaurant.

We always find ourselves stumbling in here when we're craving Italian.

Delicious and the friendly smiles and service is impeccable! So is the food!
author: Alex K.

description:
I've been to this place so many times and have never been disappointed. I also always bring people here with me and everyone is always really impressed. The service is impeccable. The food always hits the spot. It's true Italian food.

I usually get the Pollo Arrosto. But would want to try everything on the menu. The Salmon Risotto is incredible (real salmon fillet) and the Pastas and Pizzas are all just great.
author: Ley M.

description:
Love this place! The people who work here and the owners know a lot of the peoples faces and love being around them! Everytime me and my group of friends come here they are truly genuinely happy and  always great with service! Good jokes, smiles, exchanges of stories, and hugs at the end! 

Food is amazing. I love their minestrone soup! I haven't found one single place anywhere in the US and I travel frequently! No one else's soups tops theirs! I love the gnocchi here, the red meat sauce with the pasta, carpaccio, and anything else I can get my hands on here! Can't wait for my husband to meet these people I always talk about him to them! Sooo yay for Pazzia!
author: April W.

description:
Pizza is good. But soft, Neapolitan pizza with a gooey center is even better. And that is exactly as Pazzia can be best described - very gooey, cheesy pizza. After an interesting night prior to my glutton fest at Pazzia, I was eager to eat. Furthermore, I was eager to eat greasy food as my hungover helper. Pizza came to mind when I perused Yelp as the best and closest Italian restaurant.

I am definitely pleased with our choice, because of the walking distance; however I am certain there is prevailing pizza joints in the Bay Area. Once we were seated it was a tad frustrating to notice there was only one server among a plethora of lunch guests. 'Whew, okay,' I thought to myself - 'I can be patient...' That would have been the case if the pizza was that damn good and worth waiting for. It wasn't. Neither was the slow service. The service was friendly and fast enough considering the circumstances, but the excessive grease pooling in the center of my pizza just didn't win me over. Next visit to San Francisco, I am definitely tying it again, but for the more traditional Italian dishes.
author: Frances H.

description:
PAZZIA was my first taste of pizza sin. 

there's been an awful lot of pepperoni (and, of course, significantly more exotic toppings) devoured between now and then, but you never forget your first time. i'd been traveling all day and wrestling with some short people (that would be my kids) and kinda stumbled on the place with a little help from the concierge desk at the hotel. 

by that point in my life i'd already eaten several times my weight in conveyor belt pizza (a staple of my misspent youth) -- some of it pretty good and some from DOMINOS and LITTLE CAESARS. that PAZZIA moment was a proverbial thunderbolt, a transcendent moment of epiphany when the universe opened like a bright, beautiful flower and i glimpsed all that could be good and true and delicious in a pizza. 

the wife raved about (and shared a little) of the BRESAOLA (beef cured in red wine, sliced paper-thin and served with arugula, lemon and extra virgin olive oil) and, on another visit, the CARPACCIO (with capers, lemon and parmigiano cheese). 

i love the PENNETTE AI FUNGHI (pennette pasta with cream sauce and porcini mushrooms). oh, yeah -- and the pizza. i go every time i'm in that neighborhood and suggest you do too.
author: Scott T.

description: Charged $18 for the Lasagna. Ordered it for TAKE OUT.  Gave the Server/Cashier $20 and she had the nerve to ask if I still wanted change. Was not happy with the quality of food and service.
author: Lucky Cat F.

description:
Legit Italian pizza restaurant with outdoor seating, good appetizers, but unfortunately bad pizza.

Like other reviews mentioned, the burrata is very good, highly recommended. 

The pizza though... not so much. I got the Capricciosa. The thin crust was delicious, but the toppings were just so bland. Also incredibly oily. Just not impressive at all.

3.5/5
author: Bubba B.

description: A friend of mine told me about this restaurant since she knows how picky I am being an Italian from New Jersey. I've been living in California for 13 years and this is by far the best place to go for Italian cuisine. The prices are reasonable and definitely worth it. I had the Penne Puttanesca. It was incredible. My friend and I split the Tiramisu. I highly recommend it! The service is friendly and personable. I suggest making a reservation but the restaurant is expanding very soon so it will be able to accommodate more people! Can't wait to go again!
author: Kelly M.

description:
I ate here with a co-worker back in mid-September.  We wanted a good restaurant within walking distance of our hotel and the concierge recommended Pazzia.  We walked over and had dinner.  Generally speaking, the food was good, our experience was good, and we were fortunate to select a good bottle of wine.  I would comment more on what we ate, but frankly, I don't remember exactly what I ate.  It was a pasta dish and it was good.  My buddy also had a pasta dish and he enjoyed it.  

We sat outside on a nice evening.  Perhaps the only thing I would say is that the foot traffic can bother you if you let it.  Its a bit more loud and noisy than eating outside in other parts of town.  The service was a bit slow, but we weren't in a hurry and the waiters were all nice and kept stopping.

I would eat there again.
author: Leo Q.

description:
Solid, authentic Italian food.  Waitstaff is attentive and friendly, checking up on us frequently and refilling our water glasses.  I like the cozy space, but felt like I had to yell for my dinnermate to hear me.  That was probably due to a small birthday celebration going on though--obviously out of the restaurant's control.  Would definitely come back.

Ordered the Funghi E Salsiccia pizza, Papperdelle, and a dry prosecco to share.  I'm picky about my food being oversalted and overseasoned.  Pazzia did not disappoint.  Everything was appropriately seasoned; both dishes were no frills, authentic entrees with fresh, simple ingredients.  The prices were reasonable for the portions you get (pizzas are $12-15ish and pastas $14-19ish).  We had decent appetites, but still walked away with leftovers (which I'm excited to finish).  Thankfully, we got there when there was no wait, but at some point, there were parties that had to wait outside in the cold.  Street parking is fairly easy in the area during dinnertime as well.
author: Dwigt K. S.

description:
Oh em eff gee you need to try this place out.

Our criteria was something like this: good reviews, lots of ratings, walkable distance from our hotel.

So this place fit it all and then some. But when we got there, it was packed full (the restaurant's pretty small, but you're in luck! they're expanding!). I went in to ask how long the wait might be and the nicest waitress in the world came over to tell me that it'd be around 40 minutes. She asked if I wanted to put my name down to wait, and I figured I'd go ask my friends first. We decided to try to find someplace else, but couldn't think of a place, so we backtracked and she put our name down. (She's seriously one of the sweetest ladies I've ever met. :D I don't know her name, but if you ever read this, you're awesome!)

They actually seated us much sooner than we thought they would. It was pretty hot in the restaurant, but I liked the ambiance. 

Since we're big on getting different things so we can split them all and try everything, we ordered the gnocchi, the ravioli, and a pizza (it started with an 'f' but I don't remember what it really said...it was mushroom, basil, and mozzarella? something like that). They were freaking awesome. I was half in starvation mode, so I polished off almost the entire basket of bread (in my defense, the others said they were fine). Olive oil + pepper made it even more awesome.

The food we ordered was absolutely amazing. The ravioli had a nice zing to it and I really liked the meat sauce. I think this is my new favorite Italian restaurant, of all the ones I've ever been to, although the one in Walnut Creek still has a special place in my heart because of its tiramisu. It was pretty filling, and split between the four of us, I think it came to around $15 each.

They apparently have a sister(?) restaurant in Florence, Italy. (I thought that was kinda cool. :O )
author: Farrah F.

description:
Hands down one of the finest meals we have ever had!  The pizza was amazing.  The homemade pastas were outstanding and cooked to perfection.  Flavor was perfect.  The owners are the nicest most friendly people.  If you are looking for authentic Italian in a warm environment, look no further.  THE BEST RESTAURANT IN THE ENTIRE CITY.  

ENJOY!!!

Classy and very accommodating to families too!!
author: Michael M.

description: The best I've ever been to. I feel like I was just in Florence. Pizza the best. Gnocchi incredible and Tiramisu to die for. Don't miss this wonderful family. They make it an unbelievable experience without having to go to Italy.
author: Jackie J.

description: I ate here last night and enjoyed their house salad followed by veal scallopini.  The portions were nice and server was helpful.  I tried the tiramisu which was pretty good.  The waitress was a bit distracted as i had to wait 10 minutes for bill after requesting.  If you want a good meal, i would recommend this restaurant.
author: Barrett G.

description: Excellent pizza and service. The best pizzeria in SF so far. Try diavola with spicy sausages, won't regret :)
author: Nicolai C.

description:
OVERALL:4.1   FOOD:4.5   SERVICE:4   AMBIANCE:4   VALUE:4
Wanted some Italian before hitting up an event @ the YBCA, and this place [or at least one person in this place] was pre-marinated, slow-cooked, infused, battered, and deep-fried in Italian. So OK, the food is pretty damn good (effing greasy pastas, but in that effing delicious kind of way): fresh, semi-crisp pizza napoletana, soft homemade bread, saffron white-wine risotto is to die for...but the REAL reason you'll want to come here is to experience [marvel at] the animated owner [free entertainment!].  I know stereotyping is bad, harmful, for small-minded people, yada*yada*yada...but this guy just oozes Italian-ness!

Ridiculous dark, lush, wavy mane: check
Fancy footwear [i.e., definitely animal-based]: check
Unassuming yet deliberate machismo swagger [you know the one]: check
Well-dressed (2 wardrobe changes, one of which included a fresh pressed mauve, French cuff shirt): check
Olympic-grade Hand Gestures: check, check, check....and check
Deep, golden tan: check
Full vocabulary of rolled Rrrrs & geminated syllables [swoon!]: check

No, but seriously.....I only come here for the food.
author: Amy K.

description: This was close to the hotel we were staying at so we came in for dinner.  So glad we did. This is the best Italian food I have ever had.  I will recommend this place to everyone and will make sure to eat here again next time I am back to San Francisco.
author: Gina M.

description:
This place came highly recommended by the locals, and the hotel concierge so I had high hopes.  It's a cute little place in SOMA and when we came upon it, I thought, it's got to be good because it was packed (albeit a small restaurant) and the owner seemed so nice and greeted us right away while we waited for our 8pm reservation.  I really really really wanted to like this place but I was underwhelmed at best.  The food was mediocre.  My pasta really lacked taste.  I mean, it's always a bad sign when I keep salting it over and over and over.  The presentation was eh.  The service was seriously lacking.  They initially were really nice, but it seems they don't know how to handle a crowd.  We waited over 40 minutes to get our bill, after asking for it about 5 times.  We would ask for our bill - then we would watch the waiter go and socialize with someone else, hugging, laughing with others.  Then we'd watch him stand at the counter doing who knows what. Then we ask again.   And again, we see the same thing, him dilly dallying and doing other things.  Then we ask again.  And again.  It was seriously annoying.  Finally, we got our tab, and he came up with some excuse that the table next to us had an issue with their bill and he was working to solve that and that is why it took him so long to get us our tab.  Um... the only thing was that the party next to us left a while before we finally got our tab.  

Yelpers usually don't steer me wrong, but in this case, I am just going to have to be in the minority here and say this place is just Eh.
author: Lora H.

description: AMAZING. SO WARM, FRIENDLY, really love on you like family. all smiles, and it helps that everyone that works here is easy on the eyes! and i havent even started on the food yet! hubby and i got the cheapest glass of red on the list - it was marvelous! their salad was stupendous with a really earthy taste lent by the beets. the lasagna- TO DIE FOR. hubby's puttanesca was so so good too, droool. he insisted we return here each time we visit the city, which i wholly agree with. thank you thank you pazzia! much love!
author: Jan Y.

description:
Ok, so this was by far the best pizza I have eaten outside of Italy and the South Of France. Being European and half Italian, I know my pizzas well and let me tell you that Pazzia's are a thing of beauty. Don't go there expecting the puffy and greasy American version. The desserts were of the highest quality and taste too. 

The other great thing about Pazzia was the friendliness of the staff. Everybody was absolutely brilliant and smiley all the time, ready to help and making sure you are having a good time. 

It's so inexpensive for the quality you are getting it's unbelievable. 
If you are looking for a real Italian restaurant, with Italian flavours, friendliness and warmth, don't look further. 
We are from LA so we cannot come here often, if we lived in SF, we would be there every week.
author: Ludivine V.

description:
Pizzas run around $14-19 for a personal 9 or 10-inch thin crust. My friends and I ordered the one with mushroom, proschuitto, mozarello, and artichoke (forgot the name of it) but it was definitely a good choice. 

Pasta dishes were around $14-21- I ordered the rigatoni which was just tomato sauce with mushroom and sausage... meh nothing hard to make at home so i'd probably recommend trying something more special. 


Overall, the pizza was decent. Nothing too special but definitely sufficient enough to satisfy a craving. They also offered a good selection of simple pasta dishes if you want the more simple stuff like rigatoni or fusilli with eggplant. Chill spot if you need a quick non-frills italian dinner 

Pros: 
+ i was able to make rsvp for a party of 14 for friday on the same week! (major bonus for last minute get-togethers that you want to reserve a restaurant for to avoid huge lines)
+ service was efficient and nice! waiter always made sure our wine/water/drink cups were full so kudos to that
+ good wine selection

Cons: 
- do not use the yelp menu page for a price estimate since it's WAAAAY off. 
-  decor was bland so don't expect anything fancy. I also didn't like how the restroom was located IN the kitchen area but BYPASS the dirty dishes and cleaning area which may throw your senses off if you haven't received your order yet
- no calamari :(
author: Patricia K.

description:
I really really really wanted to like this place. It's in my neighborhood, it's Italian, it's locally owned, and Yelpers seem to dig it. Unfortunately, my dinner experience on a Saturday night was not a success. Was it the techno music playing coupled with the bright lighting at 8pm? Was it when our main courses came to the table and we were not even half-way through our appetizer? Was it the bottle of red wine that was way too warm? Insert sadface here.

I could honestly overlook all of this if the food was tasty, but, sadly, it fell short. The delicious burrata and prosciutto appetizer was the highlight of the evening without question. However, the main course mushroom pennette I ordered, and the meat tortelloni in mushroom sauce my husband ordered, were just meh. I love all things funghi, but my dish was more pennette and less mushroom. My husband's order appeared to have been sitting at the pass for awhile because of the visible film of coagulated mushroom sauce from the dish cooling before it came to our table (as we were still eating our appetizer as I mentioned earlier). He was also disappointed in the tortelloni's mushroom sauce and compared its lack of flavor to a can of mushroom soup. Yeesh.  

I love simple, rustic, lovingly made Italian food served with the same care that went into its creation. Unfortunately, the ambiance and service made us feel rushed, and the food was memorable for all the wrong reasons. Maybe this evening was an anomaly, but it will be awhile before we go back to give Pazzia another shot.
author: L. H.

description: I was in townn on business and received a recommendation from the hotel where I was staying (Courtyard Marriott) which I typically wouldn't give much credence.  However, I was very impressed with all aspects of this restaurant.  Cozy atmosphere, very friendly waitress And delicious food.  I took the recommendation for an appetizer from the waitress and loved it (don't remember the name....pastry/bread with prosciutto and cheese).  Garlic and rosemary chicken was also yummy.  Would definitely recommend this place for dinner.
author: Steven G.

description: This was easily the best Italian food I've ever eaten. The service was excellent also. I had to be rolled out of this quaint little place, after all the food I stuffed into my face left me in a coma. The handmade pasta, the ridiculous sauces, the excellent sausage, the very authentic tiramisu, all of it was perfect. If you're anywhere near the city and craving Italian food, do yourself a favor and don't go anywhere but here.
author: Ken A.

description: Even though they were not open yet they let us come in, sit and order. The service was excellent the food was satisfying! Great atmosphere for a casual lunch.
author: Jennie B.

description: It's one of those places you'll go when you dont want to wait too long at the other good places - and the food is good and solid here. It's not really located in a charming location, but it's one of the OK priced italian places that are not too touristic, and which is still close to down town/AMC theater, if you're going to the movies after.
author: Marie V.

description: The service was Stellar but the food was meh. Had a pizza and angel hair pasta and it was similar to my first experience, ho hum
author: Tiff W.

description: Fantastic place with solid Italian food. I liked the atmosphere and the food was better than any I had in Italy.
author: Matt B.

description: Very Small, Massimo the owner was very gracious! been in business for 20 years, the concierge highly recommended this restaurant. Walking distance from the hotel. The food was great. Burrata, Sausage mushroom pizza, Bruschetta, Chicken, Mushroom Pasta and Rigatoni special all were excellent. Traditional Italian! Complimentary Sambuca and Lemoncello for dessert.
author: Rick F.

description:
I'm always surprised that this place doesn't have a big line. As far as Italian restaurants in SOMA go, I definitely frequent this one. A few of the waitresses have italian accents, which I am not 100% sure are real, but it works.

The Arugala salad is delicious and my appetizer of choice. I've only tried a few dishes here but every time I go back I have to get the Diavola pizza. The one pizza with meat on the menu!

If you're looking for a decent date spot in the area this is a good option. It's reasonably priced, has tasty food, good selection of wines and the service is great.
author: Brad M.

description:
Loved this place! The food was phenomenal!! The service was just as great! We are from Dallas and here for our first wedding anniversary and ate here to celebrate it!  We found the
Place on Yelp and went without seeing a menu- we just read the reviews and it was all we read about! We are definitely trying to visit again before we leave! Very impressed! A totally classic italian joint!
author: Ciearra H.

description: This restaurant came highly recommended by the concierge at The Marriott Marquis in downtown San Francisco and it did not disappoint. Traditional Italian, moderately priced and simply amazing cuisine! The staff went out if their way to accommodate our party of seven and they exceeded our expectations. I would highly recommend them to anyone in the downtown San Francisco area.
author: Jerome J.

description: I always appreciated eating here but after visiting Florence and Rome I realized that the food at Pazzia is just as authentic as the food served in Italy! Massimo is an amazing restauranteur and I wish the best of success for him and can't wait for the expansion (whenever it happens!). Gracie Massimo!!
author: Hooman M.

description:
I was recently in San Francisco for work and was tasked with arranging a mini-reunion for a group of friends (10 of us).  Obviously, the restaurant is key for a successful reunion - and I don't live in San Francisco so my knowledge was limited.  Based on extensive internet searches, I chose Pazzia and made a reservation two weeks before our dinner. 

With a group that size, I was extremely worried that my reservation would get lost or they would separate us into separate tables.  However, my concerns were alleviated when the manager called the next day to confirm my reservation and assured me that we would be seated together.  When we got to the restaurant - sure enough, we had a single table which ran right down the middle of the restaurant.

We ordered a variety of pizzas, pastas, and desserts and shared everything (family style).  I wish I remembered specific names - but everything was delicious.  The pizza was amazing - an uber thin (almost cracker-like) crust with fabulous cheese and high quality toppings.  One had prosciutto (aka expensive bacon - and everything is better with bacon).  The cheesecake was perfect - not overly sweet. 

Throughout the whole night (and we were there from ~6:30-~9:00), we never felt like we were "taking up a table" or the wait-staff wanted us out of there.  Even when an 11th person showed up late (a spouse who originally couldn't make it), a chair and silverware were immediately located.  Everyone was extremely helpful, and the relaxed ambiance in the restaurant lends itself to a fun - yet high quality - dining experience.  

It was as though I had everyone over to my house - except I didn't have to cook or clean!  Really, what more could I have asked for?  I will definitely be returning to Pazzia on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Andrea A.

description: Delicious food, really wonderful staff.  I had lasagna and my sister had pasta pomodoro and we shared caprese salad.  All good!
author: Ellen H.

description:
My love of Pazzia is officially over. We had a good run but the food has gone from bad to worse to now totally *gasp, sigh, cry* terrible. I always come here when in town and the last three times over a one year period have been really bad. Little fruit flies buzzing around, precooked pasta that's so soggy I'm embarrassed for them, The sauces have less flavor. What is going on here? The crowd has changed, The food is greasy. (And I mean greasy gross like the grease that sits on your pizza when you buy bad pizza. My pasta leftovers leaked in my purse and left grease stains that killed my beautiful bag and the couch. it leaked through the bag and completely saturated the bag, a cushion, and a cardboard box. Yuck! It's like the grease was alive or something.  It got everywhere. I have never seen anything like it. Seriously. It was horrible.)

I'm so sad. I used to eat at the sister restaurant in Florence every day when I lived there and for me Pazzia was a trip right back to Florence. I would make special plans to come here, I have pictures from many wonderful nights here. But I won't be returning ever again. Everything has been compromised and the food (on more than one occasion) had to be sent back. And the service has gone down hill too. Some of the worst I've had in a long time. The waitresses don't even know what's on the menu.

Arrivaderci Pazzia! It was fun while it lasted.  I'm crying as I write this but I can't give you 5 stars anymore. Or 4. Or even 3 for that matter. I paid $70.00 for that last disgusting meal. And I'm out a handbag.
author: Danielle F.

description: We wanted to try this place since we walk by often and it always looks busy. We decided to order it for delivery and have to say we were disappointed. The quantity was on the smaller side (I ordered a meatless pasta dish for almost $20 thinking the portion size would be on the bigger side). My husband's lasagna was also fairly small. Perhaps the dining in experience would be better, but for the quantity and flavor of the food, I would try somewhere else in the neighborhood first before going back.
author: F M.

description: My friend and I were looking for a place to have a good dinner and drinks before a performance at Yerba Buena and I stumbled on Pazzia via Yelp. I called for a reservation (thank goodness) and we got a table at around 530 pm on a Friday night before a Giants game. The place was packed when we finished around 7. And the food was fantastic- the grilled vegetables were very tasty and close to what I had in Dalmatia. The homemade pasta was so good I ate my entire order of linguini even though I had planned to take most home. Ditto for my friend. The menu is not extensive but everything was made with care and delicious. My new go-to place when in the Moscone center area. And it felt like we were in Italy.
author: Linda B.

description:
How did I never know about this place?!?! This may have to be my new regular spot.

As one of of the few good spots open for dinner within walking distance from my place, it automatically gets some major points in my book. We were able to call ahead and get reservations for Saturday night. Showed up and every table was full, happy we did call.

First thing you notice is that the place feels very cozy. Just 2 servers, 1 busser, 1 manager. This could be the most efficient restaurant I've ever been to. They were always there to check up, refill water, more wine, clean tables, etc.

We split the prosciutto pizza and the ravioli. Both were definitely 5 star. 

- The pizza was light, crispy and full of flavor. 
- The ravioli tasted like something from an Italian grandmothers place. The pasta was perfectly al-dente. The meat-sauce was simple, fresh and delicious. Very homemade tasting!

If you're an Italian fan Pazzia is a must try!
author: Colin A.

description: This place is amazing. From outside could seems not as special, but if you try it, you r not gonna forget. Waiters are friendly, the Owner is an wonderful person, and the food.... You should try the taglierini verdi!
author: Alessio N.

description:
Come here for great pasta and pizza at a great price... i had the calzone, pasta, and the tiramisu.. each of which were very delicious.. Ingredients were really fresh and well made. 

I thought for the price it was a pretty good deal and i will definitely come back .
author: James H.

description:
This is one of a few TRUE Italian restaurants, if you wanna know how a pizza taste in Italy, this is the place. Also, the owner is very cool guy, that help us to accommodate us when there were no more tables available, and somehow he managed to get 2 other tables for our group.
I don't know why nobody has mention the CHEESECAKE, it was amazing and i surely put it in my top 5 list of cheesecakes. Tiramisu, is not bad, but not as good as some people mentioned.
author: Gio S.

description:
Found this place off of yelp.  We bought two pizzas here, and 1 tiramisu.

The tiramisu was delicious.  It was a shame we had to split that into four

Their pizzas were actually good.

Funghi e Salsiccia pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and spicy sausage for $9.50

And the Capricciosa pizza with tomato sauce, prosciutto, mushrooms, artichokes, mozzarella, and olives for $10.50

Between the two.. I liked the Funghi e Salsiccia more.  Although both were good.  We walked there from our hotel which was a couple blocks away. 

The walk back was torture.  The pizza smelled so good. MmM.  I'd come back here. Definitely!
author: Emily S.

description:
This restaurant exceeded my expectations. 

I ordered a pasta dish and found it to be quite satisfying. It was close to $20, which I thought was fair for the portion size.

I also ordered a Italian-style grilled vegetable plate which was yummy but a huge rip-off. The portion size was extremely small, especially considering the $14 price tag. Seriously, it should have been $9 or $10, and even then I think they would have been pushing it.
author: Stella L.

description:
I ate lunch here on a weekday. The service was very good, and the owner was clearly attending to lots of details around the restaurant. There were a few groups enjoying long meals together and all seemed relaxed and happy. I ordered a prosciutto and arugula pizza, and something about it was just off -- it was a little too cheesy and the prosciutto was kind of limply laid on top. I like it when salume gets crispy like bacon on pizza; that might just be a matter of taste. But the un-crispy prosciutto was kind of chewy and not very pleasant to eat. It just wasn't a very flavorful pizza for $17. What's more, the music was pretty loud, alternating between some unusual electronica and Italian pop ballads. This might be okay when dining with someone else, but as a solo diner it made it difficult for me to focus on reading my magazine article. It sounds like others have had better experiences with the food, so it's possible I just had an off meal. A slightly better meal and quieter music would have tipped this over into a much nicer experience. That said, the server and owner obviously care about what they're doing.

Edit: I came back here to give it three stars instead of two. After three days of leftovers, the crust was still very delicious. Got to give credit for that.
author: Laura H.

description:
I had passed Pazzia numerous times and always overlooked it. Because of its location, I had always assumed it was a chain or another restaurant with mediocre food charged for a hefty sum. I was pleasantly surprised. Nicely but plainly decorated inside, Pazzia doesn't seem too special inside. 

A group of four, we ordered three pasta dishes and a risotto dish. The consensus was that food was tasty. Pasta prices range from $12 - $16. Their portion size isn't huge, but not too small either. Glasses of wine go for about $10. If you're in the area, craving Italian and don't feel like paying +$35 per person, I would recommend Pazzia. 

TIP: Make reservations. No Opentable option, so call. Pazzia gets crowded on Friday & Saturday nights. Ask for a booth vs. middle tables. Middle tables are esp. no good when it's cold outside. They leave their doors open bc there is outdoor seating. With the weather getting chillier, you want to sit on the insides.
author: Rosa L.

description: Scaloppine was marvelous.  Ravioli was not bad.   Much more subtle flavor than the scaloppine.  All yummy.  Tiramisu was good, although tasted from frozen. Nice wait staff.
author: B Y.

description:
I love Italian food and this place is incredible... The quality of the ingredients is high... The meals I ordered (burrata and prosciutto ) and the gnocchi were incredibly delicious... 
The service was fast. The owner and the waitress were friendly, helpful with me...
I recommend this place for people who like authentic Italian food... My favorite Italian place for the moment and I am pretty sure that it will be my favorite... :)
author: Cristelle M.

description: Wonderful food and customer service. We got the margherita pizza and lasagna and they were scrumptious. The gelato has a smooth texture and the flavor is rich. Will definitely be back!
author: K K.

description: Really solid homestyle Italian food. Good for a casual date night. Must try the sausage and mushroom pizza. Very delicious!
author: Yasi N.

description:
The ambience - small, cozy, and smelled delicious! Just a bit loud, full of great conversations in the air, but hey, isn't that exactly how great Italian meals are experienced? 
The bread basket - amazing!! Crunchy, chunky, fresh. 
The papardelle - true Italian flavor. Not too sweet or too heavy. Just very light and seemed fresh in the sense that the chef put all these wholesome ingredients together, mixed it up a bit then served. However, the problem is many people expect Americanized-italian food, which is also good but not what this place is. This dish was much lighter. 
Chicken with mushroom sauce - hands-down the tastiest simple chicken dish I have ever had. My eyes glittered after the first bite. I would love to know how they cooked the chicken that well. 
The caesar salad - Sadly, forgettable. Only thing that saved it was having the anchovies on it.
author: Cara S.

description:
Heard great things about the lasagna. 

Tried it. It was just OK. I wished there was a bit more MEAT. All I had was a lot of cheese and the dish was more on the liquidy side. I'm more used to the hearty meaty lasagna. However, I appreciated the homemade pasta which I can never say no to. Love Love Love homemade pasta!!! They also have a few other homemade pastas like ravioli, fettuccine and linguine. 

The staff and Massimo (the owner) were really accommodating to our large group. Service was quick and very attentive. 

I think I should have sticked with the crowd's other favorite: 
the thin crust pizzas!
author: Molly T.

description: OMG, YELP inflation is outta control.  Completely mediocre Italian food! Nothing to write home about at all. We had the bruschetta: under salted and super hard bread. The grilled veggies were ok. The beet salad was lame. The fettuccine with clams were terrible. Super oily and not good at all. What is UP with the four stars!?
author: A S.

description:
The "pizza of the day" eludes me - due in one part alcohol and one part to exhaustion - it was expertly made with fresh prosciutto, mushrooms, and mozzarella cheese. The crust was thin and crispy, even cracker-esque. It was a very fundamental pizza, but the simplicity forced you to concentrate on the quality individual components of the pizza - in this case, a very good thing.
Read my full review on my blog!  http://joeatsf.wordpress.com/2012/12/16/pazzia/
author: Joseph F.

description:
Fairly empty restaurant, sat us in a shitty spot.

2 groups came after us. 10 mins later they had taken the order of the other group. ignored us. no water, no drinks asked. waitress then went back to the other group to help them. wtf. 

food is probably decent but basically ignored us. as we left they since we were receiving no service they acknowledged us and told us to come back again.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Pazzia was so close to being a 5 star experience. It started out a little rocky for us; we waited quite a bit longer than our reservation time of 8:30PM. We were a party of 6 and when we originally sat down they put us at two tiny tables with two people at the end (they eventually added another table when it was clear it wouldn't work). Needless to say we started out a little cramped. 

Along with that, when we glanced in at the table they were setting for us, we noticed that they hadn't changed the table cloth on one of the tables and there was dark stains down the side (yuck!). 

The food however, more than made up for the crappy start we had. I haven't had a calzone that big or that good since I was in Italy. It was absolutely HUGE. Literally, I couldn't even eat a quarter of it and I was stuffed. I'll be having leftovers for days. The caesar salad probably had one of the best dressings I've ever had and the greens were so crisp. The ambiance here kinda sucks. 

Downfalls: the decor is boring and the techno house music they were playing in the background was weird and out of place. If you can overlook that and the fact that it's a really small space, you will go gaga over their authentic Italian food. Enjoy!
author: Julia N.

description:
I recently visited Pazzia with some friends, and I really can't recommend it in good conscience at all.

The front staff are all Italians and quite friendly and attentive. I can recommend them, they really did a nice job and deserve better to work with. The three Latino fellows in the kitchen were working hard too (the restroom is through the kitchen) and listening to banda. 

The space is nice, and the crowd is dressy for the area. If you are looking for a spendy supper before going to a show or event, it's not a bad choice... but:

Unfortunately, there's a big disconnect between the charming staff and the ineffective product. Our group had calzones and pizze, and all was mediocre at best. The salads looked nice but are for one person only, not really suitable for a group or even a couple to share one.

But the price list is the worst part. My very ungood gorgonzola pizza was $15 or so, and was probably worth about 6 euro (current rate $1.11-1). Wine prices are on par with the rest of SF's overpriced sommeliers. You can eat much, much better Italian food elsewhere for much, much less. Managgia, invece si puo` risparmiare dei soldi e viaggiare in Italia!
author: Spaulding A.

description:
We ordered two entrees, two glasses of wine and tiramisu.
Verdict: the best tiramisu we have ever had!!! 
Entrees: we ordered/customized for vegetarian/chicken fare...pizza and pasta... underwhelming at the best.not worth the 90 bucks (18% tip) we paid for the entire experience. 90 is appropriate for a swanky place, this was pretty ordinary (food and ambience) except for the tiramisu which was heavenly.
author: Nidhi V.

description: I was in town for only one night and my hotel concierge suggested this place - it was delicious. The decor isn't fancy. It's on open room with small candle lit tables. But I think that's part of the charm. The salad, pizza, and house wine all hit the spot. Do yourself a favor and visit Pazzia.
author: Patrick R.

description: The worst terreble service i ever experience in my life, after a long beutiful day in san francisco my teen agers decide to try this oulet soon as i walk to the pizza place the main manager told us that all the tables were recerve and we decide to seat outside onother server came and told us that we should seat inside and we said that they told us that the tables were recerve ,, so i felt unwanted in this oulet by this manager this manager is in the wrong business so i cancel my order and i left somewhere alse my money dosent decerve to be in this oulet so  the place where not busy
author: A C.

description:
I work pretty close to this place and have passed it going to the Thai place next door several times. Today I felt adventurous and in need of comfort food and my coworker obliged. 

We ordered the bruschetta appetizer and it was good, not great. However, the lunch entrees were both great. He ordered the baked lasagna and enjoyed it. I ordered the spinach and cheese ravioli which they graciously made for me with vodka sauce instead of a meat sauce. It was wonderful, I cleaned my plate, which I never do.

On top of it all, the service was warm and attentive. I was pleasantly surprised.

They will see me again.
author: Nicol B.

description:
I was so excited to try Pazzia based on all of the reviews. Now I'm just bummed about the disappointing experience. Almost made me think I was in the wrong place.

It was packed - which I took to be a good sign. They seated us at our table for 3. After a long wait, we finally had to ask for menus.

We ordered a salad (they gave us the wrong one and we ate it anyway)
2 pizzas-both just ok(and they left a topping off)

The food  took forever to arrive.Mis meal -we had to duck while they lifted a table over our heads to make room for additional seating.

What I hoped would be a great local find turned out to be a 2.5 hour disappointment.
author: Tiffany D.

description: What a great place, the owner met me at the door to greet me. The places is small and quaint, the staff is very attentive and the food is excellent. Would most certainly go again.
author: James R.

description: 1hr to order and get food is too long, especially during lunch hour. And fares were quite average for the price.
author: Ruben K.

description:
Busy Italian restaurant in SOMA - a little pricey, but the quality of food is on point. 

Ambiance: restaurant is a bit cramped - saw that they are expanding the space, but very clean and unpretentious. 

Salmon: moist, simple, great sear. Entrees come with broccoli and roast potatoes -both well seasoned and hearty. Portion size was just right. (~$25)

Pizza: typical Neapolitan style - thin, a tad soggy, but very gooey and with great flavor. Ingredients were fresh. 

Gnocchi: appeared tasty, with homemade mozzarella (so good!)

Service: nice, but servers are very busy.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Wow. Such authentic Italian food. I'm off gluten and all grains, yet I couldn't help but sneak not one, but two pieces of my husband's pizza! The antipasto plates were amazing, all the veggies perfectly grilled, and the meats fresh and delicious. That pizza, with fresh arugula on the top, was just divine. 
My lamb chops were on point. The service was friendly and fun! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in SF!
author: Jennifer S.

description: My favorite Italian spot! Great staff and owner. It's our go to place for a nice dinner date or bring the family.
author: Erin C.

description:
Absolutely remarkable experience! 
Wow. I consider myself a tough critic (peep my 1 to 5 star ratio) but this place deserves a lot of praise!

Made a last minute reservation for two around 9:30pm (kitchen closes at 10:30). We walked over and were seated right away. The ambiance was warm and cozy. 

Food was fresh, flavorful and filling! I recommend trying the digistivi (?) after meal liqueurs, they are great! 

The waitress was awesome! Super friendly, charged my friend's phone and I lowkey wanna porty with her. 

My water glass was always full and the bread basket was always full of warm, soft slices.
author: Lydia L.

description:
This place is ok, probably on a good level among italian restaurants in SF, but still not the best.
Burrata, pizza and tiramisu were all pretty good, although the bread was reheated from some time before (too bad) and prosciutto wasn't fresh as well.
The waitress was very nice with us, +1 for her. I can't say the same for the owner though.
It might have been a 4 star review if it was related only to the food quality, but it's a bit too pricey for serving reheated bread.
author: Giulio G.

description:
Came here last night to grab a bite before meeting so co-workers at Rye. Although there were open tables, the hostess made us stand and wait near the door for 15-20 minutes. She did get us drinks while we waited but the whole situation was strange... 

Our waitress was less-than-friendly and we had to ask her to tell us about the specials. 

The pizza itself was good. Ingredients were fresh (really tasty pepperoni) and I like the crispy crust on the pizza. And one regular pizza will definitely feed two hungry people. 

I just didn't care for the way we were treated by the staff. There was another customer across the room who was also a tad frustrated, as the hostess kept propping the front door open and he kept shutting it. It was entertaining to watch, but probably not for him.
author: Abby S.

description:
The pasta was amazing! I am not normally a pasta fan, because a lot of it tastes "generic" to me. This Seafood pasta dish was a big stand out. Flavor, texture, quality, all top notch.

The pizza was great too. Very thin and flavorful. It was on the pricey side, but it did have an authentic taste/feel to it.

The Salumi platter was fairly basic. Nothing out of the ordinary, but still tasty.
author: Adrian P.

description:
I eat here twice a week or more, because I live on the same block, and because it's such a great restaurant. Massimo, the owner, is Italian (not Italian-American), and it shows in his restaurant's casual savoir-faire when they prepare their homemade Italian dishes using quality ingredients that come together in fantastic ways.

In addition, I like how it's a small restaurant, with an open kitchen. There's almost no lag time between when a dish is finished and when it gets to your table. The pasta comes in steaming, like it's just been taken off the pan, and the lasagna comes with its cheese bubbling.

Try the lasagna. I find it to be exquisitely good. It has a subtlety of flavor that I've never experienced before, and every person who I've taken to the restaurant has commented on how it was some of the best lasagna they've ever had. I also love the homemade tiramisu.

The only issue I have is that there aren't enough meat dishes on the menu, though if you're a cheese-is-okay sort of vegetarian, this is a great place to eat. Also, the daily specials don't actually change that much from day to day (the soup du jour is probably minestrone 90% of the time). But having said this, nearly all of the dishes are amazing.

I'm in the Army Reserves, and if I end up getting sent to Iraq, I will have my last dinner here before Ieave for active duty. 

(Just a bit of disclosure: Having eaten at his restaurant for so long, I've been treated to a fair amount of complimentary tiramisu. Not that I received these gifts in exchange for a good review on Yelp.com, but I thought I'd mention it in the interests of full disclosure.)

UPDATE: I ended up getting sent to Iraq a couple of years ago, and, indeed, I had my last dinner in SF was here with a close friend. At the end, the owner comp'ed me the dinner. I was impressed.
author: Jimmy H.

description: Ottima! I am from Italy... This is the real deal. Cute so small place, friendly Italian staff. So glad I found it!
author: L. L.

description:
Excellent Italian style pizza--some of the best I've had in the bay area.

Their prices are a bit high, so that's the reason for less than five stars.  $6 for a tiny cup of minestrone?

Never tried their pasta dishes, but they looked great; just the same complaint about the small portions and large prices.

You should try to get reservations for night time.  Things didn't seem so crowded when I went for lunch though.
author: Rocco B.

description:
Yum! I can't wait to go back! I wish I could remember the name of the dish I got too...it started with an M and it was basically fresh spinach pasta with big chunks of salmon on top. It was to die for. I hear there pizzas are delicious I can't wait to try one next time.

They have a great wine list and the atmosphere is really cute. It's a pretty small restaurant, but it's very clean and decorated nicely. It's a bit dimly lit so it would be nice for a date.
author: Juliet S.

description: I ate here last night and had the Caesar salad, lasagna, and tiramisu.  The salad was good, but the lasagna was awesome!  I had never had a lasagna with a creamy sauce, but the waiter convinced me to try that rather than one of the pizzas I was also considering.  He did not lead me astray.  Both the manager and waiter were Italian, and made me feel at home!  The tiramisu was very good too!  Service was prompt and attentive, even though the place was very busy!  I will be back!
author: Gerry B.

description:
This place is forgotten about way too often.

If you want to impress anyone in the downtown area with a solid, fairly affordable meal - take them to quaint Pazzia.

From the food quality, to the quaint ambiance, to the rocking prices. Pazzia is what's up.

Though it may not get the most foot traffic in it's location - it's worth the extra block or two.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Such a great place!  Everything was awesome! The owner was so friendly as well as all the waitresses! Food was delicious.  Will be coming back here next visit to San Fran for sure!
author: Jessica D.

description:
Pazzia's properly prepared pizzas positively ...uh.... reviewed? I can't think of any more P-words that work here.

Pazzia has pretty good food, and the service is wonderful. I had their spaghetti vongole (spaghetti with clams in white wine sauce), and it was delicious. We also had the pizza with prosciutto, olives, and artichoke. The pizza wasn't bad; it was more New York-style than Italian, in that it had that foldable thin-crust. The tiramisu was very delicious as well.

Okay so nothing really wow'ed me here, but everything was pretty good. Solid 4-stars!
author: Kazu O.

description:
So disappointingly meh :(

Service was okay.  Server was friendly, and did come by once to refill our water glass.  But -- perhaps beyond her control -- the pizza that she said would be ready "in ten minute... no problem at all!" came 30+ minutes later, causing me to be late for my after-lunch appointment.

Worse, though... my pizza was a very cheesy blob of mostly-tastelessness.  Any sauce that was once there was pretty clearly heated away.  Though the sausage was fine.  I mean, seriously, it's pretty hard to mess up sausage.  Even bad frozen pizza has tasty sausage :).

Yeah, I know, we Americans have been conditioned to like weird, not-really-Italian pizza.  But I've been to (and loved eating pizza in) Italy, and have also been to some wonderfully authentic Italian pizzerias in America and in Europe.  This, sadly, seemed to be neither authentic nor tasty :(

P.S. -- Giving this three stars instead of two because my friends eating with me were slightly less disappointed with their meals.
author: Adam L.

description: I would go back for the margherita pizza in a heartbeat.  The ravioli and gnocchi were good, but nothing spectacular.  There is indoor and outdoor seating. Good wine list.
author: Kruti P.

description:
NOT WHAT IT USED TO BE

I've been frequenting Pazzia for years.  Last night I was severely disappointed in the quality of food which is being offered.  I can ignore many unpleasantries but if the food is amazing, who cares?  The food was NOT amazing.  

Bread was fresh and warm, but things went downhill from there.  The wine was good, but for $11 (for the Cab Franc) the pour was insufficiently tiny!  The glass was minuscule.  Please, buy some nice big wine glasses!  

I ordered lasagna and my husband had veal.  Both dishes initially seemed ok, but mine seemed not fresh, mostly sauce, and it came to the table half-blackened.  I just smothered it in Parmesan and soldiered on.

The veal's sauce had that corn-starchy look to it that looked awful to me.  My husband admitted it was not great.  

I initially thought it was just an 'off' sort of night, but based on other reviews I see, the attention to quality is definitely not happening.  I'm sad to say I won't be going back.
author: Kat D.

description: A small place; it's much easier to get a table with a reservation. Great spot for a weekday dinner after work, or before catching a movie. Good pizza and a helpful staff. The tiramisu is an A+.
author: Andrew H.

description: Great food!  I had the tortellini with  a mushroom cream sauce.. So yummy! I will definitely go back!
author: Alicia A.

description:
Small family owned traditional Italian restaurant well worth the try.

I wouldn't recommend coming here with a group larger than 4 but its a perfect spot if you're looking for a good meal and good service.

The thin crust pizzas here are the incredible. Share one as an appetizer or order me as your entree.
author: Tavis S.

description: True to form, lovely dishes.  If you like the place, as the menu says,  visit their other location in Florence!  Our servers were lovely and did an excellent job as well.  The italian being spoken at neighboring tables was a testament to Pazzia's quality and authenticity.
author: alex c.

description:
First real time in SF.. was walking down 3rd street from the Cal train.. got hungry so went to the first place open. From the outside, it looks like a quaint italian place with fresh yellow tulips on each table. What a poser.

My friend and I started with the Carpaccio appetizer- thin slice of raw beef with capers, and cheese.. and then shared the Capricciosa pizza- mushrooms, artichokes, mozzarella, olives. The one good thing about this place: the CHEESE. The cheese from the appetizer and the pizza were both pretty darn good. but everything else brought it all down. The pizza crust was soggy. Service was unremarkable. Maybe this place used to be good. Or maybe it just has its good and bad days. But I was not impressed.
author: g k.

description:
Small Italian place near work.  We came with a relatively large party (7 people), and the service was pretty good.  Their bread was delicious.

The food itself was pretty good, but nothing outrageously special.  I'd come here again if I was craving Italian.  The homemade pasta I had was very good, but the mushroom cream sauce was heavier than I was hoping for.
author: Ian C.

description: I was referred here from a friend of my brother. Took a bit to find the restaurant, but we were glad we persisted. Small intimate place. Very attentive service. My wife had a salad and the angel hair pasta with shrimp. My dish was the chicken in the white wine sauce. We both very much enjoyed each dish. We are also planning a trip to Italy in June, so they were very helpful in pointing out different things that we may enjoy when we are visiting Florence. All in all, a nice luch. Would definately return.
author: Steve S.

description: I've been here several times and will gladly come back. I love the dynamics of Italian waiters buzzing around, hugging, joking and making sure you're paired your wine well with the meal. I mostly had pasta, some appetizers and tiramisu, it was delicious. The line here is usually about an hour, so either reserve a few days ahead or come prepared.
author: Marina R.

description:
Loved the pizza at Pazzia. The white pizza and margherita pizza were my favorites. The gnocchi was just okay. 

Good service overall but waitress gave us inaccurate ideas of the portion size. The pizzas were much larger than she explained which caused us to over order.
author: Reem A.

description:
I was here with 15 people for a dinner event over the weekend.  We had pizza, bruschetta with heirloom tomatoes, salmon with pasta, lasagna, and various salads.  I had the beet salad and thought it tasted too strongly of olive oil.  It was advertised as having a vinaigrette dressing but my salad had no acidic overtones but had only a flat olive oil taste.  I am not fond of shredded lettuce which is what my beets were floating in.  The best part of my salad was the goat cheese.  The 9.95 price was reasonable but I just didn't enjoy the salad.

I sampled the heirloom tomato bruschetta and the tomato topping was very fresh and this was perhaps the highlight of the meal.  I also sampled the pasta with salmon and bacon and thought the pasta was overcooked and the dish overly salty.  In fact, I heard similar complaints from other patrons that their dishes were too salty/greasy.  One guest waited more than fifteen minutes for her glass to be refilled with water.  She also complained that she was forced to order an entree though management previously said that there were no minimum orders.

The ambiance is nice here.  If you want to eat pizza in a room with lighted candles and white tablecloth then Pazzia is your place.  I regret not trying their pizza as it seems to be the most raved about food on Yelp.   I would come back but only to try the pizza and definitely not over the weekend as it is is a small venue and overcrowded at these times.
author: Lorissa W.

description:
I went here for lunch with my co-workers. I was very impressed by the freshness of the food. Each of the foods I tried (pizza, bruschetta, gnocchi, and bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar) was a hit for me. 

Their pizza isn't my favorite, but it was done well and had great flavors. Definitely try it if you like thin crust pizzas.

The bread was quite tasty, but a little doughy in the center. That said, I'm don't eat italian foods regularly, so I'm not sure if that's normal - it was a bit of an odd texture for me though.

The gnocchi was fantastic. Served with wedges of mozzarella on top, it's definitely the best gnocchi I had.

My favorite item, however, was the bruschetta. Perhaps it's odd that this is my favorite, but I was surprised by how wonderful it tasted. It's not like it was a very complex bruschetta compared to others I've seen. As far I as I could tell, it was simply oiled bread that had been toasted, topped with fresh tomatoes, fresh basil, and a little sauce. What made it work was the simplicity and attention to detail - each part of the dish was perfect; the bread was toasted just right and added a crunch to the texture, the basil and tomato (one of my favorite combinations) had the right proportions relative to each other and their freshness was delightful, and finally the sauce added just enough complexity to blend all of the other flavors together. Delicious.
author: David E.

description:
Nice spot for Italian in SOMA. It's the kind of small, non-themed, owner-run place that should be in every neighborhood. We all went for veal/beef/lamb dishes. The veal scallopini was great, the lamp rib racks nicely seasoned, the sauce on the beef fillet a little burned-tasting. The Italian wines were reasonable, heavy on the chiantis, which isn't bad, just saying.

I would go back and try some of their home-made pasta dishes, they all looked great.
author: Bob S.

description:
Was in SF during GDC with friends and were looking for a place to get dinner. Originally chose Zero Zero but they told us the wait would be over an hour so we walked to Pazzia instead.

Our group was 14 people and Pazzia was packed but the owner was super nice and told us he'd be happy to seat us in ~40 minutes. Not much room outside on the sidewalk to wait but we didn't have to wait very long. The waiters and staff quickly put together a couple tables and got everything ready.

The pizza here is only topped by the pizza in Italy - that's how good it gets. It's true the pasta sizes are a bit small for 'American' portions but they serve fresh bread when you sit down so you can fill up a bit on that, or just order a pizza since they're just the right portion for one (or can split a pizza and get something else too).

Waiters/staff are super friendly even though it's so busy. Definitely worth coming again.
author: Tushar R.

description: I'm from out of town, here for work, and decided to walk around in search of food. Noticed this cute little Italian place with outdoor seating and just had to stop.  I just wanted to order something small, so just a Caesar salad.  It was beautifully played as many other dishes I saw come out of the kitchen and it was very good. Aside from kind of a long wait for the check, I thought it was great. Thanks!
author: Sarah C.

description:
oh my word!! i had their seafood pasta dish and omg it was heavenly and i mean heavenly! 
we started out with buffalo mozzarella and caprese and wow it was delicious, almost like Italy!
great prices too
my husband loved his lasagna, Italian style.
yup, glad we went to this place on our first day of a mini break. okay, really MY first day of a mini break lol
author: Diana P.

description: Eight of us from the office shared our informal holiday dinner at Pazzia last night and had a perfect evening.  The wait staff was all over us, in a good way, and truly knew how to make this seem like more than just your standard get-together.  Not one complaint came from our group, and my only regret is that I didn't box up the remaining slices of procciutto pizza, as I'd probably be eating it around now (next day lunch).  The food was well-prepared and served, and our chef was constantly watching over the small service counter for immediate feedback on his cooking, just from watching our faces and listening to any comments.  I've walked by this place over a dozen times, and never stopped in, but will certainly visit from now on.  Either a quick lunch, or a team dinner...it's all good!
author: Rudy P.

description:
I went here twice in 2011 and both times were excellent. THIS is good, italian, food.

The place is small, the size of my living room, so you may need to wait a little bit, but since this is more of a "neighborhood" spot it doesn't have the long lines of Valencia St. or Fillmore St. spots. 

Get the burrata! You will not be disappointed. It is friggin' amazing. Also I've always had pasta dishes there and they've all been good.
author: Melissa N.

description:
I always pass by this adorable place and decided to try it since it always seems to be packed for lunch and dinner. They must be doing something right since they are expanding to the adjacent spaces.

According to the menu, their original restaurant is located in Florence, which gives the restaurant a special charm in my eyes.

I had high hopes for the restaurant, which may have colored my ratings. The food, decor, and service were pretty standard for the price point.

I tried their Scallopine and specialty pizza. I enjoyed both, but honestly, nothing stood out to me.
author: Lily D.

description:
Apparently San Francsico has great Italian food but I never found a place that satisfied me.. that was until I came into Pazzia Restaurant & Pizzeria! We came in here Monday night and became believers!

I had the Pollo Arroso, she had the Lasagna.

My chicken was roasted PERFECTLY. So tender and moist, the skin, flavorful and crispy. The potatoes we soft and fluffy on the inside and baked crispy on the outside. My girlfriends lasagna was cheesy, meaty pasta bliss! Simple dishes but with complex and calculated flavor and aroma!

To me, this is what Italian food should be. Simple and to the point. Traditional yet updated.

I feel this is what my Italian grandmother would have cooked me, if I had an Italian grandmother..

I want an Italian grandmother :'(
author: Aaron V.

description:
A great place for a small group dinner, which is what most tables were last Friday night.  It's small and inviting with lots of chattering and laughing throughout so not the best date spot unless you want to chance the weather and sit on their front patio. 

Great service, very friendly girls, and food was good as well.  Had a variety of pizzas, pastas, and entrees and while nothing out of the ordinary hit me, I still found all the dishes very well done and tasty.  

Most memorable was the 2005 Cabernet Franc.  DELISH. And their tiramisu was lovely.. very light and fluffy.  Lemon cake? definitely could have done without.  Perhaps it was sitting too long in the fridge but it had an odd taste. 

Keep in mind that your reservation is an estimate.  Our table was ready about 20-30 mins after our reserved time.  But perhaps they didn't rush the first party out because they knew mine was straggling in late as well?

5 girls, 5 entrees, 2 desserts, 1 bottle of Cab Franc = $33 with tip.  Fabulous.
author: Beatrice T.

description:
I ordered the Linguine with seafood (shrimp, calamari and clams) and it came out pretty bad. 

The pasta wasn't al dente
The shrimp was tough
The calamari was rubbery
The pasta's red sauce lacked flavor and was not rich. They tried to add flavor by throwing in basil but there was way too much basil as a result

The prices are high, equal to the Italian restaurants in North Beach. But the food here is really Americanized, and arguably of a lower quality. The wait staff is friendly.

If you're sitting there now I recommend trying their pizza because they failed at pasta. if you're deciding to go in or not, I say keep looking.
author: Chris W.

description: Based on my one and only visit. Seems as authentic as it can possibly get (I know Italian food very well). I had a calzone and 2 glasses of wine - superb! Rather small place and gets packed quickly to be warned!
author: George L.

description: The location is random and odd but the food is authentic and delicious. Service is always friendly. Great place for a casual dinner or take out.
author: Mimi T.

description:
On our last night in SF some lovely ladies and I were looking for a not-too-spendy spot to enjoy one another's company. Pazzia was a quick jaunt away and they were able to accomodate us, so it was perfect. 

They've only got two beers available (Moretti and Menabrea) but a good number of wines. We scanned the menu and the non-pizza prices were a little higher than expected. Not astronomical, but given the relative lack of atmosphere and polish I would have expected it to be a bit cheaper. We decided to split some salads and pizza and that was definitely the way to go as our bill was quite reasonable and we got to try a bit of everything. 

The beet salad was very good, but I don't typically meet a bad beet salad. For pizza we got both the margherita and the Diavola. I liked the thin crust and the overall flavor but I found both pizzas to be a lot greasier than I like, especially at a higher-end spot. This was like Pizza Hut greasy. Ew. 

Service was okay but nothing to really speak of, making this all in all a 3star experience. With so many phenomenal spots in SF, I can't see returning, but if I lived here I could understand it being a solid neighborhood go-to.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
First time coming with the family and it was an okay place. The setting of the place was like an ambiance and had an open kitchen. Only downside to seeing an open kitchen is catching the workers performing bad work ethics (ie on the phone then handling the food without washing his/her hands).  So it was interesting to see the cooks "cook". The wait staff were pretty friendly even the busboy was helping out refilling our waters. 

Onto the food now, I had order the Medici and Fettucini and it was pretty good. The presentation of the Medici was pleasing to the eye. The Fettucini was a little to peppery for my taste buds but overall it was pretty good. 

My sister had order the pizza likes the thin crust but you would have to like Italian pizza to begin with. My dad had order the Linguini and Carpaccio. Overall he enjoyed it, the seafood wasn't overlooked or undercooked. Mom had ordered Veal Scallopini with Marsala but the sauce was too overpowering for her taste as well as mine. 

For desert we had the Tiramisu and the Torte la Limone. The tiramisu was weak/lacked the right amount of rum when it was baked. The Torte la Limone was refrigerated too long causing the batter to loose it's elasticity and became to dense to eat. Almost like the texture of peanut butter.
author: Maile W.

description: Came here for a last minute lunch with my mom and her friend. We were seated immediately by a genuinely sweet waitress. The pizza was delicious - we split a pizza and salad. The salad was a little bit overdressed but still yummy and crunchy. I'm giving it 4 stars because it was a bit loud. Will definitely go back when I'm in the mood for genuine Italian.
author: Courtney D.

description:
Pizza. It's a food which can have you hankering for it even if you've consumed an entire industrial sized fridge's worth of Pret A Manger food as well as two plane meals - it somehow captures the non-hungry in a way other food cannot. There's always time for pizza, and we three girlies were a happy bunch when we spotted little pizzeria Pazzia right near our hotel.

What a welcome to San Francisco. Kind serving staff, amazing wine, water regularly poured and an outside seat on a late California evening... and the food. Oh the food! Even the complimentary bread was spectacular, then we picked at chargrilled vegetables, burrata and Jen and Row waxed lyrical about their carpaccio beef. We went for pizza mains - mine was a calzone filled with spinach, ricotta and egg, the innards of which resembled a souffle and the outer dough was delightfully light as opposed to heavy and sluggish. Meanwhile the other two ladies had the same thin and crispy pizza with capers, artichoke, mushrooms and ham... blissful. The prices were also overwhelmingly reasonable for San Francisco.

Our server Laura realised we were new in town and actually gave us her number as well as the addresses of some cool stuff that was happening. She was fantastically friendly and we wound up adoring her. We'll probably be back for some takeout during our holiday time here, so well done Pazzia for finding three brand new loyal customers from the other side of the Atlantic!
author: Emma Louise M.

description: Wow! We came across this little gem while on a family vacation. Service was exceptional and the food was delicious. We visited on a Monday and they had a full house. We had caesar salad, pasta (Pappardelle with bolognese), pizza (margherita & prosciutto arugula) and tiramisu for dessert. If we lived locally, this would he a definite go to. We also had a 2.5 year old in tow...this is a nice establishment, but they were open to children which was nice.
author: Pamala N.

description: The team that works at this restaurant is amaaaaaazzzzinnnggg! I think all the workers are European and they definitely give off that flare.  Service was terrific and friendly, and we really enjoyed the owner (I think he was the owner) shaking the hands of patrons and giving them goodbye hugs.  Food quality was good, although I was more bought by the superb service.
author: Vivy C.

description:
I had high hopes for this place because of all the Yelp reviews, but I was a bit disappointed with my experience.  I came here for a birthday dinner, and we had reservations at 8:00.  The place was packed, and we didn't get seated until 20 minutes later.  

Julie F. and I were STARVING, so we went ahead and put in an order for 2 Caesar salads when we sat down( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/SCCLlekS90ycPW00p9_LaA/l ).  A majority of us wanted to get the lasagna, and we were all set to order.  Person #1:  "I'll have the lasagna."  Waitress:  "Sorry, we're out of lasagna."  How do you run out of lasagna????  We all sigh and scramble to find something else.  I changed my order to the Rigatoni Con Salsiccia( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/hbw6GFk1zuXg7o12za4XSQ/l ).  So remember those Caesar salads we ordered first?  Well, we waited and waited and waited, and they didn't come out until everyone else's appetizers came out!!!

The Caesar salad was just ok...I've had better.  There wasn't enough dressing, and the croutons weren't crunchy.  They were more like stale chunks of focaccia bread.  The rigatoni was pretty good, but after a while, it was a bit on the salty side.  My friends said the Spaghetti alle Vongole( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/_rwQSOa2NmwBujp3LMp9iw/l ) and the Tortelloni( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/WJoRg3C2DEwu5ZYac3Gzug/l ) were good.  

Slow service, and just ok food.  Maybe I went on an off night.  Maybe I'll have to give this place another shot.....maybe....
author: Patra I.

description: I'm Italian so I know a thing or two about good Italian food, and this is as good as it gets.  I eat here 3-4 times a month and have never had a bad meal.  The pasta and sauces are home-made and perfectly combined, the pizza crust is delicious and the toppings even better, my work-wife (also Italian) says the gnocchi are as good as her mother's, and, best of all, the owner Massimo wants everyone to have a good time and a great meal.  It's currently in a tiny space, but the expansion should be open in early 2014.
author: Kevin T.

description: A little off the beaten path, however the food here is delicious.  Fresh house made pastas and tasty pizzas, definitely can't go wrong here.
author: Dilly M.

description: I had the 10 inch mushroom and sausage pizza here ($16). The pizza was amazing and large enough that neither my friend (who got the Gorgonzola pizza) nor I could finish, leaving us a snack for later. They served us warm bread and olive oil first, free of charge, and the service was fast and friendly. Would definitely recommend.
author: Kyle J.

description:
Every time I drive by Pazzia's there is a long line outside so there must be something to the food here so last night we finally tried it out.  We didn't have reservations and the place was pretty packed but they sat us within 10 minutes when they told us the wait was probably 30 minutes so that was a nice surprise.  The wait staff was very friendly albeit a little slow since they were running around all over the place.  One of our orders was forgotten so we had to wait a little while but it was fine as we were enjoying the atmosphere.

The food was good here.  We had the beef carpaccio, caprese salad and for our main meals we had pasta and chicken both of which had a nice flavor.  For dessert we had the tiramisu which was delicious.

Overall it was a good meal but I wouldn't say excellent.  The place was crowded but it will be nice when they extend next door soon.
author: Blake B.

description: Great dinner spot. Finish with the affogato for dessert.
author: Josh M.

description:
OVERALL - rating based on overall experience.

FOOD 
- excellent! simple and fast best describes the food. they don't over-complicate any dish. no borrowed interest, just straightforward. 
- pizza's are enjoyable and a nice addition to you meals.
- i particularly liked the tagliatelle pasta.
- some homemade pasta options. i haven't tried yet.
- spaghetti vongole was nothing memorable.

SERVICE 
- fast, friendly, service
- servers actually get to try the entrees so they do have an opinion

AMBIANCE
- lacks any real personality and charm
- the block it resides on is empty and much more business-oriented
- has an outdoor option, again not amazing, but nice option
- quiet with small crowd to help you feel like you're out without dealing with being out.
author: Good U.

description: I loved my chicken dish but my friend who ordered a pizza didn't quite like it. I guess I would definitely go back :)
author: Aravind G.

description:
My wife and I have been enjoying Pazzia and Massimo for 12 years. The food and the friendly inviting service has not changed one bit! First the food. For the longest time we would go for dinner and have the same thing. Bruschetta (marvelous) and pasta with tomatoes. We loved it so much. It was always just right. Sometimes we would end with the Tiramisu. 

Of course after so many years we have tried many more items on the menu. Never have we had less than a wonderful meal. 

Pazzia is a great place to bring friends and have 4 or 6 at the table. The place is alive your friends will enjoy the food and the service. They will think you are a real foodie because you know Pazzia and unassuming wonderful restaurant.
author: FRANK S.

description: I've been working in the neighborhood for almost a year and have never had the opportunity to try this restaurant until recently. After a lunch with several coworkers, I am slightly disappointed. The restaurant was not very well decorated, and the staff seemed to be a little slow for the lunch crowd - not sure who can take almost 2 hours for lunch? Aside from this, the food was quite good, but not good enough to justify the price. While the traiditional Italian cuisine was good, it will likely be my last time visiting this restaurant for lunch. Perhaps dinner is much better.
author: Adam T.

description:
YUM! We came here on a thursday night around 8 pm and the place was packed! There was a 15 minute wait, but it was beyond worth it.

This place is tiny, loud and it's like 95 degrees inside, that is the only reason why I removed one star, their food is amazing!

The food is authentic italian, it reminded me so much of Italy! We shared the Cappricola (?) pizza and the Pennette Al Funghi. 
The pizza had a perfect thin crust and it was delish! Same with the pasta dish, the sauce was so good I almost wanted to lick my plate after I was done.
