description: Amazing pizza and pasta. Delightful staff - charming and charismatic. It is like walking back into Florence. The location is a bit unusual south of the Moscone Center, Metreon and SFMoMA. However, it is worth the trip and street parking. In 15 years I've never had a bad experience.
author: laura p.

description:
I'd probably give it another half star if I could.  The pizza was indeed great, solid caesar salad, good free bread.  I think the total was like $25.  The server (dude) was super unfriendly, but I pretended he was the owner's Italian relative who came over to help out the family and got over it.    

Live nearby, so it was a good mid-week, quick, no frills dinner out.  Didn't try an entree but they looked huge.  The pizza was crunchy and delicious.
author: Michelle K.

description: good pizza, real Italian people (authentic = good, poor communication = bad) , inconsistent service - decent food. I've been here a good many times and sometimes they pay attention to you, and other times they do not. i am going to attribute this to how busy they are. decent Italian food in soma. not too many other options for th price. food is pretty good, daily specials... are.. well... it should just say 'specials' cus they are the same every day... same with 'lunch' menu.. it should just say 'menu' cus its just about the same...  they seem to be getting busier/more popular. just hope it stays a small place with decent food and service. a reliable local place.
author: stephanie w.

description: I LOVE this place.  Been coming here since they opened.  Have many memorable meals here.  The owner and staff are usuallu quite outgoing and friendly and the meal quality is consistantly high.  The pizza is EXACTLY what I had when I was living in Rome.  The first time I ordered it, I couldn't believe it... sooo freakin' good!  That said, I also like the Mussels and linquini if it's offered.
author: doug b.

description: I was staying at The Four Seasons on a business trip for a full week and wanted to leave the stuffiness of the hotel one night for a quiet casual dining experience.  I bumped into a bellman in the elevator and asked him for a recommendation within walking distance of the hotel.  He told me about Pazzia, just a few blocks away, and I was off.  The restaurant is pretty small and was already pretty packed by the time I arrived.  I was seated right away and ordered the hand-made lobster ravioli, which was one of the specials that evening.  OMG, it was deee-lish!!!  I can still taste the savory flavors in my mouth.  I  asked the manager to recommend a great wine pairing and he poured me a glass of Inama Soava Classico.  I had never heard of it before but it was the perfect pairing to my meal.  Light, crisp and slightly fruity, it was nice.  The servers were pretty attentive, considering the place was so packed.  I would definitely go back.
author: Mary P.

description: Nice small place with an authentic feel and taste.  I'd heard this place was famed for their pizzas so I gave the diavola a try and it was tasty.  The pizzas are a large size and the base had the right balance between being too deep and too crispy.  Definitely a nice place to grab lunch.
author: Planet K.

description:
there are a lot of reasons to go to Pazzia...great Lasagna, amazing Veal (I know..don't start whining...it was broken leg goodness), and my personal favorite pizza in the city.  

However the true reason to go to Pazzia is the owner..Massimo.  A true Italian, doing what he loves, bringing the experience of family to a meal.  You will see him hugging and laughing and doing what  a good host does when someone comes to visit, making them feel at home.  

To take a place with little ambiance in a strip mall type setting and make it a home requires someone who truly understands the idea of a "meal"..that is what makes Pazzia so great for me.
author: Stephen L.

description: One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city!  Always great service...always great food.  The place is tiny but they always find a way of squeezing us in on a busy night.
author: carmen m.

description: Great place for a dinner date! Not too quiet not too loud. Not too empty not too crowded. The owner is extremely friendly and takes care of his guests. Above all, the food is great. I haven't found anything on the menu that disappoints so far.
author: Arnab B.

description: I don't like Italian food all that much, but this place is not bad.  The place itself is not very big, but it's clean, and the atmosphere is good.  Pizza is ok, but the mussels and pasta are delicious. The dessert is the best part.  I ordered a tiramisu, and it just melts in my mouth.  The ice cream with espresso is also very delicious.
author: Wendy C.

description: This is a solid neighborhood Italian restaurant - great food, casual atmosphere, reasonable prices and friendly staff. This is definately a place I like to return again and again.
author: Marybeth T.

description: truly tastes like Italy (I used to live in Rome). The food is delicious, a little heavy (but sometimes that hits the spot). Many come for the pizzas, which are pretty good, but I usually order off the regular menu. Casual, unpretentious trattoria atmosphere. Only drawback is that is quite noisy and crowded.
author: Bambooo S.

description: I have been coming here forever, I think since it opened, around '91?  It offers something special, and that is why it lasted so long and in such a location.  That something special is the food, truly authentic.  The pizza is Italian style, i.e., like in Italy!  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere casual.  I think of it as my secret, but it is always packed.
author: Sammy O.

description: if massimo, the florentine owner, doesn't charm the hell out of you, then the authentic italian fare most certainly will. having lived in italy i can tell you that this is as good as it gets in soma. delicious, and inexpensive-- i've rarely spent more than $15 on lunch here. just don't expect to walk in off the street at dinner time; open tables are harder to find than tits on a turtle. the pizzas are molto authentico and the staff is bellisima... bravo!!!
author: Brett W.

description: Everytime I go, I am less impressed.  My first meal here, homemade gnocchi, was excellent.  They have since taken it off the specials menu and I am sad.  I've been back 3 times since then and each dish I've tried has been ehh.. so-so.  The pizza is no bueno, anyone who has tasted really great pizza (i.e. NYers!) should know this. I do really enjoy the people who work here, but the food just hasn't been making it worthwhile. I often feel like "I could've made this at home."
author: Mary Kate B.

description: food is gross.  overpriced.  scene is so not cool at all and ugly people abound.  all around yucky and gross. gross.
author: Pammy S.

description: The food, wine, and service were all excellent!  The restaurant accepts reservations, which is a huge plus for a party of six like ours; however, we lucked out and were seated right away even without a reservation (twenty minutes later that would not have happened).   If you like lasagna, and like me prefer the sauce to be heavy on the cream by all means order the lasagna.  The staff was professional and patient with us while we mulled over our choices and aptly helped us select two excellent red wines for our dinner.  Once served, the staff was quick to refill our glasses of water, soda, etc.. but let us eat our own pace.  My only recommendations for improvement would be portable heaters for outdoors and having vinegar and spices to accompany the olive oil served with the bread.
author: John G.

description: The owner visually undressed my date, ogling her outfit and repeatedly exclaiming her beauty and how she looked repeatedly, interrupting, and rudely over and over throughout my meal.  The food was average at best and his demeanor was disgraceful.  As a Stanford suma cum laude graduate and as a Silicon Valley veteran with over a decade, I was still treated as an early 20-something child, my date was literally undressed with his rudeness, eyes, and attitude.  My date and I were in a serious discussion throughout the night when he repeatedly interrupted and exclaimed repeatedly how fantastic she looked and shook my hand awkwardly each time.  What a terrible place to take a date.  A terrible place to go thinking a cute italian place is what you'll discover.  A terrible experience with poor english equipped clientele.  If you have something between small and medium range in cost, have some education or taste as I do, avoid this place like the plague if you want your date undressed and underserved.  The food isn't mediocre.  The owner still may give you a free shot of limoncello as I've seen him undress women with his eyes.
author: Cayman C.

description: The best thing about the place is the pizza. Appetizer, pizza, desert -- that's it. Skip the rest.
author: M P.

description: it's simply amazing that an exciting and authentic trattoria exist in the concrete jungle they call soma. this is no urban myth though. pazzia is phenomenal. all their dishes i have tried are outstanding, but it's the pizza that separates pazzia from the rest. i believe their margherita is the best thin-crusted pizza in the city. yes, you heard it here. so go ahead and try the margherita with a glass of wine. all your stress, albeit temporarily, will vaporize. throw in the highly personal service of massimo, leticia and the rest of the staff, you realize pazzia is a precious gem... then you come out of the dream, um i mean pazzia, and face the grim world of soma.
author: frisco j.

description: their pastas are very nice and since this place is always crowded i suspect that the rest of their menu is really good too.  i wouldn't go at 6pm with a toddler though...way too distracting.  you need to be able to sit and enjoy your meal italian style.  the pizza looked tasty too.
author: Cyn B.

description: If you're looking for a memorable main course, you may want to look elsewhere. The pizza, however, is fabulous and the tiaramisu is orgasmic. The ambiance is quaint, cozy and intimate. The wait staff were attentive, helpful and very likeable. Overall, it's a great find -- the tiaramisu in and of itself will make your trip there well worth it.
author: Kimi K.

description: the food here is pretty tasty. but the prices are too high for what you get. its located downtown, near a lot of businesses so i bet if the prices were about 30% lower, i (and a host of other folk) would be here at least once a week.
author: thats r.

description: Nestled in the heart of ... well, nowhere close to North Beach/Little Italy... you'll find the small confines of Pazzia situated beside an old out-of-business diner and a dry cleaners.  But once you get past this unlikely facade, you enter into a lovely and friendly environment.  The staff creates a welcoming atmosphere, and makes you feel right at home. This place gots to be good, cause you can hear some of the patrons speaking in the Italian tongue... man, if they like it... then you know you're in the right spot....  Sit down, order yourself a Peroni, and start with one of their pizzas... I'm a sucker for Mahgerita pizza... and they do it well here.  And then from there you have an endless choice of pastas and other hearty entrees.  You can not go wrong.  And what's great about this place is that it's priced incredibly.  You'd think that you'd shell out $30-$40 a person for a meal of this quality (that's before even the alcohol)... but ya' don't....  So good, that I'm gonna celebrate my b-day this weekend with my friends there... Happy Birthday to me!
author: Dale K.

description: We went for dinner without making a reservation. The hostess/waitress was very nice and accommodating. She quickly arranged a table outside for us and we were seated. She came back after only a few minutes and took our orders. What a great start.......The other waitress brought out our food, the linguini vongole we ordered with extra sauce came out dry without any sauce. I picked up a slice of mushroom pepperoni pizza and found the bottom crust pale in color. I took a bite and the pizza tasted doughy and it was completely undercooked. The veal scallopine was fair, and the veal chop was the only dish that was completely eaten clean off the plate. We left $110.00 dollars including a 10% tip, 3/4 of a plate of uneaten clams w/linguini, and 3 & 1/2 of the four slices of undercooked pizza crust. I deducted 10% tip for the rude waitress who brought out our food and was not very helpful in fixing our problems. I expected a little better experience for $25.00 per person.
author: Gene L.

description: For all you ignorant Americans. YOU have NO IDEA how authentic this place is! Growing up in Italy, THIS is the real deal. You don't even REALIZE how lucky you are having such a place in SF. And I have to read your whiny corkfee this, small table that. Bla bla. The food is as authentic as it gets. This is the reason why I would never want to own a restaurant. Having to listen to all you whiney Americans. Makes me sick! 5 stars for this amazing authentic place!
author: Jimmy C.

description: Great thin crust pizza (5 stars)! Pretty good fresh pasta. Don't order the antipasti plate.
author: Emily H.

description: The food here is good, nothing amazing and the price is right but the rest isn't really that great. Been here a few times and the kitchen is basically right next to where you eat and last I was here the dinning room was full of smoke because of this. Also, they need a bit more of a waitstaff, last time I waited a little over 20 minutes just to get my order taken! Overall its an ok place and have gone back but nothing great by any means.
author: Michael P.

description: The food is awesome!  The chicken focaccia is great for lunch.  Every pasta dish is great.  The waitresses are all extremely nice.  There's not a lot of space so make reservations.
author: Johnathan H.

description: Im from NY so I enjoy NY style pizza.  This isnt NY style, its actually italy style pizza.  I love this place.  Its thin crust and great. I love the carpaccio.  When you call for a reservation (it helps if its busy and you can all like 30m before you show up) they say buona sera which I think is great.  The best thing I think is that the servers seem to be to best in italian and not english.
author: Brian S.

description: The bruschetta, pizza, tiramisu, and hot chocolate were all good. Don't order a soda, though, because they bring you a can. We made reservations a day ahead of time and had a party of 7. Small restaurant. My group brought a bottle of champagne and the waitress didn't know what to do. She brought us glasses but said it wasn't allowed normally and charged a $20 corkage fee. Good for small groups/couples, chatting, casual dinner. I would definitely dine here again.
author: Reading W.

description: Enjoyed the food, the lack of pretension, the authenticity of the Italian staff, and the over all experience.  I liked the Cured meat appetizer alot and the pizza was really damn good.
author: chris o.

description: Good pizza.  Good price.  There was quite an excessive amount of cheese on the pizza, but other than that, it was enjoyable.  I will definitely return and try one of their pasta dishes or sandwiches.
author: Sheeva G.

description: The first time I went to this restaurant, I walked what felt like 10 miles across San Francisco in high heels late at night.  My boyfriend and I had gotten a recommendation from a friend thinking it was only a few blocks from where we were, but little did we know what a trek we were in for.  But never has a walk been more worth it.
author: L C.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been to this restaurant several times.  The service and food are always good.  It is torture walking by and not being able to stop in because it always smells so good.  I've had pizza and pasta here and always have left very satisfied.
author: Kathleen L.

description: The best thing about Pazzia is the generous scoop of vanilla gelato. I've been to Pazzia twice, once for lunch and once again for dinner. The roasted chicken and potatoes I ordered for lunch packed a salty, oily flavor wallop, which was great if you're not looking for delicate perfection. I wasn't, so I was satisfied, until I eyed my coworker's gorgonzola pizza. I am enamored of gorgonzola pizza, so I swiftly returned, this time for dinner. My companion's pricey pasta special with crab wasn't at all what he expected, and his report was that it was overpriced and underpromised. I was also a tad disappointed with my pizza. It had either lost a lot of heat in preparation or had never had much to begin with and felt heavy and soggy beneath the gorzongola. The cheese was perhaps the wrong brand choice or too plentiful for the combination, resulting in a sharp taste of stinky cheese without any other flavor balance or nuance to round it out. I'd return to Pazzia for lunch on someone else's dime; otherwise, I'll be holding out for my Italian inspiration. I've had enough excellent 'zola pizzas in Italy not to confuse this for the real thing.
author: Jessica D.

description: you should eat here.  the food is great, the service is great, a little loud but lots of fun.
author: michael k.

description: Buonissimo e molto authentico.  This place is a real gem with autherntic and traditional italian food overseen by the Florentine owner Massimo in a truly italian atmospere with true italian waiters who a freindly and efficient.  50% of my italian friends claim it's the best italian pizza in SF,  the other 50% prefer Tomossos.  I  most recently ate here last week after a visit to the MOMA.  We were able to just walk in and grab a table on a Thurs night without a reservation (I think were lucky because the place was packed).  We shared mussles in a tomato sauce and a nice bottle of Barolo.  For the main course I had the lamb in chianti, rosemary sauce and it was delicious and a big portion 3 good sized chops.  My date had the veal scollopini with porcini mushrooms and capers which was also quite tasty.  For dessert we had tiramisu and cappucinos that were very very good. Mine even had a heart on it out of the milk.   This is a cozy neighborhood place that you can always count on for a good authentic italian meal.
